40857533.review:
This game is a small, charming little point & click game that is a great way to kill a few hours. Some of the puzzles can be a little frustrating, relying less on puzzle solving and skill, and more on just shaking your mouse around on the screen a bunch of times until you complete them. However, these are far and few in between, so it shouldn't be a major annoyance, just a small nitpick. 

A few more of the drawbacks include: the game being too short, (you can finish it in one sitting if you so pleased), and the story isn't really deep and intricate. Though, overlooking these problems is easy as you dive deeper into the beautiful style, and the (sometimes) funny and (for lack of a better word) adorable animations.

One of my favorite things to do in this game seek out, and collect all of the 'animated cards'. The characters are lovable, even without the use of words; the art style and music are beautiful and well executed. I could listen to the Botanicula soundtrack for hours. 

Overall, yes, this is worth the ten dollars. Just don't come in expecting to get a riveting story and a long game.

40344772.review:
Wow. This is not what I expected. It is [i]much[/i] better.
(The trailer is cute and features the actual game screens and models - but it looks like one big race. In truth, this is not a game that makes [i]you[/i] run. All you do is click things and watch what happens.)

More than anything else, this is a happy game. Things turn dicey towards the end, but fear not. This entire experience has made me smile and chuckle and laugh and just generally feel good about weird little insects and heroic seeds.
I started playing, immediately drawn in by the adorable protagonists and the music and sounds (especially the way our guys cheer when they achieve something!) ... and did not stop for hours, until I had almost reached the end.

It's a game of exploration and puzzles and trying random things for fun or progress.
A lot of the puzzles follow intuition, but some feel more unlikely than others. And that's fine: just click and push and pull anything that can be touched.
I eventually had to consult a cheat sheet because I was stuck and wanted to avoid spoiling this for myself with needless frustration. (Something I thought could only be clicked turned out to be pull-able.)

Aside from aiding our heroes on their important quest, the goal here appears to consist in collecting as many creature cards as possible. I missed about nine, or so. I will (mostly) enjoy replaying this sweet and surreal game to grab the rest!

Because, yes, this is definitely on the bizarre side.
Very little in the way of violence, though. I was an easily frightened child but except for the last level none of this would have caused me upset.

Happy, hilarious, strange -  I love Botanicula.

40182023.review:
Botanicula is a wonderous game. 
Not only is it an elegiac fable against the forces of entropy (or just plain ol' good vs evil/life vs death) but it's quirky and cute and utterly gorgeous to experience.
The art work is beautifully rendered with a soft glow to it that makes the game feel almost dreamlike. The seeds you control as well as the myriad strange creatures you encounter all have distinct and unique personalities that burst through their designs. 
The audio is truly delightful, with sharp changes in sound as you enter new areas, and not to mention the amusing noises you will hear upon interacting in various ways.

The gameplay itself is fluid and smooth, the game works very well as a point n click adventure and the animations integrate seamlessly with the movement of the mouse. The puzzles themselves are not particularly difficult but do show some measure of increasing difficulty and near the end require you to recall a fair amount of information from the interconnected areas in order to succesfully solve them. They do also allow for multiple puzzles to be worked upon at once, which gives the player some freedom to solve them in the order they choose, rather than be stuck on one and stop playing in frustration.

Highly, highly recommend this game. Well worth the money despite it's shortness. Whether you purchase to play with a child or just to appease the own child within.

40146856.review:
一份不算很美好的回忆。
高三毕业那年，录取通知书之后，我接到一通电话，是一个女孩子，有点犹豫，带着放下的勇气。
她说其实我从初中开始喜欢你，到现在暗恋你六年，现在，我还是喜欢你，仅仅只是喜欢你。
没有想要给我选择的权力，忍了六年却告诉我这件事情，我很难过。她也很难过。
她说，我是不是很恶心。
我说，没有。
她说，你会不会讨厌我。
我说，不会。
她沉默了一会儿，提了最后一个问题。
你能来我家吗，我想见你。


我们睡在一张床上，枕着两个枕头。
我们说了很多话，从天南讲到海北，从埃及讲到宇宙。
讲到我以为她不会再说下去了的时候。
她说，再没有人会像我这么对你了。
我说，是。

她攥着她的小狗玩偶不知道是对谁说，我会忘了你。
我揪着我的小兔子睡衣大概是在回应她说，好。

我们窝在一张床上玩游戏，玩的就是Botanicula。

第二天清晨，她送我回家。
从此，再无联系。


PS：都是女孩子，她LES，我性取向不明。
        不该问的别问，不该说的别说。
        不然……不然我就吃了你的小饼干！！

40139760.review:
游戏真的是超级超级萌，老阿姨的少女心完全复活！
这是个解密类游戏，里面并没有文字，不需要担心长篇大论像看天书一样在里面寻找答案。而作为一个无文字解密游戏他的难度中等剧情丰富，也不需要什么特别厉害的操作，唯一需要的是脑力。
在里面唯一让我头疼的是容易路痴，其中有一关的场景非常多，我总是记不住路线，而它的每一个场景都必有一个解密物品，就意味着必须跑完全地图，虽然这点让我比较头疼，但完全不影响我对这个游戏的喜爱，画风小清新看着很舒服之余它的音乐也有种眼前一亮的感觉，配上小果实们与树林其他居民的互动真的是蠢萌蠢萌可爱到心里去。
里面有个小缺点是不能F12截图，很多地方超想截图的但却没办法。而且也不能自选章节，如果要全成就那就意味着要再来多几次，当然，你也可以保存载点回头再专门去清成就。

40138518.review:
I can not decide, whichever addition was most infuriating in a point'n'click adventure of Amanita Design's commercially released titles - precise timing of the last puzzle in Samorost 2, endless marathon of tabletop / classic arcade rip-offs of Machinarium or dealing with never-ending chain of fetch quests in Botanicula (which are less of a target and more of a way to check your progress... also, an excuse to run through same screens several times)

Regardless, no matter which game you pick, you can safely bet that the "adventure" part is one thing that's fully delivered at 200% efficiency and, at least, once or twice the game will lead you to some weird places (and Botanicula in terms of "weird places" takes the freаking biscuit)
It is, somehow both, a heart-warming journey, acceptable for all ages, and the closest thing that will make your head spinning dizzy without ingesting some mind-altering substances.
Absolutely recommend this to everyone.

39969632.review:
보타니큘라

2D 포인트 앤 클릭 퍼즐 어드벤쳐 게임.
머시나리움으로 유명한 아마니타 디자인에서 제작한 게임임.
게임 진행 방식은 머시나리움과 비슷하지만, 분위기는 전혀 다름.
그리고 머시나리움에서 있었던 직접적인 퍼즐은 별로 없는 듯.
주로 어드벤처 퍼즐임.

스토리는 식물을 죽이는 거미를 피해 씨앗을 심는 이야기.
조그마난 식물 쪼가리나 벌레(?)들이 주인공이고, 식물들 위나 아래를 돌아다니며 진행함.
머시나리움이 칙칙하고 으슥한 분위기가 났다면 이것은 굉장히 밝고 힐링되는 느낌의 게임임.
항상 그렇지는 않지만, 전체적으로 봤을때는 그럼.
아무튼 난이도가 그리 어렵지 않음.(물론 막히는 곳이 없진 않음.)
말이 없어서 언어의 장벽도 없음.

플레이 타임은 3시간 정도로 짧은 편.
머시나리움과 비교하자면 개인적으로 머시나리움이 더 재밌었던 것 같음.
다만 크게 차이는 안 날 듯함. 이것도 재밌는 게임임.
포인트 앤 클릭 어드벤처를 좋아하는 사람에게 특히 추천함.

진행도: 엔딩 봄.
숨겨진 것 거의 다 모았는데... 완전히 다 안 모으고 엔딩 봄.
도전 과제도 남음.

39790996.review:
Zajímavě zpracovaná adventura odehrávající se na jednom velkém stromě, který napadli pavouci a vysávají z něj jeho život. 
+ Námět a příběh
+ Grafické zpracování
+ Hudba
+ Způsob vyprávění příběhu bez nutnosti textu
- Hra se poměrně brzy změní v pixel hunting. Ovládací prvky nejsou dost často intuitivní a některé věci je potřeba "vyklikat". Tohle považuju sa obrovskou chybu hry, kvůli které jsem hru málem nedohrál. Několikrát se mi stalo, že jsem prostě pro danou činnost chybně klikal o pár pixelů vedle nebo jsem netušil, že se při delším kliknutí stane něco jiného. Tohle bylo hodně dobře vyřešeno v Machinariu, v předchozí hře stejných vývojářů. Tam byl systém miniher, po jejichž splnění se zobrazila nápověda. Tady nic takového není, takže jsem se kvůli špatnému nebo nepřesnému kliknutí na slušnou dobu zasekával.

[7/10]

39696956.review:
Botanicula is a beautiful point-and-click adventure game. You take control of a band of critters that are trying to revitalize their tree home from the Zlo, who is sucking all of the life out of the tree and the other inhabitants on it.

In this adventure, you will be able to meet all sorts of different creatures; some will help you, others are not as friendly, and the rest are just very interesting to watch and see what they do. There's quite a bit you can click on and check out what they do and what they can do for you. Each character in the group you control each will help you along your path one way or another.

The visual is very appealing and nice to look at. The creatures range from near exact models of real-life animals to other made up critters. There are also a few cameo appearances in the art form of Botanicula. The scenery in the game also looks great. The music that was made for the game is creatively put together through the help of many of the creatures in the game. It's very light-hearted and playful music throughout this game.

The point-and-click part of this game is the sole way to navigate the game and can get boring at times (especially when you're first playing the game), but it's mostly about the journey and the puzzles that you'll solve along the way.

If you already own it and you haven't played it, it's definitely worth a try. If you want to buy it, pick this up on sale, it's a nice game to play when you've got time to kill and want to relax.

39679779.review:
Najpierw zagrałem w Machinarium, potem w Samorosty, a na koniec zostawiłem sobie Botaniculę, bo wydawała mi się najmniej najlepsza z tej trójki. Ale się myliłem. Nie można umieścić gier Amanita Design na liście od najlepszej do najmniej najlepszej, bo każda z gier jest inna, każda jest najlepsza w innej kategorii. Machinarium ma najlepszy klimat i fabułę, lekki humor, postacie, lokacje, piękny soundtrack i trudne zagadki. Samorost (3) ma najlepszą grafikę i klimat fantasy (chociaż nie wiem, czy to można nazwać fantasy), również lekki humor, dobrą fabułę i soundtrack. Za to Botanicula ma pojebany humor (co spodobało mnie się w Botaniculi najbardziej), jak i pojebany świat i postacie (ja nie mam pojęcia co twórcy ćpali, ale też tego chcę), zajebisty soundtrack (różniący się od soundtrack'ów z Machinarium czy Samorostu, nie było już na przykład tyle klarnetu) i proste zagadki. I jeszcze coś, co również było w Machinarium czy Samoroście, ale nie tak wyeksponowane i śmieszne, czyli dźwięki. Chyba wszystkie dźwięki były wydobyte z ust, co jest zabawne ([i]ciamk ciamk ciamk ciamk[/i]) i pasuje po prostu idealnie. Ale jakbym miał wymienić największe zalety Botaniculi, to z pewnością byłyby to humor i świat.

Przejście gry zajęło mi 3,5 godziny (mogło być mniej, bo raz utknąłem na pewnym etapie na jakieś 20 minut bym powiedział), co jest dość podobne do długości Samorostu 3, gdzie też były dość proste zagadki. Jak już wspomniałem w innej recenzji, najlepiej kupić Amanita Bundle, bo jak jedna gra od AD się spodoba, to już trzeba wszystkie kupić (w moim przypadku zaczęło się od Machinarium). A jak nie Amanita Bundle, to chociaż jeszcze OST (+ art book), bo jak w innych grach jest po prostu idealny.

39072219.review:
[h1]Botanicula[/h1]

[i]愿这趟旅行能治愈你的心灵~[/i]

Botanicula是我最早添加到库中的游戏之一，小时候在论坛上看到植物精灵(中译)感觉十分惊艳，就悄悄的在粑粑的电脑上下载了一份盗版的，照着攻略断断续续一个月才通关(笑)。时隔多年在steam入正，游戏体验仍不减当年。

---------------------------------------该评测涉及轻度剧透---------------------------------------

Botanicula是一款点击解密游戏，解密难度并不高，非常适合小孩子游玩，大人也能在其中寻找儿时的乐趣~

[h1]+细腻唯美的画风 夸张可爱的造型[/h1]
Botanicula的故事发生在一颗生机盎然的大树上，这里有千奇百怪的动物植物，他们或是飘逸灵动或是笨拙憨厚，你甚至在人类世界的找不到类似的生物与之对应，就像儿时在画册上随意勾画的东西一样，制作者就是将这份天马行空的幻想用更加细腻的笔触绘制出来，呈现在玩家的面前。游戏的大部分角色的造型都十分夸张，大头大身子大眼睛，细腰细腿儿细胳膊，设计师又将比例调整的刚刚好，再加上柔和的配色，一个个可爱又不突兀的造型跃然”纸”上。

[h1]+优秀的原声音乐[/h1]
如果你想入手Botanicula，请将它的原声DLC一起购入。
和Machinarium(机械迷城)、Samorost(银河历险记)一样，Botanicula也没有文字叙述，音乐承担了大部分的场景渲染责任。[spoiler]在树冠坚果社会时的忙碌热闹；在巢穴寻找长者(不许暴力膜=W=)时的空旷神秘；在地底发现巨龟时的悠远苍茫；在落入怪物体内时的阴森可怖[/spoiler]每到一个新场景，总有恰到好处的音乐响起，这种游戏体验，真是太棒啦。

[h1]+丰富的可收集元素[/h1]
游戏一共提供了123个可收集的动植物元素，并以卡牌的样式显示在右上角，也就是说，基本每一幅画面都有一两个可收集的东西，只需要通过点击或是拖动就可以得到卡牌。有些还颇具难度，需要动动脑子才能得到，一般需要两到三个周目就可完成全收集[spoiler]达成全收集后可在通关后得到三个搞笑的动画短片作为奖励。详细攻略请参考[url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=600227815] 中文指南[/url][/spoiler]

[h1]+童话般的故事[/h1]
正义必将战胜邪恶；永不抛弃自己的伙伴；身处逆境时要坚强勇敢；乐于助人；以智取胜；Botanicula的剧情里充满了这样积极向上的理念，这就是它为什么适合小孩子的原因，它像一本立体的童话书，歌颂着人性中最阳光的一面。

[h1]写在最后 评分8/10[/h1]
    也许这是一个 [b]童稚[/b] 的游戏，但它绝对不是一个 [b]低龄[/b] 的游戏；
    也许这是一个 [b]简单[/b] 的游戏，但它绝对不是一个 [b]无脑[/b] 的游戏；
    11¥(折后)的Botanicula是一方小小的净土，静静等待你去冒险。

五位小伙伴拯救树籽的[strike]史诗级[/strike]旅行，没有旅行手册，也没有旁白提示，通过每一次的冒险熟知这个古灵精怪的世界。

Had this sitting in my unplayed list for far too long, and am happy that I finally found time to go through the game. Spent about 5 hours on the game, which seems about right. I explored and clicked on everything, which is what you'll need to do while figuring out puzzles and finding all of the insect thingies.

If you've played and enjoyed Samorost or Machinarium (same designers, same Monty Python-esque animation), you'll definitely love this one as well. It's harder than both, I think ... 3 or 4 times I considered looking at a guide/walkthrough, but just kept clicking and trying different things until I figured them out. Note that there ARE a few dexterity & timing puzzles which can be frustrating. Some anre't too hard, but there are at least 2 where fast clicking and mousing were necessary.

Botanicula is a site to behold. A mixture between point and click and pixelhunt, it doesn't offer much of a challenge, you will find the next puzzle solution eventually. But it has charm. All of it. It is childish fun to explore the organic world and find little creatures eating leaves or buzzing around. It is a great example of non verbal storytelling, and is completely wordfree. You can get lost, yes, and you can get stuck on some multi-screen puzzles, but oh wow is it an adventure! Recommended for all ages, a relaxing and cute experience, phenomenal soundtrack. Bit expensive though...

Это как плюшевые игрушки с успокаивающими шариками, только на мониторе. Выдыхаем, релаксируем.

Если пришло время отдохнуть от драйва и экшуна (не обязательно сугубо игрового, если в жизни треш, тоже будет актуально) Botanicula вполне подойдет. Это чертовски милая, но при этом не слащавая и не приторная игра, где потребуется внимательность и смекалка в разумных количествах. 
О ее качествах можно говорить долго: красиво нарисовано, хорошо озвучено, приятно оформлено, нетривиально придумано... Но это все же простенький формат игр, которые полностью вытягивают благодаря сэттингу. Игра за добро против довольно милого зла.
Не уверена, стоит ли ее проходить залпом, но иметь в библиотеке - маст хэв.

37759196.review:
Собрались как-то Фонарик, Гриб, Маковая Коробочка, Веточка и Перо и отправились в долгое путешествие, чтобы спасти последнее семя от паукообразных черных паразитов. Нет, я не пил и не курил, просто это описание игры от Amanita Design, чешской студии, которая подарила нам серию Samorost и Machinarium.

Добрая, душевная игрушка, без единого слова, которая берет игрока уникальным визуальным рядом, добрейшим сюжетом, необычными персонажами и не сильно сложными головоломками.  Проходится игра за 4 великолепных и ярких часа. Мало, очень мало и хочется добавки!

Рекомендуется как взрослым, в качестве релаксанта, так и детям любых возрастов.

Саундтрек к игре от чешской группы DVA можно смело ставить на полку рядом с саундтреком к Neverhood.

Обязательно к приобретению!

37171940.review: Botanicula é um jogo que se inicia sem grandes pretenções e mistérios. A história parece ser bem simples no início e cada desafio não chega a ser um mistério, porém, à cada passo, cada novo trecho da história você passa a entender que o simplismo do jogo acaba se tornando em algo cativante. Você entra na história, se diverte com os personagens do jogo, que possuem cada um sua habilidade e personalidade, vibra com as conquistas e avanços e teme pelo fim da história. Vale cada minuto jogado, os gráficos são belos, a trilha sonora é envolvente e os desafios te alegram com a interatividade com o jogo. Mais do recomendado é praticamente obrigatória na biblioteca de games, seja por gostar de jogos do gênero, seja para ter um pouco de descanso frente aos jogos mais pesados e desafiadores o useja simplesmente pra animar o dia.

A point and click adventure starring funny characters, and no speech nor text whatsoever, but with a good audio and music track.
The adventure takes place in a fictionary natural-like tree kingdom where the heroes must defeat an evil spider-like creature that's ravaging their tree.

Recommended.

36562915.review:
Man, I think this is my game of 2017. It's so good. It's a nice relaxing point and click adventure, it has lots of little mini-games and is an utter joy from start to finish. That's not to say it's not hard, it's damn challenging at points. But it strikes the perfect balance of being accessable to pretty much everyone but not being an easy game. What's more it's an incredibly pretty game with a good soundtrack and a really decent story. The rewards you get from exploring the levels and clicking on random things and discovering all the little creatures that live in this thriving landscape. You can tell the creator put their heart and soul into this and I look forward to playing it again to get the creatures I missed the first time round. (14, grumble)  I don't often give positive reviews, particularly not ones without a caveat, it's not your huge sprawling action-adventure but if you want a game that is relaxing and you can waste a few hours away on, I highly recommend this. 

Out of the games I've played revently, this is the first one I can say is absolutely worth the price, and I look forward to playing more by these developers.

36561878.review:
Um...WHAT?

I hate to write a bad review for an indie game shop, especially one that produced the brilliant Machinarium.  I also know I'm going against a tide of positive reviews from both users and pro reviewers I respect greatly.  Apparently, I have no heart or soul.

But seriously...what the hell?  This is not a game.  It's a trippy surreal click through random psychodelic cutscenes  with no apparent goal or purpose.  Yes, I know there is (sort of) a bad guy and a goal, but that doesn't really have much to do with any given scene.  Lots of people describe the art as "beautiful" or "charming" but it's all just minimlist soft-focus psychodelia.  Maybe if you were REALLY stoned it would be awesome, but otherwise it's just odd.

And I'm somebody who really appreciates weird and surreal indie games.

The main problems:

1) There's no emotional connection to the characters or environment, like in Machinarium.  If you CARE about what you're clicking on, games like this can be a lot of fun.  But I can't even tell WHAT I'm clicking on most of the time.  (Unless it's just another goddamn leaf or berry.)

2) It's all random "click-on-everything-and-see-what-happens".  If there's no intentionality, there's no puzzle solving, and no game.  Just a lot of clicking on random stuff to get random effects (that sometimes move the "story" forward).

So...no.  Just...no.  I loved Machinarium and I hope they make a sequel, but this game is the polar opposite, and I cannot recommend it.

36543319.review: I play this for the scenery and music, whatever this "game" lacks, it makes up for it a thousand times with the amount of creativity in it. I wonder what substance the creator was on, or in what dreamland, when they came up with all this because it is out-of-this-world creative and beatiful and soothing and the music is just so wonderful it makes you smile and regress back to your child self while being tucked into bed by your mother. Brilliant. 20/10 stars for whoever imagine this and put this together with the music.

36343421.review:
非常可爱的一款游戏，正好趁着打折入了，还是比较划算的

[h1]先说下音乐[/h1]
绝对是很令人惊艳了，好几次都给人一种重新燃起生活希望，眼前豁然开朗的感觉。我觉的一款解密游戏能做的这么赏心悦目，让玩家体会到快乐，感受到美，本身就是一件艺术品了。
[h1]然后是画面[/h1]
绝对没的说，美到忍不住截图放在朋友圈炫耀，然后发现[b]并没有截图的功能[/b]
[h1]接着就是解密[/h1]
一开始会有一点提示，不过很多时候还是会让人摸不着头脑，这个时候就需要你开动脑经，从另一个角度进行思考了。很多操作你都会有一种“还有这种操作”的感觉，但是同时也不会觉得突兀，我想这就是一种童心吧，孩子们往往会做出出其不意的，十分奇妙的行为，正是因为他们有一颗童心，有尚未被固化的思维。所以整个游戏也是充满趣味性的。

整个游戏通关我用了4个小时，因为我比较笨，这游戏对路痴的恶意比较大，还好有地图。中间还因为卡BUG重新游戏了好几次。【BUG啊，虽然不多，不过也是有的】，另外有几个地方参考了b站up主[u]德法小u[/u]的通关视频。[spoiler]我在这里偷偷亲一口应该不会被发现。[/spoiler]

然后呢，记得要[b]存档存档！！[/b]
总的来说，8.5/10，是最近玩的比较好的游戏了。
不过并没有全成就，准备有时间再走一遍，看看都是哪里漏掉的。
17年11月7日

36304632.review:
I just can't continue my life without recommending this game... It's incredibly beautiful: the drawings, the music, the cute sounds your flock of botanical friends make when jumping on branches ^_^ The dreamy, organic world and sometimes almost psychedelic scenery absolutely deserves a spot in my top 3 of most amazing game art. 

Peaceful point and click adventure with challenging puzzles for all ages (well, I'd say 8 and up since some puzzles are pretty tricky). Rainy Sunday afternoon, cup of tea, Botanicula...perfect!

Only downside: the price. Of course I can imagine that it took a ton of work to create this game, and it's not that I think it's not [b]worth[/b] it, but it's really short and has little replay value (only maybe to complete your cards set). I completed it in less than 5 hours and I am not a particularly good or fast gamer, so I would recommend picking it up on sale.

Amanita Design не умеют выпускать плохие игры!

Botanicula очень сильно напоминает стилистику другой серии игр от этой же компании Samorost. Только здесь вместо космоса использовали тему органики.
Как у них это получается? Тонкая комедия сюрреализма и абстракционизма в сочетании с потрясающей озвучкой не отпускает до самого конца. В своё время прошёл ещё в день выхода игры два раза и вот ещё раз приобретя в стиме недавно. 
Не понимаю откуда у этой игры отрицательные отзывы. Кто эти люди?! Понятное дело, что на вкус и цвет, но ты же видишь что покупаешь. Неужели на скринах и трейлере не понятно, что здесь нет реальной физики и эпичных загадок. Тут же видно, что эта игра создавалась для релакса, поиграть в удовольствие. К тому же её можно смело рекомендовать детям, они будут довольны.

36208435.review: A cute point-and-click puzzle game about a group of plant-like friends on a quest to save their home from an invasion of parasitic creatures. Progressing through the game usually relies on the characters finding certain items, which you collect by solving small situational puzzles like picking the right character to solve a problem, beating an NPC at a minigame, or manipulating the environment in some fashion. The biggest challenge in these usually comes from which mechanic to rely on (i.e. clicking on an item vs. clicking [i]near[/i] it vs. click-and-drag), but that doesn’t detract too much from the game. Part of this may stem from the absence of dialogue and text, but I think it was the right stylistic choice to add to the game’s charm. The world, art style, and tone all play off one another well, making it fun just to take your time and click around each screen to see what you might unearth. Recommended for fans of puzzle games and anyone who wants a game that encourages them to slow down and give their mind a light challenge.

36144109.review:
[h1]Genre:[/h1]
Point & Click Indie Puzzler.

[h1]Gameplay:[/h1]
+ You have a party of 5 strange creatures to guide through an even stranger - yet intriguing world, by point & click puzzles that are original, with stunningly beautiful artwork and charm!  Save their world from the evil Botan-vampire (Botanicula) sucking the life-force from life in order to grow its own kind.
+ Beautiful, quirky and strangely attractive music soundtrack & sound effects.
+ Characters and atmosphere have charm.
+ Each party member has it's own puzzle solving ability.
+ A streak of humor runs through the gameplay from start to finish.
+ Built-in save feature.
+ No perma-death, no lives.
+ Basic tutorial, keeping things intriguing that encourages experimentation.
+ No keyboard needed, only mouse.
+ Play-time to completion is about 2 hours, a indie point & click puzzler fits that perfect time amount that your brain would want.
+ Memorable game for the rest of your life.

[h1]Difficulty:[/h1] 
+ Delightful game and that perfect amount of challenge from start to finish.
+ Puzzles are new, fresh, stylistic, easy-to-comfortable challenge, rewarding.
+ Not for the hardcore puzzle gamer, but they'll still want to do a play-through as the game is worth the exp.

[h1]Replayablity:[/h1]
+ 2/5 Rarely
- Once completed, you feel rewarded & content. One of those games that you'll want to play again in a few years to relive the exp.

[h1]Graphics & Artwork:[/h1]
+ High quality indie digital artwork for its 2011 time that will always hold up due to its originality & strangeness.
+ Has a art & bizarre feel to it like the fabulous 1973 animated science fiction film 'Fantastic Planet', but made more towards the innocence of the inner-child.
+ Every section of the game has an original setting and creatures to keep you feeling refreshed & entertained. 

[h1]Overall Rating:[/h1]
★★★★☆ (4/5 Stars) Great Game!!
+ Game is a digital piece of art and a indie masterpiece.
+ Worth $3-$5, and is contently on 75% off sale throughout the year.
+ Leaves you wanting more from the developer!
+ Must-have game for your library!

-------

For additional game reviews please visit: http://steamcommunity.com/id/LordOfDarkFlame/recommended/

36068033.review:
故事是典型的王道故事：有一个黑球生物要吸收生命力要毁掉森林，一粒种子正好掉在了树上，一个栗子碰到了这颗种子，获得了天启，知道把种子送到地下就能长出新的大树，解决危机，所以找来了他的小伙伴-蚊子、竹节虫、香菇、坚果，一行五人踏上了护送种子从树上下地的艰难旅途。途中他们遇到黑球的围追堵截，也遇到了形形色色的生物。他们帮助他人解决问题，也获得了他人的帮助。
风格类似机械迷城，没有一个文字，全靠画面和自己脑补，找到一件件物品，解决一个个谜题。本来这类不明确说要干什么，全靠自己找的解谜游戏我是不喜欢的，但这个游戏因为风格原因，我找的很有意思。
前几关还算简单，后面开始难了。这种自己找的解谜游戏确实不适合我，我没什么耐心，所以不打算通关了。但如果你喜欢这一类游戏，这绝对是个好游戏，别错过。
PS：这游戏本来打算掉完卡牌就删了的，结果7个小时一张卡牌没掉。另一个我想继续玩的游戏，2小时就掉了两张。尼玛，steam也会读心啊。

35634005.review:
Charming point-and-click with beautiful graphics, flawless animation and a brilliant soundtrack. My personal favourite from Amanita Design; I have this on Android too. Unlike their other titles, I could complete this game without referring to a walkthrough. Outstanding game to say the least.

However, the story length is still quite short (~5 hours). Also lacks replayability and the maximum resolution is 1400x900. Full price may be questionable to some.

35520939.review:
This game is very odd. But it is very beautiful. Exquisitely beautiful.

The puzzles themselves are pretty basic click-and-point types. Sometimes it's unclear what you're meant to be doing or where you're meant to go, but honestly, that doesn't matter overly. You will get there eventually.

It's the stuff that happens in-between that's the real journey. 

The game brings quirkiness and thoughtfulness in an unconventional way. You'll be desperately clicking around the screen hoping for something to help you move along, and next thing you know, there's a bunch of lil scribbly doods singing the most beautiful melody you've ever heard. Bizarre, but so beautiful.

The music in this game really is the standout for me. It's atmospheric, it's invigorating and it takes your breath away sometimes. You end up just sitting wherever you are for a bit and listening cause it's super nice. Even if you're stuck for an hour and a half on something, it's completely tolerable. Please play with the sound on. I promise you, it's a beautiful experience.

Botanicula has a good deal of replayability, as there's a lot of cool little achievements you can get. It'd be fun to like spend a day or so 100%ing this, as all achievements only require some particular clicking.

Overall, this game is one of those games that everyone needs to try when they feel like disappearing irl for a few hours and leaving an everyday mindset. It'll make you think, but it'll also make you smile, cause it's just one of those beautiful little indie gems that you come across once in a while (rhyming unintentional - but unapologetic).

Definitely Recommend (Y)

35482305.review:
Amenita Design ekibinin doğa temalı point & click, puzzle oyunu Botanicula. Gerçekten başarılı oyunlar çıkardıkları kesin. Bundan önce Machinarium oyunlarını oynayıp bitirmiştim. Öncelikle çıkardıkları her oyun için şunu söyleyebilirim ki herhangi bir diyalog geçmiyor. Karakterlerin kendine özgü iletişimleri olmasına rağmen senaryo görsellerle gayet iyi anlatılıyor. Oyunde kesinlikle görsel iletişim ön planda. 

Tahmin edileceği üzere oyundaki karakterlerimiz ağaç tohumları. Doğadaki ağaçları yok eden bir parazit tehlikesine karşı kahramanlarımız mücadele ediyor. Karşıma çıkan bulmacalar genel anlamda kolaylıkla geçilebilen türdendi. Ancak bazı bölümlerde bir hayli uğraştım.Beni en çok rahatsız eden tam ekranda oynarken bile oyunun küçük pencerede kalmasıydı. Bunun dışında bir kez bug yüzünden oyunu yeniden başlattım. Am çok sorun olmadı. Machinarium'a göre daha iyi bir oyun beklerdim. Yinede beğendim. Sırada Samarost serisine göz atıcam.

Oyun Puanı: 7/10

35447262.review:
首先，这是一款风格清新的小冒险游戏，画风和模式展现了开发者的大脑洞。适合家庭有小孩子的一起玩，开发小孩子智力和想象力，同时兼具认知和行为能力的提升的特点，更为适合中国的小孩子。
这是一个抛开课本，发挥想象力的童话世界,同时要使用团队协作、逻辑判断、现状解读、解决方案制作这些技巧，需要玩家使用一定的方法来解决遇到的问题。我觉得现在教育不要停留在课本，应该更加多的渗透些新元素和方法，一些有益因素对孩子是潜移默化的，恐怕唯有一些明白人才能认识到。

总之,推荐亲子党,让孩子对世界有一个不乏想象力的认识。

35263414.review: Io non fumo, né sigarette, né altro. E non assumo stupefacenti. Anzi, mi dà fastidio persino bere troppo perché odio non avere il controllo di me stesso. E poi in fondo vivo già in un universo tutto mio, senza aver bisogno di sostanze esterne, di buff. Però mi son sempre chiesto cosa si prova ad essere strafatto. Beh, in verità ho già un mio modo di strafarmi: mi siedo, o mi sdraio, e mi ascolto 20-30-40 minuti o anche più di fruscii dei King Crimson, dei Pink Floyd et similia. Nei momenti migliori mi sparo un intero album degli Area. Oppure, in alternativa, mi gioco a roba come questo Botanicula. Immaginatevi la scena: spaparanzati sul divano con lo sguardo perso, fisso, allucinato, magari con un gatto al proprio fianco compagno di stasi, tapparella semi abbassata, mouse in mano a cliccare su… cose, animate e non, in un mondo arboreo disegnato come un cartone dell’Europa dell’est. Non di quelli moderni, di quelli di una volta. Con un contesto del genere è normale che nel mio cervello avvengano reazioni chimiche non ordinarie, soprattutto nell’emisfero destro. Così ci si predispone per Botanicula, una storia eroica che racconta l’epopea di 5 valorosi in formato mignon: una castagna, un chiodino, un porcino badius, un rametto e quello che sembra essere un Pikmin con una piuma in testa. L’albero su cui vive il loro ecosistema è sotto l’attacco da parte di strani ragni che sembrano i cugini malefici delle fuliggini dei film di Miyazaki. Ma non tutto è perduto: un seme caduto dal cielo rappresenterà il futuro, la speranza, un nuovo inizio. Un po’ come il riso per il poveraccio ucciso dal Fante di Picche in Ken il Guerriero. Il vostro ovvio fine è quello di viaggiare per il grande albero, visitando tutti i suoi ameni e strambi luoghi, per raggiungere il suolo e piantare il seme della speranza. Come il precedente lavoro di Amanita Design, il mai troppo lodato Machinarium, ci troviamo davanti a un punta e clicca dove in quasi tutti i quadri è presente un enigma da risolvere. Ma a differenza di Machinarium, dove ogni sfida aveva una sua logica, seppur fantasiosa, qui spesso ci troveremo davanti a enigmi dai risvolti imprevedibili, improbabili, per non dire fuori di testa. Molte volte vi chiederete “Ma che c***o sto facendo?” cliccando a caso qua e là e sperando che qualcosa si smuova. Il bello di questo gioco è un po’ questo, non è una sfida, è un “Vediamo cosa diamine succederà”. I vari protagonisti non mancheranno di utilizzare le loro peculiarità per superare gli ostacoli che vi si pareranno davanti. Azioni assurde dai risvolti a volte insensati, incorniciate da ambienti e personaggi onirici. E’ un’esperienza audio-visiva, cibo per la mente. Prendetevela comoda mentre giocate a Botanicula, non vi tediate se non arrivate in breve alla soluzione, qui l’importante è godersi le stranezze, il nonsense e l’atmosfera rarefatta, il resto verrà da sé. Il viaggio sarà breve e, come da tradizione Amanita Design, senza nessuna linea di testo: i personaggi comunicano con mugugni e disegnini, tanto basta per capirsi e per farvi capire cosa sta succedendo. Il costo del biglietto è irrisorio, la più grande barriera è solo il vostro lato razionale. Predisponetevi all’irrazionale, e Botanicula si potrà rivelare un bellissimo e bizzarro sogno. Molto bizzarro.

34180039.review:
- Botanicula -

Resumo do jogo: 
O jogo segue a aventura de cinco criaturas botânicas (Mr. Lantern, Mrs. Mushroom, Mr. Poppyhead, Mr. Twig, Mr. Feather) tentando salvar a última semente de um tipo de árvore ancestral que serve de casa para milhares de outras criaturas, pois um tipo de parasita está tentando sugar toda a vida que existe nas árvores (incluindo a arvore em si).

Pontos positivos:

-O visual do jogo é único, muito lindo por sinal ! Muito bem feito e combina completamente com o jogo, não a nada a reclamar, tudo se casa perfeitamente! 

-A trilha sonora e os efeitos sonoros também são incriveis e casam perfeitamente com o visual, as músicas são muito boas e variam como devem para cada situação, quanto aos efeitos sonoros não há nenhum genérico aqui! Todos são únicos e muitos são vocais adaptados de maneira muito consistente! 

-A quantidade de detalhe no mundo do jogo é impressionante ! O mundo é extremamente vivo de maneiras muito variadas a cada cenário até o final do jogo, sempre inovando, sempre apresentando novas coisas.

-Seus puzzles são bem criados e todos são lógicos, mesmo que alguns sejam difíceis, todos tem uma lógica consistente. (estou falando isso pois muitos point'n click fazem puzzles sem muita lógica para suprir uma suposta "dificuldade")

-O toque de humor que existe no jogo é perfeito! 

-A história e os acontecimentos que vão acontecendo no jogo são muito bons e sempre divertidos de passar.

Pontos Neutros
-Por ser um jogo antigo só dá para jogar em uma dimenção de 4:3

-Não tem save automático, então se está acostumado a jogar jogos da atualidade, lembre de salvar! Caso contrário você perderá todo o seu progresso!

Pontos negativos:

-Sem pontos negativos desta vez!

Nota:10\10

Para quem gosta de Point'n Click, é um jogo indispensável!

34130872.review:
I don't have much to say about this gem.

[b]What the game does right.[/b]

It's brimming with charm and personality. Every odd character and strange creature you encounter feels weird and unique. The soundtrack is brilliant, and the voice acting, if you can call it that, is spot-on. The bizarre, almost psychedelic feel of Amanita Design's games is to be found in spades within this title. It may, perhaps somewhat ironically, be one of their spaciest titles yet. 

[b]What the game does wrong.[/b]

Hardly anything. There are a few [i]very[/i] obscure puzzles to be found, and some seem to have entirely random solutions. On a few rare occassions, you might get stuck on something long enough for it to get a bit tedious. 

[b]Conclusion.[/b]

Playing through Botanicula is, in my opinion, a great way to spend an afternoon off. If you just want to kick back and spend a few hours falling in love with a strange and bizarre little world, then this game definitely delivers. I don't know that any game in recent times has made me stop and think; "What on earth?" quite as much as this one has.

Most importantly, it made me happy.

34128028.review: Botanicula jest świetną, przygodową grą Point and Click, przy której naprawdę spędziłem sporo czasu, domyślając się co należy zrobić, oraz rozwiązując różne zagadki logiczne, co sprawiło mi wielką przyjemność.Dodatkowym wyzwaniem dla tych,którzy chcą wymasterować grę jest zbieranie kart kolekcjonerskich z różnymi typami zwierząt...nie przepraszam, nie mogę powiedzieć, że to są zwierzęta,a raczej hybryda zwierząt z roślinami.Naprawdę nie umiem tego określić.Gra jest stosunkowo długa, przez co jej ocena podwyższa się natychmiastowo.Moją oceną będzie 9/10, bo praktycznie nie mam się do czego przyczepić.Niektóre zagadki logiczne mogłyby być łatwiejsze,co zaoszczędziło by mi przynajmniej pół godziny gry.

34071670.review:
I don't want to end up not mentioning Botanicula's art style and music. I found both of these to be excellent; the music above all else. It's not something I would normally sit and listen to, but it's the perfect soundtrack for this game. I love the music and how it's used here.

I played through the first four levels out of the game's entire six-level length, and while I could have played another hour or two and finished, I was not feeling any desire to keep going. The story is that you're trying to save a seed from some shadowy monsters that are pursuing you and sucking the life out of the tree and its inhabitants. The tree is big, compared to your characters, at least, who are a team of things like nuts and a mushroom, etc., who each occasionally use a unique talent to enable progress. Getting to the bottom of the tree to plant a seed seems to be the end goal, and honestly the plot doesn't seem like it's supposed to be the driving force here.

The gameplay mostly involves finding things on the screen to click and occasionally wiggle or pull the mouse around to obtain one of numerous objects you need to continue. I'm no stranger to point-and-click games. The Space Quest and Kings Quest series were some of my favorite games as a kid. However, though there are a few little changes in environment, one of the biggest problems with Botanicula is that all the environments feel at least a bit similar. In most adventure games, the environments tend to be widely varied, and I find it helps keep a game from getting boring. Many games benefit from this.

On the topic of the objects you have to obtain to progress, though...it's generally duplicate copies of the same item for an area. For instance, to complete level one, you need to find several bug-wing thingies. Then to beat level two, you need to find five keys. To beat level three, you need to find three missing children. Then to beat level four, you need to find [i]fourteen[/i] birds in a village on the tree consisting of a dozen or more little similar buildings. This became taxingly repetitious to me, and the puzzles became more and more obscure, with the 12+ buildings making it difficult to figure out if I was done or not with any given home.

I eventually had to resort to a walkthrough and found several solutions which I am certain I never would have figured out on my own, because I believed I was done in those particular buildings, having already obtained birds or seemingly having already completed everything in the buildings that there was to partake in. Navigating the walkthrough was even hell, thanks to how many of these buildings there were to check out. When an adventure game taking a long time to solve part of it while using a walkthrough, there's an issue.

When I saw/read that level 5 was labyrinthine, I called it quits. While the music and visuals are a treat, it's not enough of a treat for me to justify playing through more of this game. The 2 hours I played felt like 5 or more, which is not good. =/

33527559.review:
Botanicula is a very entertaining short click and point game filled with tons of charm. This game kept a smile on my face throughout playing it, even getting a chuckle out of me at some points. The story is wordless and simple. That is appropriate, since a complex story would take away from the charm of the world. The sound effects given to each character combined with fun animation gives the creatures of Bontanicula their own voices and tiny story to tell. The creatures are fun to discover and click on, which the game encourages with a card collecting achievment system. As the game went on, I started to care less about the achievements and more about what cute animation would pop up when I clicked a leaf. 

The puzzles are all based on these magical creatures, appropriatly starting simpler in the beginning and gradually progressing into more difficult tasks. With the fantastical nature of the game, some of the solutions are not always obvious, and took some clicking around the screen to figure out. I had to pull out a walkthrough during one point of the game, but that was after attempting the task multiple times. With a little thinking and lots of clicking, I was able to solve the rest of the puzzles. 

If anyone is looking for a short puzzle game full of charming characters and creatures then Botanicula is a must have. While it's about a 3-4 hour play time, the $10 price tag is deserving due to the obvious time spent fleshing out the world and the creatures. There is a great ammount of polish and love put into this game. Please give it a shot!

ほのぼのとした世界観と謎解き要素がミックスされたゲーム、非常にオススメ

・クリックゲー[spoiler] かと思ったらドラッグアンドドロップもあるけど基本クリックゲー。
トゲ引っ張ってビヨーンって弾くところとか特に時間かかりました。

ただ謎解きゲーなので詰まるとなかなか抜け出せない時があった。

33086856.review:
Botanicula  hat mich echt überrascht. Selten hab ich ein so tolles kleines Point and Click gespielt, das von Charm nur so sprudelt.
Das Spiel an sich ist sehr simpel, man spielt eine Gruppe von ,, Früchte,, (sind das Früchte) eines Baumes. Diese 5 Freunde, versuchen einen Samen am Fuß des Baumes zu pflanzen. Grund dafür iss eine Böse Macht, die das Leben von Pflanzen sowie Tieren aussaugen kann und somit umbringen. Das Spiel gestaltet sich dabei aus einer Mishcung von Rätseln, mal muss man etwas Sammeln, mal ein Rennen mit Käfern führen. Das alles ist wunderschön gestaltet. In den ca. 3-4 std. wird das Spiel nie langweilig und gibt einem Nie das Gefühl verloren zu sein. Die Rätsel sind alle machbar und abwechslungsreich. Das was das Siel aber wirklich großartig macht ist der Grafikstil und die Sounds. Der Stil iss einfach einzigartig und so schön wie kaum ein anderes Point and Klick. azu kommen die tollen Sounds, die so lustig aber auch toll klingen. Selten ahb ich so gelacht (im postiven Sinne ). Man merkt zwar das das Spiel von einer kleinem Entwickler entwickelt wird, aber genau dieser Umgang dmait find ich einfach großartig. Man braucht nicht tausende Euro für hochwertige Sounds aufgeben, wenn man auch so auf eine tolle Weise selber welche Generieren kann. Dazu passen die Soundeffekte auch wunderbar zum Grafikstil und der allgemeinen Stimmung des Spieles.
Das alles zusammen ergibt ein tolles abwechslungsreiches Point and Klick Adventure, das einzigartiger nicht sein kann und sein Geld auf jedenfall Wert ist. Für alle Fans von P&K ein Muss.

32978920.review:
[h1][b]Review: Botanicula[/b][/h1]
Botanicula, ist eine Perle die ich bedauerlicherweise viel zu lange in meiner Bibliothek hab verstauben lassen. Es ist ein etwas anderes Point & Click Spiel, als wie ich es sonst von diesem Genre gewohnt bin. Im Gegensatz zu anderen Point & Click Spielen verzichtet Botanicula (beinahe) gänzlich auf textuelle Inhalte, sprich es gibt nahezu nichts zu lesen und auch die Charaktäre brabbeln in einer süßen und unverständlichen Sprache so vor sich hin. Die Geschichte wird primär durch das zeigen von Bildern und Animationen vermittelt, untermalt mit fröhlich klingender und aufmunternden Musik. Unterstützt wird der Spieler durch richtungsweisende Pfeile entlang der Äste und man wird förmlich animiert dazu überall hingehen zu wollen und alles anzuklicken nur um zu sehen was passiert. Auch die Grafik lässt einen in die Tiefen dieser Mikrowelt eintauchen - die gezeigten Screenshots versprechen nicht zu wenig - und man erkennt die Liebe zum Detail und welches Herzblut in das Spiel gesteckt wurde weil es haufenweise Easter Eggs gibt die, wenn gefunden, durchaus einen zum Lachen bringen können.

Einen kleinen Dämpfer gibt es hinsichtlich der Engine die für die Entwicklung verwendet wurde. Die Einstellungsmöglichkeiten bezüglich der Auflösung sind äußerst beschränkt. Man kann bei den Fenstergrößen nur zwischen 100% und 60% auswählen, wobei 100% jetzt gefühlt einer Auflösung von 1280x720 entpsricht, also kein FullHD. Ein Vollbildmodus existiert zwar aber macht insofern keinen Sinn, weil das Spiel nicht an höhere Auflösungen angepasst wird. Wer also in Vollbild spielen will muss bei aktuellen Monitoren mit schwarzen Balken rund um das Spiel rechnen. Besitzer von 4K Monitoren könnten unter Umständen das Gefühl haben Botanicula wäre eine 3DS XL Portierung. ;-)

Kleiner Tipp, das Menü für die Einstellungen ist am unteren Bildschirmrand und wird nur sichtbar wenn man mit der Maus hinfährt. Speichern wird dringend empfohlen, da es kein Auto-Save gibt.

Persönlich musste ich mindestens 2-3 Mal wirklich lachen und war durchwegs entspannt beim Spielen. Die Rätsel würde ich vom Schwierigkeitsgrad her als leicht bis mittelschwer einstufen.

Wenn euch das Review gefallen hat und hilfreich war, zeigt es mit einem Daumen - danke! :-)

띵! 유후~!

플레이 시간 : 약 3시간

가성비 : 보통

난이도 : 다소 높음 (퍼즐이 뒤로 갈 수록 복잡해지고 길도 복잡하다.)

몰입도 : 다소 높음.

힐링게임이 맞다. 음악을 들으며 나도 같이 진짜 춤을 추게 된다. 흐뭇한 미소를 지으며 게임을 하게 되는 나를 발견하게 된다. 다만, 한 번에 이 게임 엔딩을 보려고 한다면 조금 힘들지도. 복잡한 퍼즐, 복잡한 길은 자칫 화를 불러올 수도 있으니까. 만약 힘들다면 잠깐 쉬고 나중에 다시 플레이하는 것을 권장한다. 나름의 스토리도 있고 분위기도 좋다. 

사운트 트랙까지 샀긴 한데 게임 안에서 듣는 것과 그냥 음악만 듣는 것과는 천지차이다. 나는 사운트 트랙을 사서 듣는 것을 진짜 좋아하지만 이 게임의 사운드 트랙은 사실 다른 걸 하며 듣기엔 애매하다. 그냥 눈 감고 감상하기도 좀 애매하다. 이 사운드 트랙의 진가는 게임 안에서 발휘되니 사운드 트랙을 살 때 조금은 고민해보길 바란다.

32595282.review:
Amanita Design is one of those developers that I love to death, and in their case it's because all of their games are so unrelentingly joyful. From Samorost's kooky cosmic critters to the pleasant rustbuckets of Machinarium, their games exude pure happiness in the form of upbeat gibberish, uncomplicated puzzles, and positive themes no matter how dark individual moments may get. Botanicula is another notch in this merry belt, one that has no trouble juggling goofy vignettes with existential threats.

Once upon a time there was a very nice tree, full of little bugs and sprouts and assorted critters. Some spidery thing showed up and started devouring it all with a sort of creeping darkness, and a small band of the aforementioned critters escape with the tree's last seed. Struggling to stay one step ahead of their monstrous adversary, the critters journey through a colorful arboreal world in search of a new home and a fresh start.

What this actually means is you have five little dudes who roam around as a unit, following your clicks from screen to screen and interacting with the many living things of Botanicula's world. As an adventure game there's very little player input, relatively speaking. There's only left click (and on occasion mouse proximity has an effect) and only on specific points of interest like critters and items. You don't move your team directly, but rather click on arrows pointing to different areas.

These limitations actually serve to benefit the game, especially as the scope of the gameplay expands. Botanicula's world is strange and alien, and most of the puzzles wouldn't work at all if they required more exact input. Instead, you can just click on little creatures to make them fly or yell or burp, and as long as you do it at the right time or in the right order or at all, you can make progress. The scenes your clicks produce are so funny and heartwarming I doubt anyone will have a problem with relinquishing control for them. And then later in the game you'll get to pick specific critters on your team to do things, collect items to use in puzzles, and work through a few more nifty gimmicks.

The story is another strong point building on these basic mechanics, a remarkable feat given that it is told entirely without dialogue. The folks at Amanita have mastered the art of storytelling through action and expression and it does tremendous work here. All of the adorable denizens you meet speak in mumbly Sims-like chatter but get their points across through wild gesticulation and the occasional visual aid. This hands-off approach both heightens the impact of events (good and bad) when they occur, and also keeps the game feeling lighthearted and silly the rest of the time. You're also encouraged to experiment with everything you meet, because interacting with new critters earns you collectible cards that can score you extra scenes at the end of the game.

You'll experience the world of Botanicula through a mix of vector art and photoshopped works, a finely-blended style that gives everything just enough weight to seem real, without losing its fanciful, dreamlike energy. The peppy soundtrack follows suit with all sorts of cutely and folksy tunes to keep you engaged. The artistry on display here is rare and unique, and makes the game feel like a real treasure from its simple beginning to its unexpectedly epic conclusion. Botanicula makes another excellent entry in Amanita Design's lineup, and an unforgettable title for any fan of point-and-click adventures.



Did you enjoy this review? I certainly hope so, and I certainly hope you'll check out more of them at https://goldplatedgames.com/ or on my [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/audish#curation]curation page[/url]!

32530679.review:
Certainly I am not surprised by the glowing reviews for this game on the whole. You can tell a lot of love went into this game. One of the positives people put for this game is that the puzzles are challenging. This is true, and it can be a perk, but it is also where the game struggles the most. Some of the puzzles are mouse-only and require actually doing stuff, which seems both highly at odds with the 'take-your-time' puzzle style of the rest of the game and... not very good. To me this is a very strong game, but ultimately all it takes is one 'bad' puzzle to totally halt progression. And the thing is, any given level can be your 'bad' puzzle, and even if they're not brick walls, the sound effects are so in-your-face that even a temporary slow-down can be very off-putting and jarring.
 
Ultimately I REALLY want to like this game and recommend it, but a few bad puzzles make me unable to do so.

32091108.review: I don’t usually like p-a-cs; I tend to get bored and find them frustrating. That’s how I ended up never finishing Machinarium, the game that put this studio, Amanita Design, on the map. But I ended up really loving Botanicula, found it to be very solvable, and it was short enough that when I was started to get a bit bored, it ended. The game is incredibly cute, with endearing collage-ish art and cute little sound effects that serve for the communication between the characters. Botanicula is noteworthy, like all of Amanita’s games (or so I’ve been told) for having no words, spoken or written, and still telling a compelling, coherent story. You play as a troupe of anthropomorphized floraforms who are trying to save the inhabitants of their tree from evil spider-creatures.

32080443.review:
[b]What you do[/b]
Walk around clicking on stuff to see what happens.  Marvel at the imaginative fervour of the world before you.

[b]What you don't do[/b]
You don't have mechanical control.  Exploring simply means clicking the button for the next screen.  Although there are puzzles, they only require observation and recognition of icons - not logical deduction to an extent that you would stop to think about.

[b]My reaction[/b]
My general feeling is that I don't have the patience for these kinds of games.  But Botanicula stands out because of its inspiring art, which conveys a kind of childish delight through many thousands of inventive and unexpected details.  The sound and music top it off perfectly (although sadly the compression makes it only appropriate for the tiniest speakers).

32058558.review: Sono rimasto bloccato al concerto, le ho provate tutte, schermata senza senso, senza un minimo aiuto o indizio su quello che bisogna fare, devi fare a caso sperando nella fortuna.

32047608.review:
Studio Amanita Design je bezesporu klenotem české vývojářské scény. Zatímco z našich známých AAA studií zůstává na scéně v podstatě jenom Bohemia Interactive, četným nezávislým tvůrcům na čelní pozici vévodí tato kreativní firma, uznávaná nejen v naší české kotlině, ale i “za kopečky”. 

Botanicula se poněkud vymyká ze zavedené adventurní linie titulů Samorost a Machinarium. Ty byly také hravé a kreativní, ale budily ve mě dojem určité serióznosti. Možná díky odlišnému autorskému týmu. Botanicula ale podle mě není pro každého. Přináší uvolněné a hravé vizuální i zvukové zpracování, ovšem ti, kdož nebudou s tvůrci naladěni na stejně bláznivou až infantilní vlnu, možná nebudou spokojeni a sluníčková “juchů” adventura je nemusí bavit. 

Ocitáme se v bizarním ekosystému blíže neurčeného stromu, v jehož mikrokosmu se odehrává střet dobra a zla, boj s pavoučími parazity přinášejícími zkázu. Tým pěti postaviček, každá se specifickými dovednostmi a vzhledem, v klasickém point and click dobrodružství zachraňují stromový svět. Díky nosnému tématu i zpracování Botanicula zdánlivě působí jako dětská hra, ale pro ty menší ratolesti by mohly být některé temnější lokace zdrojem strachu a obav. 

Prostředí je nesmírně živé a je radost objevovat a poznávat, co se na monitoru děje. Stylová a bohatě animovaná grafika, po obrazovce vidíme neustálý cvrkot a pohyb, záplava hmyzáčků a různých pidižvíků vykonává své pravidelné rituály. Odměnou za úspěšné interakce jsou kartičky s příslušníky hmyzího řádu (a taky množství achievementů). Na předloženém světě je vidět radost z designu a nesmírný tvůrčí talent. Stylovou a v jiných titulech neviděnou grafiku doplňuje zajímavý soundtrack dokonale korespondující s děním na obrazovce. 

Nicméně hratelnost již bůhvíjak orginální není a spočívá víceméně v klasickém point and click adventuření. Hra je naštěstí přístupná, bez dialogů či záplavy zbytečného haraburdí v inventáři, děj a potřebné úkoly se dozvídáme prostřednictvím animovaných sekvencí. Obtížnost je nastavená poměrně nízko a většina úkolů se dá vyřešit bez zákysů. Zpravidla se jedná o přinesení potřebného předmětu, což se ovšem neobejde bez luštění puzzlů, kde je opět mnohdy nutné pohrát si s prvky prostředí nebo i s jeho obyvateli. Mohlo být více využito odlišných vlastností jednotlivých hrdinů. 

Oceňuji jistou nelineárnost, což pro adventury nebývá typické. Nemusíme splnit do puntíku vše co se po nás chce, abychom se posunuli dál. Některé úkoly jsou nepovinné a pro příběh jsou vedlejší. Z hlediska technického zpracování je pro Amanitu tradicí zpracování ve Flashi. Nevím, jestli je to tím, ale docela mě iritovalo neustálé vyskakování menu, pokud jsem se kurzorem přiblížil k dolnímu okraji obrazovky. 

Botanicula je vhodná především pro hravé pařany, zejména pro ty, co již povili nějaké to dítko. A nebo se mezi děti věkem řadí, či se jimi alespoň cítí. Mohou si tak vychutnat nabízenou animovanou poetiku. Ti co jsou single nebo zatím bez přírůstku do rodiny, možná hru úplně neocení. Za nabízenou vizuální a zvukovou stránku si Amanita zaslouží absolutorium, ale po stránce hratelnosti se nicméně o úplně převratný titul nejedná. 

Hodnocení: 80%

31764220.review:
There's something charming in little inanimate objects that make cute sounds, something magical about the world of Botanicula. 

The constant click and chirps truly represent an odd ecosystem within the game.
I played this entire game without a guide, and though at times it can be downright frustrating, those are always at the fault of an inattentive player. And the game does not punish the player for making mistakes. However, there's no hint system, so traversing for clues can be hard at first.

However, through brilliant visual storytelling, your objective is always clear. So if you run into any trouble, the "click everything until it works" strategy works, albeit unrewarding cause you are not solving it with your brain. 

What this game shine is in sound. It fills you with the amazement of life. 

Overall, Botanicula is a satisfying journey that is wonder in its purest form.

Le simulateur de bonne humeur

Crée par amanita design, ceux derierre machinarium, le jeu vous propose des puzzle, réflexion et surtout une VERITABLE bouffé d'air frais dans un monde coloré riche en personnage, en petite scenette rigolote et autre doublage mignon.

Et vous aurez un beau sourire en jouant, meme si vous vous appelez vladimir poutine.

En résumé :
- Un monde, beau, coloré
- Une ambiance d'aventure qui fera sourire petit et grand
- Des énigmes ascendo facile au début puis plutot dur
- Le style graphique au top, décor comme personnage
- Une musique et ambiance sonore au top qui donne un feeling good tout le long du jeu
- Des doublages marrant voir kitch
- Difficile à 100% et un peu cours

31331735.review:
If you don't really play point and click games and want to try a couple, have this one at the top of the list.

Although it's short, it has a ridiculous amount of style. Imaginative critters that are crosses between insects and plants essentially, but they're really hard to describe other than that, you just have to see them in action. You go through the game interacting with these critters, you play as a small team of 5 critters trying to save the "critter tree" from being drained of all life by black "Zlo" critters. Interacting with the area will introduce you to new critters who will help you progress. It's fun to see how creative the game designers got with the critters, all having their own signature sound effects that are sometimes quite humorous. The sound design is great in this respect, having hundreds of sounds between critters and many tunes that sound like the critters singing a ditty as a group. The area design is also quite varied, going from the canopy of the critter tree to a critter village to a branching cave of more gangled critters.

The game is short, but enjoyable all the way through. Puzzles aren't too obscure or confusing, it doesn't really have a hint system but it isn't too hard to figure out what to do. Very satisfying. This game has become one of my favorite point-and-click games, due to its style, music, and sound effects.

The game runs at sub 1080p resolution. I think the max width is 1440px, the rest will have a black background. This doesn't affect things too much, but thought I should point it out. It also does not have steam UI integration, so you have to take screenshots manually, for example.

31114063.review:
[b][i]"MADE IN CZECH REPUBLIC"[/i][/b]

I can't really help myself, but when there's game that coming from Czech or Slovak Republic, I just want to get them 10/10 and 10/10 only. Nope, I'm certainly not patriot, but goddamn we can make some great games. Especially indie ones. Yes, Arma and Mafia is one thing, but Botanicula oh lord. 

Another great example of game that is indie and truly is indie. I guess you know what indie game is suppose to mean and also you know that some games are "indies" just to cover the lack of quality.

Anyway, Botanicula is truly beautiful. Basically it's for everybody but also not for everybody. When you check the images, you might say that you'd sit your child in front of that and that's game for children but it's only beacause of visuals, that might give you cartoon atmosphere, or something you've watched when you was 4 years old. But guess what, that's indie genre dudes.

You want to know how awesome Botanicula really is? Imagine some interactive picture of let's say forest. You can move your cursor whereever you want, and every object that you can see will act like that cursor is there and behave like it's there. So the leaves will move in the direction cursor went, small twigs too, nuts, chestnuts or other forest fruit. Simply said, like you was there.

Audio is on whole another level. It was done just by two guys that goes by name DVA (Bara Kratochvil & Jan Kratochvil) and they just done their work perfectly. Amanita Designs, small czech independent studio lead by Jakub Dvorsky didn't just made Botanicula, they made their impact with Machinarium and Samorost series. With their skills, DVA duo and highly highly highly interactive enviroment they have created truly great indie gem.
(Demo available - another bonus point)

[b]Bonus Point: Czech Feeling[/b]
[h1]Rating: 9/10[/h1]

La verdad es que no se si recomendar o no esta "aventura gráfica-hidden object-clicker-ida de olla" que es este juego.

Gráficamente es muy simpático y está bien hecho. Admiro a la gente con imaginación que es capaz de crear mundos tan subreales como este. Pero creo que se han pasado con los tripis. He tenido muchos momentos de "WTF está pasando aquí!" Muchas veces no tiene ni pies ni cabeza y te sacarás los puzzles de puro churro, a lo prueba y error, porque aquí la lógica brilla por su ausencia. No obstante me ha supuesto un reto para orientarme y no perderme por los mapeados imposibles que tiene. Nunca vas a saber qué tienes que pulsar, o arrastrar, o empujar, o estirar, ... Es un desafío mental profundo.

Iba a darle una recomendacion negativa, pero tras terminarlo he de reconocer que cuando te acostumbras a su mundo de paranoia, valoras muchos de los puzzles que tiene y al final te hace pasar un ratito agradable (es bastante corto) y te saca alguna sonrisa con las tonterías de criaturas, animaciones y ruiditos. Aprobado por los pelos.

[h1]I realize I'm in the vast minority, but this game just doesn't fit me.[/h1]

I can recognize that this game is very pretty, well animated, and has a charming "cute factor" going for it, but I just can't get past the nonsensical seemingly "random" events in the game.  You do things and click on things, not so much out of logic or purpose or because you know what's going to happen, but out of [i]"you just need to click on everything to see what it does"[/i] -- and some comical, weird, random things happen.  Then using a little logic you learn to click on things in the correct order and progress the story along.

I wish I liked this.  But I couldn't get past all the [i]"wait, what just happened?  Ok, that just doesn't make sense"[/i].  Which make me think of this game more as "a doodle" as opposed to "art".  It has no point.  No aim or over-arching design, message, or meaning.  Just very random and disconnected.  Yet, is well drawn and colorful and passes the time.  It's not 'art'.  It's a doodle.

Given the ratings...I'm sure it's just me.

[h1]If you like Machinarium, you'll like this.  It has the same feeling.[/h1]

30346731.review:
How do I even begin to describe this game…?

Botanicula’s visuals are soft and dreamy and really beautiful, and unlike anything I’ve seen before, surreal even! The many strange sounds all around you pull you right into this enchanted little world, and the wonderfully ambient music follows the mood of wherever you are, from sad to scary and all the way through to elatedly happy!  (“Yoohoo!” as the five little friends would shout Ü)
 
I must admit, I was slightly sceptical as to how much fun a point and click game could possibly be, but shame on me…  It brought me straight back to that childlike wonder you have when you come across something never discovered before; thinking hmmm, what might happen if I just…?

It is a think-outside-the-box puzzle game, where you have to trust your intuition and just try… anything goes, whether it’s in a little mini-game or a mini-quest, or one of the many, many puzzles; from the playfully simple ones, to the downright trying ones and finally the ones that are just extremely frustrating (yeah, talking about you caterpillar…)!

There is no tutorial, no instructions… you’re simply thrown in the deep end; so go explore, experiment and figure it out yourself… oh, and have tons of fun while you’re at it Ü!!!

Botanicula is imaginative and intuitive and to me it has been an absolutely delightful adventure! My only regret is that the journey through this magical world is way too short (the reason that I used such a long time is that I got completely, utterly, totally lost on several occasions throughout the game in the more maze-like levels; turns out I have no sense of direction in games either…) and also I suspect that much of its charm would be lost in a replay… 

It may not be for everyone, but I loved every bit of it!

Ü

30052712.review:
First 15 min impressions:Botanicula
Verdict: Buy for <= $2.50

This is a point and click adventure game with whimsical art. You play a group of friends as they try to shelter a seed from a big evil spider that is sucking the life force out of everything it touches. There's no text, no speaking parts, and the story is entirely told via pictures and iconography.

The game reminds me of Samorost. The puzzles are simple, and there doesn't seem to be any sort of inventory. I imagine the game will be short, perhaps an hour or so.

I wouldn't spend a lot of money for this game, but it kills a little bit of time.

29949421.review:
Botanicula est un point-and-click des studios Amanita Design, également responsables des très bons Machinarium et Samorost.

Autant vous mettre en garde: si le mignon vous dérange, si vous vomissez du métal poilus et pointus dès que vous entendez des gazouillis d'enfants et si des boutons vert-ocre vous poussent sur le corps quand vous pensez à la nature, retournez écraser des cannettes sur le bitume, ce jeu ne vous conviendra pas.

Tout ici est poésie, de l'éstéthique globale du jeu aux bruitages et musiques, entièrement faits à la bouche.

Botanicula n'est pas très long, quelques heures suffiront pour finir l'histoire, mais si vous voulez récupérer toutes les cartes (et donc les succès), vous pourrez probablement prévoir un deuxième round si vous jouez sans les soluces, tant certains éléments sont bien cachés.

Avis aux amateurs de belles choses: Botanicula pourrait bien vous ravir!


L'affreux.

29905960.review:
When the stars fell from the sky they ran into the moon and fell into the earth like seeds. From those seeds sprang beautiful trees with many creatures that lived inside. But one day strange, dark parasites began consuming the life from the trees without giving anything back. There's nothing really to be done but plant a new tree so life can begin anew!

The best I can describe this is a exploration, point and click. It's beautifully drawn, with strange and lively music. The sound effects from the things you click become part of the background music. There's no dialogue, and any directions are communicated through pictures or arrows, including the plot.

This is a game where you click around to figure out the next step, moving along through trial and error. The puzzles are generous, giving you infinite lives if you mess up. Not all the puzzles reset but most of them don't need to.

My biggest complaint is that the difficulty ascension is a little awkward, going from easy, easy, much harder, ahh, WHOA, and easy-ish again. Levels four and five are the hardest and longest by far, and I had to look at guide to figure out a lot of the smaller details.

Basically it went from having one step to take to get an item, to having a more Zelda-like approach with three or four steps. There wasn't much warning that this was going to happen.

I'm not sure it's a "humourous" game but it made me smile in many places. This is a delightful point and click to explore, with well designed puzzles. Absolutely add it to your library!

29770390.review:
This game is a hell of a lot of fun. There were times I burst out laughing and other times I thought I must have taken drugs with my last cup of tea due to the wild and strange things happening in-game. At other times I just sat and enjoyed the beautiful relaxing ambience this game provides.  It is truly a game for everyone. There are puzzles in the game but they are not the focus. The point isn’t to boggle the player’s mind but to guide them to thoroughly explore this unique world while completing a number of small challenges and fetch quests along the way. If you are a completionist (like I am!) then there are over 100 creature cards to collect, which you do by completing some form of interaction with all the creatures you meet, be that helping them, scaring them away or simply clicking on every single one you can see (and some of the cards are really cute!).

Overall: 9.5

Botanicula is a really fun game with a fantastic aesthetic, brilliant creatures, beautiful music and tonnes of stunning places to explore. It’s also a pretty short game so it doesn’t  overstay its welcome and even really busy people can finish it.  With a wonderful surprise at every turn I couldn’t recommend this game more!

Breakdown

Aesthetic: 10/10

Do I really need to say anything given the screenshots above? Amanita Design is also the developer of Machinarium and Samorost 3, and all their games come with the same unique, gorgeous and charming aesthetic. The way they animate all the little creatures is amazing and every screen brings you more and more beautiful designs.

Music & Sound: 10/10 

I would buy Botanicula just for the soundtrack. The music is beautiful and relaxing, and suits the ambience of the game perfectly. There are a range of moods, from dramatic to soothing to upbeat and lively and no matter what is happening on-screen the accompanying music serves to increase the atmosphere and immersion. There are also hundreds of unique sound effects associated with the different creatures in this game that serve to highlight the different personalities of each despite the fact they never actually talk (see my characters section for more). This clever use of sound effects draws you in and makes the game even better.

Game Play: 8/10

Overall the game mechanics are very simple and there is little that could go wrong other than the usual annoyance that comes with all point & click games. When you have clicked everything on the screen and nothing at all happens you have to vent your frustration by finding the nearest guide, at which point you face-palm at how “obvious” the solution is. But that didn’t happen that often in Botanicula so the pain was kept to a minimum.

The only other minor complaint I have is that I spent quite a lot of time getting lost despite the helpful little map leaf in the corner, although that might be due to my own incompetence more than anything else.

Characters: 10/10

Another characteristic of Amanita Design games is that their characters have a tendency not to speak, instead communicating via a series of incoherent sounds. This gets no complaints from me given most voice acting is horrendous and only decreases the player’s immersion. The burbling noises made by all the creatures in Botanicula suit the game perfectly and make them all so lovable! It really is incredible how quickly you grow attached to all the various nuts, mushrooms and tiny creatures you encounter and they all have so much character. And anyway, as a biologist I feel I should point out that these little guys don’t speak human language anyway and the idea of a grub with an American accent is just silly.

Bad points?

The game could do with more settings as the options menu is barely present, but apparently the game runs on almost anything so I guess it doesn’t really need a lot of options. Other than that I really can’t think of anything bad to say!

29506872.review: Botanicula - це черговий шедевр від наших чеських друзів Amanita Design, який важко назвати грою, і всі хто раніше куштували їхні творіння повинні мене зрозуміти. Зараз не багато студій, які ще спроможні передати своїм дітям душу, тому саме такі проекти виділяються з інших. Стильність картинки зачаровує, а після звуків і саундтреку взагалі не віриться, що це диво зробили люди. Навіть не озброєним оком видно клопітку ручну роботу, також виділяються всі персонажі, які не такі прості як здається і немов оживають в цій коротенькій, милій, часом незрозумілій і жахливій історії. Можна з чистою совістю сказати, що тут є все те, що має бути в квесті, і незважаючи на короткочасність, із-за тепла, яке він виділяє, в нього хочеться повернутись, як в солодкий сон.

29483780.review:
This game is fairly pretty and cute. It has it's own unique artstyle and it shows the game the simplisity of everything. It's easy to play, fun, interesting, problem solving (not hard) which makes it relaxing and enjoyable.

This game has only music (bgm) and interactive sounds but no chatter voice. They all sound muffed while talking to one another which so make you have to focus the thought bubble to understand what they say. It is fairly easy so no hard thinking required.

The five main characters are all unique with different abilities which you would need to think slightly which one would be the one to get the key items. Their characteristics are very fun to look at as it tells what the character likes and wishes.

The music is great and the story told is clear. Like most of the game, you will understand more about the background story through the game. The black laid back tall mushroom tells you the legend so you know what is going on and by talking to all three, you know how the story might end up. Well, not exactly but an idea more or less.

The achievements in this game (just in case anyone is wondering) is fairly simple. You just have to interact with all the characters (not the main ones) to unlock their cards. I played this game for the first time and I have collected all but three without guide (except once about the duck in the oven to progress).

Overall, I highly recomment you to play this game if what you seek is leisure and enjoyment.
I am giving this game a 9 out of 10. I feel this game could slightly be better to be more enjoyable but regardless, it is a great game.

29250357.review:
This game is very simple. Its only involves clicking the right places, or tugging.
This game is insanely hard, even unfair towards the end. Clicks are necessary at the right time in the right window at the right place. There is no help. There is no dialogue, except for some noises and more or less hidden signs. You didn't get them? Too bad, your fault. In later chapters, there is a multitude of screens, sometimes a maze, that you have to go through in the right order - with puzzles that sometimes are less than counterintuitive.
Graphics, or should I say "audiovisual presentations" are not to everyone's taste. It's clearly "art". Deal with that.

If you want to immerse in this story, go ahead. It's fun. I, for my part, followed the walkthrough and enjoyed a visual novel - without the fuss and the frustration of going through dozens of screens checking if I'd overlooked something. Like that, I actually enjoyed playing it - but you shouldn't expect more than 2-3 hours, anyway.

Oh, and I forgot to mention: There is a "Full Screen" Option to play this game. Which means that there is a large black screen with the game running in its native resolution in the middle. Which was kind of... influencing the whole experience in a negative way, because I was playing in 3440x1440. Which meant LOTS of black space. Talk about using the mouse pointer in an exact way...

I'm not normally a fan of point and click games but Amanita's releases and in particular Botanicula have really drawn me into the genre.

Basically, you control a team of plants/creatures who are trying to protect their home from invaders. The story is indirect but heartwarming and enjoyable. I found myself replaying the game several times to find the collectables and each time I found myself appreciating everything a lot more, particularly the soundtrack.

The game oozes  with loving craft from the developers and left me wanting more. It also made me check out and appreciate both Samarost games and Machinarium, also from Amanita.

If unsure, grab it on sale, well worth it if you like story driven single player experiences as I do. A great game.

- You control a group of people? Objects? I don't know have to describe them. You control a group of nature heroes, and its funny to see them react to the environment. 
- I don't normally like when games have no spoken words, but in this case I think it worked. Nothing in this game talks, and its charming.
- I enjoyed the music. There is just one part in the game where you control the instruments being played by two creatures, and its entertaining to hear the music develop.

Cons:
- The controls (can I even call them controls, all you do is click on things) were very unclear. It was at times difficult to figure out how and when to click on something, even when I knew exactly what to do in that situation. That was annoying especially toward the end. There is a section where you have to get a light orb from a pod, and you have to click on the white arrows in a VERY specific way to get the orb. I knew exactly what I had to do, but I had to resort to a youtube video to figure out how to pass this part.
- There is no way I found to make the game full screen, so I was playing with a black frame around the game. It was distracting.
- Steam overlay wouldn't work while I played, so I was unable to see achievements when they popped up. I also had to alt tab to get to a browser.
- When I completed the game, the main menu only gave me an option to play a new game, so I guess there is no way to go to specific chapters in the game. I hate when games do this.

Botanicula is very bizarre and trippy which was nice to see. The story was very basic and was satisfying in the end. I can't say I'd recommend this game at regular price. Definitely pick this one up on a sale. 

There are no jump scares, but there are dark sections toward the end with cartoony-creepy creatures. I wouldn't describe it as scary either.

29087931.review:
I will review all my humble bundle games and see which is worth playing and which is not! Like a lot of people i buy H.B. games as a pack because i want some of the games, but not all. I will play for 5 minutes (or a litlle bit more) and give you my opinion on it. Sometimes the game will surprise me, sometimes it will be a total dissapointment. Just keep in mind this is my opinion only and is not an objective view of the game. You might actually like it!

The review will be constructed into 5 parts:
1. Game description (from what i've seen in the time i've played).
2. Did i finish the game (YES/NO/Maybe in the future) and why.
3. Pros/Cons.
4. Final thoughts.
5. Rating

So let's beggin...

1. Game description:

Point and click adventure at it’s finest. The team behind Machinarium did not disappoint. I don’t want to spoil anything, let’s just say that without saying a word this game tells a better story than a lot of other games. 
The atmosphere is brilliant. The sound and music mixes with the actions you take and on every screen there is something that you can do, even if it is not quest related. 

2. Did i finish the game? YES

The game is fairly short if you know what you are doing, however if you take your time to explore the environment and find all the hidden stuff it will take you a while. 
I will come back to this game one day to find the last hidden creature.


3. Pros/Cons.

PROS:
- Beutiful visuals
- Superb sound and music
- Interesting story
- Tons of hidden stuff to find and explore

CONS:
- None

4. Final thoughts:

Just get it! You won’t be disappointed. Again HB manages to throw in a game that blows me away. This is one of those games you come home to after a hard day at work. Just sit down relax and get absorbed in the story and atmosphere. 

5. Rating

10/10
