29066427.review:
Отличная игрушка :) фантазийная ходилка-квест с юмором, интересным звуковым сопровождением, очаровательной рисовкой, необычными существами. Полностью построена на визуальном восприятии (ну и внеязыковых интуитивно-понятных звуках - мычаниях, хныканьях, гавканьях и пр.), текстов устных или написанных нет. Интерфейс русифицирован.
Интересная и очень приятная в прохождении. Отдельное спасибо за то, что нет отсчёта жизней или "сгорания" персонажа / пройденных уровней, нет "смертей" или урона здоровью, из-за чего можно было бы переживать и напряжённо ходить по этому миру, наоборот - в расслабленном состоянии, но весь на любопытстве бегаешь по уровням-комнатам- веткам-пещерам и радуешься :) Там, конечно, есть всякие "пугалки", которые не пускают, куда не надо или пытаются дотянуться (а то и дотягиваются) до главных героев, но это обыгрывается мягко, так что не придётся в злобе и бессилии бегать по потолку от непробиваемого монстра или невозможности пройти "уровень". Очень понравились разнообразные персонажи-существа, их продуманные места обитания и свойства, ситуации, с ними связанные, и шуточки всевозможные, то играешь, то смеёшься :) Такое придумать и нарисовать - это, конечно, надо иметь небанальное воображение... 
Звуки доставляли отдельное удовольствие, не знаю, кому как, а мне нравилось некоторые действия повторять из-за этих, не побоюсь слова, милых "пиньк!", "оп-па!" и прочего, от чего покатываешься со смеху :) музыка местами мрачноватая, как минимум - необычная - не только для игрушек, в лабиринтах и вовсе звучало что-то вроде специфичного польского джаза, типа Адама Пирончика (например, Touched By Tupinamba). Но забавный в целом настрой странная музыка и звучание некоторых существ не сбивают.
Вообще игра - исключительно подходящее воплощение стихотворения "Варкалось. Хливкие шорьки Пырялись по наве, И хрюкотали зелюки, Как мюмзики в мове." и т.д. - абсолютно точно такие же непонятно кто и непонятно где что-то этакое делают, но при этом смысл действий, что хорошо, что плохо, кто тут Бармаглот, а кто мюмзик - понятно. 
В общем, для новогодних каникул самое то было, волшебно поигралось :)

28865062.review:
Botanicula is a point-and-click adventure but also a game of exploration. It doesn't take you by the hand, you have to experiment to find out what you are supposed to be doing. Everything moves, makes sounds, reacts in some way and you have to find the pattern that makes it all come together. Almost every location has it's own puzzle, 123 in total (you get in-game cards for completing them). It is a difficult game, sometimes a silly game, always an immensly satisfying game. The music and sound as well as the art style is simply amazing. 

My only criticism is that I needed only 4 hours to complete it. I wanted more! 

I recommend this game for everyone who loves point-and-click adventures and wants to experience a somewhat different take on the genre. And for everyone who loved this game I strongly recommend the other adventures from Amanita Design: Machinarium and Samorost 1-3. They are all fantastic.

28694346.review:
At first when I purchased Botanicula, I wasn't too sure I would like it. Truth be told, I only bought it because the characters and art style looked super cute. I never really had any experience with point-and-click games - at least not in a long while - so this purchase was something of a risk for me. But, every risk has the possibility of becoming a sweetass reward, and, now that I've beaten the game, I can definitely consider my purchase of Botanicula to be just that. 

As I've mentioned, the characters and art style are super cute, and they surely have enough charm to match its cuteness. I couldn't stop smiling and giggling throughout my 6 hour playthrough due to the oodles and oodles of OMGEVERYTHINGISSOCUTENESS. Like, if you wanna see what I'm talking about, watch this 27 second YouTube video I made of some singing frogs from the game: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jLo49T7z-Jw

So, yeah: The game's as cute as a bug, and considering I have, like, 87 mental disorders involving the symptom depression, that's pretty important to me. But, what's also important to me is for there to be some sort of meaning to the game. Like, why are these bugs just going around talking to singing frogs and solving puzzles (more on the puzzles in a moment)? Well, the game does a really good job of explaining its story in a way that provides empathy for the characters' plight without using words to do so. Like, the game doesn't use any words at all. Everything is expressed using imagery and emotional gibberish; it's adorable and heart-touching at the same time. By the end of the game, I was so determined to help the buggos, that I didn't mind failing at puzzles again and again and again - so long as I knew that eventually I'd perservere, and Mr. Twig and his buddies would eventually be happy again!

The puzzles themselves are, well, they're certainly satisfying to solve! Just about every time you solve a puzzle, the characters go all "YooHoo!" and it's THE CUTEST THING EVER OMG! I'm normally pretty terrible at puzzles (I blame those aforementioned mental disorders), so I eventually needed a guide to help me through the game. However, one thing I did notice was that it was also pretty difficult to identify where exactly puzzles were supposed to be. Like, not just what you were supposed to do in a puzzle, but what exactly was a puzzle? Where to start a puzzle? Sometimes it was tough to just get started, and I feel like this might be a problem for more people than just myself, especially near the end of the game. There's this awfully mazy-like area, and it practically forces you to use a guide for at least some of it. For me this wasn't a really big deal, since I didn't really buy this game for its puzzles anyway, but I could definitely see some people becoming upset by this. 

So, there ya have it: my feelings about this game. I'm sure you're all very scared now by all of this, but you shouldn't be scared of purchasing this game, at least not if you like cute things and puzzles. Very, very, very nice game, and I'm looking forward to playing the other games done by Amanita Design.

<3

Pros:
- Incredibly charming in every aspect possible
- Clever storytelling that doesn't rely on words 
- Atmospheric soundtrack and sound effects
- Interactive environment
- Puzzles are generally satisfying to solve

Cons:
- Easy to get lost
- Puzzles are a little too difficult to identify sometimes

I am a bit back and forth on this one. On one hand the style, animation, sounds and overall design is really cute and sucks you in the game. On the other hand, there are a few puzzles where there is too much trial and error going on, where you just click things and hope it works. And even some spots where you have to click on the same spot multiple times to get the answer. I think this should never be in a point and click, even if I'm rewarded in between clicks with different animations. 

Still, I really like the overall feel, and think that in a sale it's worth the price. Most solutions are genuinely cute and give you a nice animation of the resolve. It's a bit on the short side, but that's actually just how I like my games. 

Overall a yes, even if some parts drag on and put you out of the game.

28523678.review:
[h1]Простота да чистота — наилучшая лепота.[/h1]

Отличное приключение пяти маленьких друзей, по зову сердца отправившихся в большое путешествие ради спасения своего дома (большого дерева) и всех живущих там существ. Очень оригинальная идея, при этом поданная по-достоинству, абсолютно не перегруженная какими-либо излишествами. Тут есть и юмор, (исходящий из очень простых ситуаций, но при этом не скатывающийся в примитив) и даже драма (!), которая своим нарастающим контрастом и серьезностью дает игроку понять всю ценность настоящей дружбы и доброты, чего уж от этой игры точно не ждешь, глядя на полные красок скриншоты. Все диалоги и озвучку игрок поймет на интуитивном уровне, а манера их исполнения вызовет лишь улыбку. Музыка удивляет своей уместностью и приятностью уху, некоторые моменты специально перепройти хочется из-за этого. Ну а управление - типичное для жанра, ничего инновационного тут нет, зато нету этой бомбящей стороны пиксельхантинга, и хорошо. Здесь будешь думать над логическими загадками (которые в игре присутствуют, да, и даже не одна, и все они далеко не однообразные) и их решением, а не над тем, куда же теперь ткнуть, чтобы пройти дальше, когда решение уже нашлось.
Так что если необходима порция положительных эмоций, то эту игру определенно стоит купить, а эта мелкая компашка главных героев воодушевляет настолько, что игру даже за полную цену взять не жалко :)

In today's age of gritty shooters and action-packed open worlds, it's rare to find a game to just kick back and chill with. Rarer still is when a game's universe is so enthralling and imaginative you can't help but smile the whole time playing. Enter Botanicula.

The sound design and charming art style work perfectly together for an experience that feels less of a game and more of a bizarre interactive storybook. It seems that with almost every click in this point-and-click adventure something brilliantly adorable happens that will take you completely off guard.

28128579.review:
Botanicula è un'avventura grafica molto particolare. Partendo dal fatto che non vi troverete alcun dialogo o riga di testo, il potere comunicativo di suoni ed immagini è eccezionale. La trama è semplice quanto quella di una favoletta per bambini: dobbiamo accompagnare 5 amici funghetti (il nostro fantastico A-team allucinogeno) in un'improbabile avventura che li vedrà coinvolti nel salvataggio dell'importantissimo seme di un albero, simbolo di vita, l'unico scampato all'attacco appena perpetrato da parte di alcune creature nere e cattive (che ricordano molto i ragni).

Dal punto di vista grafico il gioco adotta uno stile artistico che ho apprezzato molto: un piccolo mondo fantastico a tema botanico, realizzato con una grazia ed una delicatezza rara. Anche il comparto audio è ben realizzato, con suoni, musiche e versi che calzano perfettamente e ogni tanto strappano un sorriso o fanno salire un piacevole senso di tenerezza.

Gli enigmi non sono difficili, alcuni richiedono un po' di pazienza e qualche tentativo, ma sono simpatici da svolgere e non frustranti, senza però risultare banali. Il gioco in sè mi ha trasmesso un senso di calma, positività e stupore, dato dal perfetto connubio di immagini e suoni che accompagnano l'esplorazione di questo bellissimo mondo vegetale.

1.鼠标游戏，用不上任何手柄因为要无脑点很久。点得手指疼。

2.给人感觉制作者头脑风暴第一直觉是什么就做上什么，直觉里充满了柴米油盐车贷房贷又有一些喜欢的球队，乱来癫狂状况下制作出来的。音乐画风人物刻画小游戏彩蛋皆是。充满魔性充满脑洞充满神经质。有鬼畜的艺术性，有日本广告的释放感。

3.接上条所以解密很敷衍，迷题的暗示性思考性不足。并没解密游戏的成就感。

4.比最有名那部有差距。

28072540.review:
虽然我给了推荐，但是我不得不上来吐槽一下我所遇到的窘境。

我安装完游戏后被这神奇的画风和故事深深地洗脑，这游戏的毒性就像其工作室的名称（鹅膏菌）一样奇毒无比，以致于我一口气把游戏玩通了关。没错，注意是一口气！一口气！的意思就是说我中途完全没存档！所以当我美滋滋看完最后附赠的3个小动画之后震惊地发现只有一个“开始新游戏”的按钮，而我还剩下4个成就没解锁！我要为了4个成就重新再从头玩到尾吗！感觉好麻烦又逼死强迫症啊！这种被懒癌和强迫症两头夹击的感觉你们能感受到吗？！

所以为了之后玩这款游戏的强迫症玩家不再受这种惨无人道的煎熬，毅然决然地决定将我的惨痛经历告知给广大强迫症患者——

随时记得存档！！

这就是我血一般的教训。

I know I've said this about Amanita Design in another review, but their games are stunningly beautiful. They have managed to create a world all of its own; which drags the player in with its wonder, scope, and beauty. I am writing this review shortly after completing the game and feel the need to go back to find more of the secrets and to 100% it. 

This game is a point and click adventure with minimalistic story-telling. It features puzzle-solving some of which are simple, others of which take a bit more pathfinding. Musically speaking it works, the pieces reflect the atmosphere of the game well and can give the player the sense of the mood of the game. I found at some points of the game the music to be very engaging and would sit on certain screens just to listen. This game took me a little over three hours to beat. I would say its about 2 1/2 to 3 1/2 hours long depending on player, and is worth a replay eventually. The price of this game is fair.

27452086.review:
Botanicula ist ein sehr ungewöhnliches Adventure. Es versteht seine Geschichte ganze ohne Worte, rein durch visuelle Erzählung zu vermitteln. Auch für das Gameplay fehlen erklärende Worte, daher hier mal ein paar von mir über das Spiel: Niedlich, wunderschön, zuckersüß, liebevoll, knuddelig, kreativ, abgedreht, alles im positiven Sinne. Grober Storyinhalt: Als fünfköpfiges Team aus kleinen Wesen gilt es zu verhindern, dass der heimische Baum von bösen Spinnen übernommen wird.

Das Spiel ist sehr intuitiv und regt zum Ausprobieren an. Viel gibt es durch Klicken zu entdecken und belohnt einen mit witzigen sowie tollen Situationen mit den zahlreichen skurrilen Baumbewohnern. Der Schwierigkeitsgrad der Rätsel ist gerade zu Beginn nicht sehr anspruchsvoll. Es geht aber ohnehin eher darum zu sehen, was durch die Interaktion passiert, als sich mit Denkaufgaben zu fordern. Das Spiel ist genau richtige für die kleine Pause zwischendurch, den abklingenden Abend oder um die eigene Stimmung zu heben. Neben dem schöne Leveldesign ist ebenfalls der Sound positiv zu erwähnen, welcher das Geschehen stimmungsvoll untermalt ohne dabei aufdringlich zu sein. 
Und wer noch keinen weinenden Käfer gehört hat, hat etwas verpasst :)

Bei so einem kleinen Meisterwerk will man einfach die Entwickler durch einen Kauf unterstützen.

---------------------------------------------------------------------
Bei den Steam Awards 2017 von mir nominiert für die "Die Seele des Vitruvs" Auszeichnung

Поначалу игра не вызывает ничего кроме лёгкой улыбки и мыслей "боже, что за наркомания".
Вроде ходишь, тыкаешь на всё подряд, получаешь карточки, дивишься больной фантазии создателей сего шедевра, но чем дольше играешь, чем дальше проходишь - понимаешь, что всё не так просто.
Плёвые задания из нескольких маленьких локаций - перерастают просто в огромнейшие квесты, которые придётся проходить часами. Исследуя деревья, подводный мир и много чего другого - ты уже не думаешь, что это наркомания. Ты думаешь что это ШЕДЕВР! 
Из детского уровня прохождения в уровень "сломай себе мозг". 
Игра просто шедевральна, сложновата к концу, но совершенно не напрягает. Множество персонажей, совершенно не напряжная музыка и.... да, у этой игры есть сюжет. И весьма интересный :)
Нам приходится играть за пятерых сушеств - листики, семена, жёлуди и тд и тп. При этом каждый обладает своей уникальной способностью, которая помогает проходить локации. Более того - каждый имеет свои мечты, которые можно увидеть попробав наркотические вещества (в игре, правда) или загадав у джина желание. Так вот, вся эта компания помогает другим жителям и существам различных локаций (в частности огромного дерева) спасаться от пауков, которые высасывают жизнь из всего вокруг, параллельно решая небольшие и несложные задачки.
Игра невероятно затягивает, берите и Вы не пожалеете.

27051918.review: That "happy place" you sometimes need to go to. In game form.

27048200.review: Ну що я можу тут ще написати? Гра просто шикарна! Графіка дуже приємна, а музика в грі просто божественна, грати під неї це як грати під арфу богів. Якщо не грали то зіграйте обов,язково, гра дуже охуєнна.

27035863.review: Один вечером, или светлым днём со всей семьёй - эта игра красочный праздник для ума, глаз и слуха!

27008644.review: Beautifully designed game. Just as good as Machinarium.

26989546.review:
In terms of what drives someone to continue a title in this genre, good adventure game wins your heart with its setting and dialog. Botanicula has no dialog, so the setting has to compensate--and it does that amazingly! The environment is gorgeous, unique, and lovably quirky, such that clicking on anything is a reward. Even the noises made in lieu of dialog is so much fun to hear!

The game does sort of change gameplay mechanics near the end, but the controls are extremely simple and make enough sense in the story for the change to be appreciated---like, the gameplay signifies a major shift in tone that induces such pathos that you have to feel it in order to appreciate it.

26972101.review: one of the comfiest games I ever played

26945624.review: Аманита дизайн как всегда в своем репертуаре.

26940802.review:
История о великом походе ради спасения мира от сил тьмы и сохранения семечка света.
Никогда еще не видел столь увлекательные похождения желудей, семян и листиков, да еще ради такой благой цели!
Великолепная игра жанра point and click, не требующая знания никаких языков вообще. С отличным юмором, прекрасной рисовкой, ненапряжным геймплеем и чудесным звуковым сопровождением. Все, буквально все в ней хорошо!
Проходится влет и хочется еще, обязательно перепройду, когда подзабуду решение всех ситуаций, а то не так интересно будет.

P.S. Игра довольно короткая. Это как плюс, так и минус. Решайте сами :)

26668922.review:
Le Gameplay est simple (basé uniquement sur la souris) mais vous demandera parfois de ne pas seulement clicker, il faudra alors "tirer" ou "tourner"... rien de compliqué, d'ailleurs le jeu n'est pas du tout basé sur une quelconque maitrise de dextérité, d'agilité ou de rapidité (légèrement à la fin) en celà il ressemble vraiment à un jeu d'aventure Point and Click classique, d'ailleurs il y a même un inventaire et quelques objets.

Avec une musique bien choisie et des bruitages amusants mais pas de dialogues (du moins sous forme de texte/voix), Amanita arrive à créer un véritable univers et une ambiance très particulière dans laquelle on se plonge aisément. C'est... beau, attachant, presque envoûtant. Même si ce n'est pas entièrement comparable, celà m'a fait penser à "Minuscule" (film avec insectes animés), ici on a plus affaire à des créatures imaginaires mais j'ai ressenti la même fascination.

Il est certes court, n'hésitez pas à fouiller à fond chaque tableau et à refaire et même à épuiser certaines interactions (5 heures en découvrant presque entièrement les petits bonus, certains me résistent encore... où sont-ils cachés ?) mais devant tant de créativité on ne peut que ressortir apaisé et content d'une telle expérience.

26650046.review: This is a charming, creative and heart capturing puzzle game. The art style and sound bits will make you smile. It's not super difficult, and I enjoyed it's simplistic approach to the puzzles. Overall fun!

It has a great experience not commonly found for "younglings" so Yes the game is worth 10 Euros, if the game is aimed toward someone under 10.

Recommended price for everyone else?
Id say anything under 2 Euros is fully passable for this title.

Under 1Euro?
Just grab it and play it when you or the kids want to play a fun and not to hard game at a later time.

FULLY RECOMMENDED.

26597802.review: 植物精灵，来自机械迷城开发组。几年前就原价入过ios版的机械迷城，一下子就被这个开发组的美术吸引了，之后又入了ios版的植物精灵。直到现在看到steam版果断再入一份支持一下开发组。无论美术，音乐还是谜题都引人入胜，但是鼠标的手感还是没有触屏好，推荐移动版能获得更好的体验。

26461931.review: Botanicula - приятный и атмосферный квест, за которым незаметно пролетает время. Сочная, яркая графика, лёгкая музыка, пять забавных персонажей со своими способностями. Это один из тех квестов, где исследование игрового мира будет не в тягость игроку, а даже наоборот, доставит удовольствие и, возможно, развеселит :)  Единственное, что отмечу: Botanicula довольно быстро проходится. У меня вышло примерно 3,5 часа [u]неторопливой[/u] игры (правда, не все ачивменты были собраны, кое-что пропустил из-за невнимательности). Но в любом случае, я рекомендую в это сыграть.

絵本のようなステージで、いろいろ試してみるゲームです。
小さい子にやらせると興味を持ちそうな絵ですが、実際にプレイするとなるとちょっと難しそうです。
小学生高学年以上ってところでしょうか。

日本語対応と言っても、システムのUIが日本語になるだけで、登場人物達は、そもそも英語すらしゃべりません。
なんだかよく分からないほにゃほにゃした音を発しています。
それでも、絵が描かれた吹き出しが出たり、なんとなく何をしゃべってるのか分かりそうな、想像できる感じが楽しいです。

少し頭を使う謎や反射神経が要求されるステージがありますが、慣れれば問題無く解ける難易度です。
軽いゲームをしてみたいなというときにちょうど良いボリュームだと思います。

25821231.review:
I have been meaning to review Botanicula for quite some time; it's one of my favorite casual point-n-click games. Botanicula is absolutely sweet and delightful, full of details and all-around captivating.

Several people who gave this gem a negative review did so due to comparing it to Machinarium. [b]Botanicula has little to nothing to do with Machinarium[/b] – so much so that [b]I[/b], for one, didn't enjoy the latter. So don't expect glaring similarities.

I strongly recommend this game to casual players, fantastic OST seekers, point-n-click die-hards, and artistic aficionados. In those regards, this game does not disappoint: it elevates.

25739111.review: Cute, textless, point-and-click adventure with a good plot. There's a ton of charm in this game and the devs were highly creative with the creatures.

25727319.review:
[h1]Botanicula[/h1]

Septique, agréablement surpris, charmé, conquis, voilà comment je résumerais les différents états par lesquels vous fait passer ce jeu. Le studio Aminita Design arrive à transformer un scénario banal en une aventure émouvante qui vous touche par son ambiance et son incroyable originalité. Qui aurait cru qu’on pourrait s’attacher à 5 petites créatures végétales qui ne parlent pas mais veulent à tout pris sauver  la dernière graine de leur arbre natal. Et pourtant c’est le pari que réussi Botanicula en vous plongeant dans cet univers que vous ne rencontrerez nulle part ailleurs, univers touchant et plein d’humour, aux décors magnifiques et fourmillant de petits détails et de créatures à rencontrer, à la musique d’ambiance envoutante et aux nombreuses animations. 
Niveau gameplay, j’ai trouvé le jeu relativement bien dosé, on se creuse un peu la tête par moment mais sans jamais se faire mal au crâne ou rester bloqué pendant des heures.
Seul bémol, on peut trouver la durée de vie un peu courte, il m’a pris 6h environ mais même à plein tarif je n’aurais pas regretté mon achat.

[h1]En conclusion : [/h1]
Il y a des jeux aussi bons soient-ils qu’on finit puis qu’on oublie et puis il y en a d’autres qui ont cette petite chose en plus, ce brin d’originalité, d’émotion, d’ambiance qui vous touche et fait qu’on ne les oublie pas. Pour moi Botanicula se range dans la seconde catégorie et même si il ne plaira pas forcément à tout le monde, je ne peux que le recommander vivement.

[b]Bilan : 8,5/10[/b]

[h1]English summary : [/h1]
There 2 kinds of games, the one you finish and then forgot and the other which have something extra to offer : a bit of originality, emotion or atmosphere that affect you. For me Botanicula is in the second group and even if it won’t be able to please everybody, i deeply recommend it

25680492.review: Great Point and Click Adventure for nature Friends :)

25619340.review:
Brilliant little thing. 

A point & click adventure with beautiful design and music. Everything is quite naive, and the puzzles are challenging enough to be rewarding, but no so much as to get in the way of the whole experience, which in the end is the journey of four friends trying to save their little "world". There are also lots of surreal characters and comic situations to interact with.

25562732.review: Botanicula is a nice game to look at, to hear and play.  Guidance is minimal but things become clear after a short while. The style is original and a little off-beat but it retains the feeling of a likeable adventure.  You feel part of the chaotic world of insects and strange creatures.  The sounds are organic, interesting and diverse.  Likewise the quirky animals and the unexpected outcomes of the chance encounters not only amuses but keeps the player a little on edge for a basic point and click style game.  7/10.

25558336.review:
Un juego muy fácil y simple de manejar, el point&click más básico posible ya que casi todas las acciones requieren únicamente clicar en el lugar adecuado y pocas veces haremos uso del inventario –muy básico siempre su uso-, aparte de que los puzles son casi todos bastante accesibles para cualquiera –solo uno puede requerir un tiempo mayor para adivinar la solución correcta-. Sin embargo, la curiosidad del jugador se verá recompensada descubriendo detalles que no son necesarios para continuar, pero enriquecen el mundo del juego y, siempre, resultan preciosos de ver.

Porque Botanicula es, por encima de todo, una experiencia preciosa de principio a fin que merece la pena visitar.

25513674.review:
Delightful, clever game; this is one I recommend to all my friends who are looking for point-and-click puzzle games. You play as a team of five seed-ish characters traveling around a tree threatened by fuzzy-spider creatures, and have to solve puzzles to reach some regions or get some resources. The map unlocks after you've done a few of the initial puzzles.


The graphics are wonderful; audio is excellent at giving a sense of mood and direction without words; puzzles are varied enough to be challenging. There's likely to be at least a few that are frustrating because of that - there's something for everyone's preferred style, which means there's also something that's outside of everyone's comfort zone. (For me, it was the ant maze.) One section has a couple-dozen separate rooms, each with a puzzle-bit to complete, and it can be hard to keep track of which ones you've completed; making notes on paper may help. 

Click on everything - most of the achievements are side-events rather than part of the main puzzle track. Fortunately, "everything" is mostly charming extras, with cute creatures bouncing around and plants unfurling and making charming noises.

Highly recommended, like everything from Amanita Design.

25475507.review:

收集图鉴也是一项大工程，我这种看见非背景色的就想点一点的人也只有111/123，剩下的还是二刷完成好啦。[spoiler]如果跟我一样强迫症式追求全成就，请记得每章来个存档= =不然就会像我一样从头开始刷，当然你要是像我一样从头开始刷是最好了[/spoiler]

25470470.review: This game is absolutely delightful. It's a simple click-puzzle game with beautiful, quirky art/music/sounds. It made smile all the time. Make sure to try everything, and then again. Even still, I wasn't able to find all the little hidden achievements. I'll play through it again for sure some time in the future to try get them all =)

25417840.review:
非常有意思的游戏！作画，声音和互动方式都非常可爱。

25412058.review:
Avec Botanicula, Amanita nous pond encore un chef d'oeuvre du point n' click. Si le gameplay est assez proche de Machinarium, le jeu se différentie au niveau de son ambiance : là encore la bande-son ainsi que le style graphique sont une grande réussite ! A noter que le jeu est assez simple, ce qui le rend accessible à tout âge.
Un des mes jeux favoris, à posséder dans sa ludothèque si ce n'est pas déjà fait (comme tous les autres jeux du studio d'ailleurs).

25403592.review:
Botanicula это не просто игра - это релаксация, маленький пучок чувства легкости и позитивчика. 8-]

Сюжет:

Мы маленькая команда - орешек, палочка, грибочик, семячко-вертушка и желудь. Наш дом огромное дерево посещает паук всеед. Поедает всех зверушек все листочки даже солнца свет он проглатить готов! Во всем этом хаосе встречаются наши друзья и бегут со всех ног от этого чудища! предстоит предупредить всех, чтоб прятались от беды огромной, чёрной, красноглазой, восьминогой! Удастся ли спастись нашей команде и всем зверушкам и самому дереву от напасти зависит только от вас дорогой мой друг!

Игровой процесс:

Игра выполненна в стиле Поинт энд Клик. Мы ходи из одного экрана к другому и решаем незадачливые говоломки приправленные резвым и умиляющим душу юмором при сопровождении замечательной музыки подстать миниатюрному миру игры. Нам встретятся персонажи, что будут просить нас найти определенные предметы нужные им на обмен нужные нам для прохождения определенной преграды. Иногда нам представят выбор кого из команды послать выполнять определенную головоломку - один з наших друзей умеет летать, другой увесистей, следующий может растягиваться в длинну и проникнуть в недосягаемые места, а последний и вовсе крепкий орешек об который сломает любой зверь свой острый зуб.

В целом игра подарила дюжину позитивных эмоций и не давала заскучать!

Советую сыграть всем будь вы стар либо млад. ;)
Держите эту маленькую божью коровку на счастье. :-]

24443346.review:
Botanicula植物精靈
是畫風柔和、療癒的解謎小品，說的是一個守護家園的冒險故事。
冒險途中玩家運用智慧，配合五隻小生物不同的特性，過關解謎趕走汙染黑毛怪，拯救他們心愛的母樹。

[h1]遊戲時間[/h1]
大約4個小時可以完成遊戲並達到全成就，當然如果你絕頂聰明，一下就破解謎題，那麼過關時間大約可以在2-3小時內完成，但如果跟我一像東戳西戳發誓要點出所有東西，又偶爾有點小路癡會迷路的話，那遊戲時間可能會再多一些些XD

[h1]遊戲優點[/h1]
畫面可愛、光影協調，氣氛十分溫馨
動畫設計幽默，常常讓人會心一笑(製作團隊很喜歡把工作人員的臉藏在奇怪的地方XD)
音樂獨特，每一種小生物的音效不論喜怒哀樂都很可愛

有些關卡是需要發揮聰明才智，理出一點邏輯才能解開的，雖然說是療癒系游戲，但有時候卡關太久還是會讓人有點小暴躁~~~~~~
(如果真的卡關的話，有種工具叫做「孤狗大神」，搜尋一下攻略應該很快可以迎刃而解XD)

[h1]評分：7/10[/h1]  整體而言，是值得收藏並多次品味的小游戲！

I never write reviews for games. But I had to for this. It's stunningly beautiful and the most delicate way, it's hilarious, and it's full of constant surprises. I'm never bored, I'm never stressed by puzzles because there is so much else to enjoy. I'm taking my time just to savour the beauty and cute fun. 24411959.review:
Probably, Botanicula - one of the cutest games that I had seen. This is one of those games whose charm lies in its simplicity and even a certain naivety, combined with excellent art-style.

Storyline is fully revealed in the first minute of the game. Our brave heroes must save last tree seed from voracious spider-like parasites and... that is it. Well, on the way from the top of tree to its roots, heroes will visit quite strange, unexpected and unpredictable places. Here I must say that sometimes Botanicula seemed for me, well... too eclectic. The first part of the game has a beautiful and clearly defined style, but in the middle of the game appeared... inappropriate elements; for my taste, they just do not fit in original style.

Last part of the game is excellent, it offers an impressive contrast with the beginning. Live intertwining branches, filled with sunlight and scurrying creatures, are replaced by dark and eerie domain of parasites. The tree is dying. I was deeply impressed by last scene... and inspired by hope. The idea is simple and clear: despite everything, do not despair.

As for the gameplay. It is very simple, puzzles are not difficult but well designed and interesting enough. There is almost no inventory management and, in my opinion, it is good, because I do not think that collecting weird stuff and guessing how all this junk should be used, is a necessary element of good game. There are some arcade mini-games, they are well designed and fits perfectly in the mood of the game.

World of Botanicula is inhabited by a variety of strange creatures and I humbly advise you to not hurry. Explore the game, click everywhere and see what happens then. In many cases, your curiosity will be rewarded with short funny scene. Botanicula is filled with humor, this game is truly created with love.

I really liked the soundtrack, this strange and charming melodies, filled with buzzing and other strange sounds, it creates a very special atmosphere. Great job!

Well. I sincerely recommend Botanicula. Odd, touching, optimistic... that is it. Not a masterpiece, maybe, but close enough.

24279337.review:
This game is gogeours looking, artful and unique, but it definitely won't be for everyone. I didn't particularly enjoy it myself, mostly because I got easily frustrated by all the 'click everything and hope it leads to something useful so I can progress' angle. 

I think some people might enjoy the slow pace, cuteness and challenge of the game, but for me, I prefer logical puzzles and I struggle with abstract stuff that my brain can't find a pattern in. Most of playing time I spent clicking on things, trying to figure out what the next step was and suddenly I'd be in the next level without even realizing what I'd done to get there or how it fit in to the story.

Like I said, not for everyone, but I can deffinitely see the appeal for people who enjoy a less linear approach to puzzles solving.

I'm working my way backwards through Amanita Design's portfolio at the moment, and not one game has disappointed me so far.

23763942.review:
J'avais déjà pas mal apprécié Machinarium (acheté en dur), et j'ai encore plus aimé Botanicula. Le studio Amanita Design semble troquer les véritables puzzles du précédent Point & Click contre un univers bien plus immersif où la découverte et la farfouille sont les maîtres mots. Les curieux (et parfois acharnés du clic) sont d'ailleurs récompensés par des petites cartes à collectioner à l'effigie des créatures qu'ils font émerger des fourrés. Mais au delà de ces cartes c'est aussi l'enchantement permanent face à un univers terriblement bien construit que viendra chercher le joueur. Les énigmes sont assez peu complexes (ce qui n'empêche pas d'aller voir un walkthrough sur internet de temps à autres puisque là où Machinarium avait un système absolument pas punitif, révélateur de solutions concernant ses énigmes, ici on est tout seul). En plus de graphismes délicieux, le sound design du jeu est encore mieux réussi que celui de Machinarium, là où il se situait plus platement au niveau de la "musique" dans le précédent, ici ce monde d'insectes, de feuilles et de vie se fait extrêmement prégnant, grouillant, et le tout fait avec la bouche la très grande majorité, si ce n'est tout le temps ! Une petite merveille enchanteresse, c'est le mot. La dernière heure de jeu nous gratifie même de séquences plus insolites comme une petite course de coccinnelles et une séquences shoot'em up simplifiées à outrance. Un émerveillement de tous les instants pour les petits et les grands (faites jouer vos gamins à ce jeu bon sang) qui revêt en plus de cela un petit discours écologique pas moralisateur pour un sou.

Il ne coûte trois fois rien en soldes, faites-vous plaisir.

23737305.review: I couldn't stop smiling while playing this game. There are so many optional puzzles that enrich the world, and even though most of them are "click the correct stuff; yay! you solved it!" the results of solving the puzzles are often so endearing, it doesn't matter.

23572478.review: Botanicula est ue petite merveille, un jeu 100% plaisir. Une esthétique vraiment géniale, un peu particulière sur les bestioles, elle ne plaiera peut-être pas à tous mais on ne peut pas nier une DA vraiment originale. Très mignon dans son ensemble, les décors sont splendides et fourmille en détails. On peut vite raté une chose à faire, une interaction à trouver tant il y a de choses avec lesquelles on peut intéragir à l'écran. Cela peut nuire un peu à la visibilité mais ça donne une vie incroyable à cette univers enchanteur. Pour renforcer cette invitation au voyage dans ce monde merveilleux des insectes de Botanicula on a droit aussi à une bande son vraiment charmante et très enjouée. En plus de cela les bruitages et les cris des différentes bestioles sont fait main ou plutôt fait bouche pour beaucoup et ça donne un certains cachet du plus bel effet. Très vite attachant de part son univers et ses bestioles, le jeu possède aussi un gameplay point and click des plus simples et intuitif qui continu de nous immerger un peu plus dans ce petit monde magique. Pas très compliqué, la logique et la curiosité est souvent récompensé par la bonne solution pour avancer dans l'histoire. On est rarement bloqué mais il faut bien explorer les différents décors si on veut dénicher tous les succès et remplir son encyclopédie Botaniculesque. Pas vraiment long mais comme on dit, plus c'est court plus c'est bon non ? En définitive une petite fable écologique ou l'on prend un immense plaisir à tous les niveaux. Léger, amusant, il emerveille et on se surprend à y jouer avec le smile et c'est le principal. Un magnifique jeu signé du très talentueux studio indé de Amanita Design.

23565205.review:
[i]Botanicula[/i] is the second full-length game from Amanita Design, and it's absolutely amazing. Compared with [i]Machinarium[/i], their first full-length (and also amazing) game, [i]Botanicula[/i] is a much more colourful approach, to both visuals and level design. In each level, there are obvious objectives you work towards to go onto the next section, however it's extremely rewarding and fun to just interact with the environment. There are so many uniquely designed creatures and beautifully drawn scenes, I can't imagine anyone wanting to rush through this game. 

The sound design is also fantastic. All the sound effects for movement, creatures and various objects in the world make the game wonderful to play through. Every time I've played through this game, I have a huge smile on my face. DVA's soundtrack is also very well done; I even bought it on vinyl!

I would give this a final score of 9.6/10. My only complaint is that there's a lot to keep track of during the fifth level, which can make it drag on and feel a little tedious. And occasionally, there are moments where I felt like I was just clicking for a solution; something that is too common in point-and-click games! As well, it would have been awesome to play this in higher resolution on my MacBook Pro w/ Retina display, however there does not appear to be an option. The game would look incredibly beautiful at a 2560x1600 resolution! Other then that, this is a near-flawless game. Don't get this on a sale, pay full price. I did when it launched, and Amanita is one of the few companies I would do it for again and again.

23033270.review:
[h1]Short version: 79%[/h1]
Botanicula is an excellent voiceless surrealist point ‘n’ click adventure, a great fit in the Amanita Design library. Two extremely long chapters hold back its final score though, as they just drag on for way too long.

[h1]Long version:[/h1]
Before Samorost 3, Botanicula was probably the longest Amanita Design game with its 4-6 hours of play time (as opposed to the 30-120 minutes we are used from them). It is also unique in their portfolio in the sense that it has a cohesive central plot line about a group of sentient plants and their journey along the branches of a life-giving, glowing tree. Their task is no smaller than saving the last seed of their tree from an evil light-eating spider-like monster and its numerous offspring.
Still, at its core, it is a surrealist adventure, this time showcased in the many small sub-stories that form each chapter. If you are looking for all those unexplainable moments, like a random onion using a fishing rod to get a mount to ride on, you’ll find those in abundance.

While it was commendable that they tried to make a full-fledged adventure game, its size also presents a drawback. This is most notorious in the underground section, which is so full of running around that it gets actually boring. But I also could mention the city, where the usual voiceless and textless approach adds an unnecessary difficulty modifier to the often unexplained puzzles. Sometimes progress can be more of a question of luck than problem solving skills.

With all these put together, Botanicula is a strange beast, because I cannot recommend it for those who are not familiar with this studio’s games. But if you already have some experience with Amanita Design, then Botanicula may be among your favourite adventure games.

22952848.review:
I was moved to write a review for this delightful game after watching a Extra Credits video on the value of short games. I can't say I remember how long it took to complete everything in Botanicula, but every minute was worth it. Rarely have I seen a game that captured whimsy in such a poignant way. With no dialogue other than sounds and grunts, the game manages to portray a story of despair & hope, longing & belonging and wonder at the vastness of everything. 

The visuals are just sumptious. The soundtrack is perfectly suited and individualized, like a theme song for each character or unique moment. I don't think you could ask for a more compelling take on a puzzle quest type game, that never has to beat you over the head that it's a puzzle quest.

I don't think I could more highly praise the work of the designers and production team. This one is worth every moment you play the game, even if it only takes you a few hours to finish.

22712282.review:
An absolutely beautiful game!  It has distinctive animation and a clever plot all conveyed with no words and a gentle,  pleasing soundtrack which just envelopes you into the world of the game.  

The puzzles within the game are unusual and make you think outside of the box.  In fact, the whole game makes you think outside of the normal challenges you find in most adventure games. They are clever and all very "let's try this and see what happens"  (e.g. if you touch this, what happens and how will that reaction help you).  The game sparked an intuitive exploration mode in me that I didn't know I had and I enjoyed every moment of wandering in its world and not just racing through it to find an ending.  

A bonus for me is that this is not a violent game other than trying to do away with a bad spider.  This may sound like a lame plot to most hardcore game players who are used to destroying enemies, dominating warloads, and relying on magic and combat to find a just end for the hero.  It isn't.  The fact that the game can be totally interesting and thoughtful without those trappings makes the game magical. 

I hope the developers create more games like this.  Kudos!  I highly recommend the game to all ages (although the very young might want assistance every now and then but how fun would that be to actually interact with your child to solve the game).

22465751.review:
Le grand + de ce jeu est l'ambiance. La plupars des bruitage sont réalisés à la bouche et la voix, c'est trés réussi, cela donne une atmosphére unique et original. Et je ne parle pas des musiques qui sont génialissime et collent parfaitement à cet univer enigmatique.
Visuellement c'est trés beau, colloré, bien animé, des décors sublime qui mettent bien dans l'ambiance. On rencontrera au fil de l'aventure toute sorte de créatures, petit ou grand, amical ou non, amusant ou effrayant, 

Le jeux ne demande pas uniquement de la reflexion, mais aussi de l'imagination, de la déduction. Le jeux est simple, drôle et intelligent, je regrette juste qu'ils n'aient pas un,peu plus approfondi, allongé un peu la durée de vie car je suis sur qu'il y avait beaucoup de chose à faire.

Bref, si vous cherchez un jeu simple pour se détendre ( auditivement, visuellement ect...) et amusant, si vous avez eu une dure journée, souhaitez vous changer les idées avec un jeux intelligent, ce jeux est fait pour vous. ♥

note: C'est le genre de jeux où il faut vraiment regarder partout, pratiquement tout ce que vous verrez à l'écran est cliquable donc si vous êtes bloqué ne baissez pas les bras et regardez dans tous les recoins ( ca m'est arrivé par moment de me sentir bloqué mais on finit toujours par trouver en cherchant vraiment partout )

Botanicula is a bizarre little game that rather successfully challenges the boundaries between games and cartoons. It looks and feels quite unordinary, but in the best sense. 

-----
Pros:
-----
+ Highly original.
+ A visual masterpiece.
+ Great soundtrack and sound effects.
+ Good, challenging puzzles.
+ Memorable characters
+ Funny and charming animations
+ Beautiful story
+ Great ending

-----
Cons:
-----
- Some of the puzzles are so out of the box that they test your patience.
- The environment is a maze where it's getting very hard to remember where you've been and where not.

--------
Verdict:
--------
If you've ever thought about picking up a point and click game then Botanicula would be one of the best choices, considering how much extra value the developers have put in there.

22041706.review:
Eigentlich ist es fast überflüssig, noch ein weiteres positives Review zu Botanicula zu schreiben ;) 

Aber wer es noch nicht kennt, sollte jetzt endlich wirklich mal einen Blick riskieren. 
Das Spiel ist zum Teil Point&Click-Adventure, zum Teil auch ein bißchen Wimmelspiel. Zweiterer Aspekt gilt hauptsächlich für die rein optionalen Sammeldinge (Achievements) und garantiert den Wiederspielwert.

Was Botanicula von vielen anderen Adventures abhebt, ist vor allem der tolle einzigartige Soundtrack, aber auch die ungewöhnlichen Figuren (die ganz ohne Sprachausgabe auskommen), die sich hier auf eine leicht psychedelische und ganz schön verrückte Reise durch eine unvergleichliche Welt machen, um ihren Baum zu retten :)

Nicht alle Rätsel sind auf Anhieb zu verstehen und zu lösen, aber mit ein bißchen Rumprobieren hat man's schnell raus. Das Gefühl, das man bekommt, während man dieses Spiel spielt, ist ein bißchen mit der Entdeckungsreise durch die Traumwelt eines Kindes zu vergleichen - alles erscheint neu, interessant, überraschend, aber auch irgendwie fremdartig.

Auf jeden Fall hinterlässt das Spiel einen bleibenden Eindruck und den Wunsch, sich die Musikstücke immer wieder mal anzuhören ;)

21972506.review:
[quote=Цицерон] "Нет ничего более изобретательного, чем природа." [/quote]

С 2003 года чешская студия [b]Amanita Design[/b] выпускает незаурядные проекты, сюжет и геймплей которых полностью пропитан приключенческой атмосферой. 
[h1] Весь секрет заключается в трепетном отношении к деталям и любви к мелочам. [/h1]

СЮЖЕТ
[b]Botanicula[/b] может показаться на первый взгляд яркой, бестолковой и чрезчур незаурядной. В отличии от предыдущих проектов разработчиков [b]Botanicula[/b] представляет из себя легкое приключение пяти "дуриков", которым выпала непростая задача - спасти последнее семечко дерева от ненасытных пауков-пожирателей.

ГЕЙМПЛЕЙ
Весь игровой процесс построен на изучении окружающей флоры и фауны. Надо сказать, что вся окружающая атмосфера пропитана антропоморфизмом, которая то и дело демонстрирует игроку сценки реальной жизни насекомых. 

[code]
[b]ЧТО КАСАЕТСЯ ГОЛОВОЛОМОК[/b] 
В игре встречаются несложные задания для решения которых на помощь приходят умения каждого персонажа: 
[list]
 [*]там где надо пролезть поможет прутик;
 [*]нужно применить силу - могучий мак уже спешит; 
 [*]перышко умеет летать; 
 [*]гриб при помощи почкования создаёт двойников; 
 [*]если стало совсем темно, то маленький оранжевый фонарик подсветит.
[/list]

Одним словом, дружная команда букашек с лихвой справится с любой задачей! 
[/code]

ИТОГ
Если в детстве вам удалось проводить свободное время на природе, ловя и разглядывая мелкую живность, то игра [b]Botanicula[/b] подарит вам возможность окунуться в грёзы энтомолога. 

[h1] Не раздумывайте, приобретайте [b]Botanicula[/b] и наслаждайтесь атмосферой живой природы! [/h1]

21771024.review:
It's not often that a game can woo me with a memorable experience without ever saying a word of dialogue, but this one certainly did.

Botanicula is nature personified in all the most enthralling ways - you have this little party of seedlings of various types who explore different regions of this massive tree together, learning more not only about its inhabitants, but its history and its looming crisis as well. Everything you experience here has a charming, hand-crafted feel to it, from the characters to the backgrounds - even the soundtrack is a lovely, quirky mix of accapella in a sound reminiscent of the band Sigur Ros.

For some people, point & click gameplay may not be the most exciting, but then again, most people who will enjoy this have played a few point & click adventures, so the gameplay isn't too surprising. Aside from a  few clickable areas that seem to keep you guessing a little bit too long, It's fairly easy to navigate. If you manage to make it through the game in one playthrough, you will definitely be staring back at the screen in awe. It's no Final Fantasy VII, but the sense of accomplishment after struggle is certainly there.

If you enjoy indie games, games with a hand-made touch, or games that are great at visual storytelling, then pick this up - you'll be glad you did, like I did :)

21407810.review: Cute, simple and fun puzzle game with a soothing, atmospheric soundtrack.

21405999.review:
Botanicula is an aesthetic-driven game whose story is told visually through pictures and images. This is similar to Machinarium which is developed by the same team. However, the setting is completely different. You follow a team of magical insects as they try to save their tree. 

Optionally, along the way you meet a host of magical insects whose mysteries you are encouraged to unravel and are rewarded with a card for your "Bestiary" collection. The cards are secondary though and merely there to represent that you have explored all the mysteries with that particular insect, and you can move on.

The mysteries themselves are hypothesis-oriented. You attempt various different experiments on that screen until eventually, you figure out how the magical insect operates. Unlike Machinarium, Botanicula has barely any item-collection oriented puzzles (and those it has are really obvious - as in an insect asking for a specific item), so most of the puzzles can be solved on the screen you are on. This lowers the scope of brute forcing and makes the actual puzzle solving a lot more enjoyable. When you need some extra knowledge or oomph from another screen, it completely becomes obvious that you've run out of actions and there's enough to explore that you can leave and then come back later with some novel insight.

However, while I have not referenced a walkthrough once and find this game charming and satisfying, I have noticed other reviewers saying that the puzzles are frustrating and very difficult. So keep that in mind and perhaps this is one of those games that you should DEMO before committing to, to see whether it's frustrating or fun for you. 

All in all, a pleasurable and enjoyable experience from a team that I will be following in their future endeavours.

21229764.review:
Botanicula je jedno z najpríjemnejších herných prekvapení aké som za moje hráčske roky zažil. Trvalo mi to však dosť dlho, kým som sa k nej vôbec dostal. Po vydarenom Machinariume, ktorý u mňa bodoval svojou hravosťou, milým humorom, vysokou obtiažnosťou a veľmi príjemným audiovizuálnym spracovaním som dostal od šikovných ľudí z Amanity ešte väčší klenot. 

Botanicula mi učarovala ešte viac. Tá hravosť, neskutočne sympatický a milý humor, plno nápadov, plné obrazovky detailov a poskrývaných interaktívnych miest s prekvapením, príjemné audiovizuálne spracovanie, prostredie, vtipní hrdinovia, to všetko u mňa vyvolalo až detskú radosť pri hraní. Usmieval som sa, pospevoval som si a cítil som sa neskutočne príjemne. Dokonca pri mne často sedela aj priateľka, ktorá hry vôbec nehrá a páčilo sa to aj jej. 

Machinarium síce bolo oveľa ťažšou hrou a Botanicula je možno až smiešne jednoduchá, no tá dynamická hrateľnosť bez zaseknutí a zdržovania mi sadla. Je to celé také príjemné, žiadna hádanka dlho nezdržuje a tak toto dobrodružstvo rýchlo pokračuje a aj rýchlo končí. Čo je veľká škoda a u mňa jediný mínus hry. Tie 4 hodiny bol príliš krátky čas a chcel by som toho viac. Každopádne som však z hry nadšený. 

Najpríjemnejšia hra akú som kedy hral.

ポイントクリックアドベンチャーゲーム。
黒い虫の襲撃を受けた大樹の住人である栗、キノコ、どんぐり、羽虫、菌糸(?)の5体の生物は大樹の種子を守るべく行動する。
ゲーム自体は、普通のポイントクリックタイプのアドベンチャーゲームだが、同ディベロッパーの前作"Machinarium"同様に美しいアートワークとサウンドは健在だ。特にサウンドについて、効果音は楽器を利用したもの、なにか物を叩いた音を利用したもの、声で表現したものなど手作り感を出しているものが多く、アコースティックなBGMも相まって心地よさが感じられる。ゲームにはクリックで反応する箇所が至るところにあり、クリックで何が起きるかを想像しながらプレイすると面白い。クリアの他にもカード集めという楽しみもある。
美しいアートワークとサウンドの絵本のように楽しめるゲームだ。雰囲気を楽しみながら、のんびりと遊ぶには良いゲームだと思う。

Au vu comme ça, la trame semble banale mais on joue à ce jeu pour ces graphismes très épurés, à ses animations toutes plus original les unes que les autres. La bande-son est juste excellente à écouter et chaque bruitage à quelque chose d'intrigant. It's a lovely game.
Not a game you should buy for its gameplay or its complexity or its duration, however, but for the beautifu-but-short story, for the beauty of its watercoloured-like world, for all the crazy and weird creature you'll meet, the OST and all the strange sounds.

Botanicula is a short, intriguing, a little scary, totally surreal, full-of-magic adventure.
I really enjoy the bunch of hours it took me to be finished and I spent this time quietly, with no hurry to see the end. 
I clicked, touched, moved almost anything, because many, many pieces of the enviroment are interactive.

I liked it so much that now I'll try both Machinarium and Samorost 2!


--------------------------------------

E' un'avventura corta, ma molto, molto carina. 
La storia pur molto semplice non è così banale e ha i suoi momenti inquietanti, se ci si mette nei piedi dei piccoli protagonsti. 
E' un mondo acquerellato del tutto surreale, pieno di creature strambe e suoni assurdi, dove tutto -o quasi- è cliccabile e offre almeno una piccola animazione da godersi.
Mi ha davvero divertito molto, come leggere una storia per bambini ma che non per questo è preclusa "ai grandi". 
Non va comprato nè per la durabilità, nè per la complessità, ma per spendere qualche ora con un giochino particolare.
Consigliato a chi può apprezzarne le peculiarità.

A me è piaciuto davvero molto e appena riuscirò proverò anche Samorost 2 e Machinarium!

20907525.review:
Botanicula is a beautiful, soothing children's story set in an alien world of plant and insect people. The tree of life is being invaded by leeching spider monsters and you must go on an adventure to save your friends and grow a new tree. A story told with child-like wonder through charming art, point-and-click puzzles and quirky music all without words! 

Botanicula has a folksy, weird-but-heartfelt atmosphere where you will drink psychedelic wine, listen to wordless folk tales, watch puppet shows, ride inside a yellow submarine creature's head, and find miniature ostriches to run inside wheels and power the propeller that lifts a village of nut people out of harm's way. It reminds me of playing with seed propellers, nuts and rocks as a kid and imagining tiny people. A joy to play.

20763056.review:
[h1] 絵本のようなポイント＆クリックアドベンチャー [/h1]

個人的には雰囲気やＢＧＭがよく面白かったです。

[h1] ゲーム内容 [/h1]

生命の星(木)から生命力を吸い取り、星を滅亡させかけている敵から、星を守ろうとする５人の仲間たちの絵本のような物語です。

基本的には画面のあちこちをクリックくして謎解きをしていくタイプで、それに応じて仲間たちがいろいろと動き回ります、見ていてとても楽しいです、ポイント＆クリックならではのミニゲーム的なものもあったりします、ＮＨＫのニャッキみたいなのが好きなら楽しめると思います。

あれはクレイアニメですが、雰囲気は似ています、公式のｐｖを見て気になった人もいいかもしれませんが、後半は暗い雰囲気なのでその辺は注意しましょう。

日本語もありますが、そもそも字幕もなにもないので音声もほにゃららみたいな感じでしゃべるだけなので、その辺は気にしないでいいと思います、動く絵本世界観や雰囲気ゲーが好きな人にはもってこいの作品だと思います。

[h1] 個人的に思った事や感想 [/h1]

先にも書きましたが動く絵本、世界観、雰囲気にはまれば、間違いないと思います、なかなか安くならないのでセールで安くなったら気になっている人は是非手に取ってもらいたい作品かなと自分は思っております。

20734305.review:
Botanicula is by far one of the most charming games I've ever played. Everything about it takes me back to simpler times when I was so easily entertained. If you have any appreciation for a light-hearted point-and-click adventure, then you will greatly enjoy Botanicula. 

The gameplay is entirely point-and-click. You will have to solve puzzles and complete fetch quests to progress through the story. Botanicula does a wonderful job of staying fresh through its visual and sound design--i never got tired of doing practically the same thing repeatedly. It also helps that Botanicula will probably only last you a few hours at most. It could have gotten tedious had it lasted much longer. The puzzles are never too difficult either. I had to look up solutions to a couple of parts but ended up kicking myself for not having the patience of figuring it out. The story is light, and is driven by the characters' actions. There is no dialogue whatsoever, rather any information regarding the story is told through pictures and short cutscenes. It's a cute element that suits the game.

One of Botanicula's greatest strengths is its visual design. The color palette really pops off the screen, and it adds to the effect when purposeful colorless segments come into play. The bright and joyful colors are complimented by jovial little characters that you control. Each of the characters in your group eventually play a significant role in puzzles throughout the game. While one of them is much more important than the others when it comes to the story, each character has a part to play. Besides the protagonists you control you'll come across several other botanical creatures you can interact with. Playing their little games or simply interacting with them earns you a card with said creature on it that you can collect. If you find them all you get a little bonus after the credits role! All these tiny creatures are diverse in design and range from adorable to mildly frightening. I had fun finding the rascals and discovering their quirks.  

The overall sound design goes hand in hand with the cute aesthetics. I found myself laughing out loud as I heard the silly sounds some of the creatures made. From speech to the sound of movement, everything was spot on to me. Even the darker, scary enemies were well done and felt intimidating in a game where I knew very well that I couldn't be harmed. The music isn't particularly memorable, but I never thought it was bad at any points either. I suppose it just gets the job done.

I loved Botanicula. It's fun, adorable, heartwarming and if I ever have kids someday, I would love to play this with them. This is definitely worth your time.

20722373.review:
This game is without question weird. And that’s definitely to its favor.
[i]Botanicula[/i] is a point-and-click adventure game about the faunal flora residents of a fantastical tree trying to stop a dark, arachnid-like entity from destroying everything they know. If it sounds strange already, then trust me when I say you don’t know the half of it.
To begin, gameplay is standard to the genre; as the player, your job is to explore the grand extent of the tree from the dramatically miniscule perspective of your band of five oddball characters. In your adventuring, you are provided the opportunity to interact with nearly every aspect of your environment, collecting items, receiving and completing small quests and challenges, solving puzzles, and unraveling the simple and yet still fascinating narrative before you, often making use of the individual assets of your tiny arboreal team to do so, and all without the game ever uttering more than a few words of human speech in the process.
Using that as a steppingstone, I transition into aesthetics. The artwork is absolutely beautiful, reminiscent of the animated fair of Tim Burton. Yet, even as there is a bizarre and almost twisted nature to the visuals, the presentation remains almost perpetually lighthearted (most of the time). Nearly every aspect of the tree that the small band of main characters inhabits has a life of its own and each is immensely unique from one to the next (so much so, there’s even a card-collecting mechanic within the game that showcases a solid plethora of these many faces whenever the player takes interest in looking back). Meanwhile, the main team itself is an odd collective of friends who, while not given heavy character development, are filled with heart and personality. Matching up with the strange visuals and dreamlike presentation is an almost unearthly soundtrack from Czech musical group DVA, who also aided in other aspects of the final product.
As I stated earlier, there is almost no true verbal dialogue outside of the intentionally indecipherable mumbles of its characters, and next to no text of any kind; the entirety of the story is recalled and played out on screen as if on a stage. Nevertheless, it is an engaging narrative, even as it is a simple one. In the end, the game isn’t especially lengthy, nor is it predominantly difficult (I, considering myself a less impressive gamer, was able to complete it in right around 5 hours); additionally, like most games in its subset genre, it tends to be a casual experience without an exceptional abundance of high-velocity or high-intensity moments during play. Do any of these facts diminish the value of this game? My answer is an emphatic no. When approaching almost any artistic product—be it a game, a song, a movie, or anything else—it’s important to remember that rarely, if ever, will a piece of art appeal to everyone; even the most popular or widely received products will have people who simply don’t enjoy it the way others do, and this one is certainly not exempt by any means.
[i]Botanicula[/i] is definitely a strange piece of work. It’s a wild adventure that takes place almost entirely in a tree; it’s a bizarre introduction to a lovable cast and a beautiful world; it’s a story without many words, yet it is filled with all sorts of heart and humor [i](sometimes irreverent—discerning gamers/parents, feel free to message me for more details)[/i]; it’s a relatively calm, somewhat brief, light-hearted game that had me entranced, entertained, and engaged all the way through.
To sum it up shortly: it was pretty weird, and it was pretty awesome.

20401475.review:
今天翻了下库存，发现《植物精灵》（Botanicula）这游戏被我冷落了大半年，那时都快通关了，就想着干脆把它打完算了。
然而下载好了游戏却没有点击进去的欲望，想了想，又把游戏删了。
这大概意味着，这游戏要烂尾了。

我的习惯是，良心游戏必须好评。植物精灵是一款各种意义上都100%良心的游戏。这毫无疑问。
但是怎么说呢，新鲜感过后，我却对它有一丝厌倦。
引用一位玩家的留言：『这哪是解谜，像我这种高智商的人从来不怕解谜，但是就是怕这种大型迷宫式连连看』 。
这完全说出了我的心里话。感觉游戏的道路设计并不能给人带来解谜的乐趣，只是增加了枯燥。就像当初仙剑的走迷宫，纯粹拖时间的设计，只不过当时我们没几个游戏可玩还能沉住气坚持，现在可不一样。
感觉还是自己老了。没以前那么有耐心了。游戏开始追求时间短、剧情紧凑、能快速通关。
大概这就是浮躁吧。

===原评测===
《植物精灵》是一款非常良心、优秀的点击式休闲解谜游戏，开发者的上一部作品是大名鼎鼎的《机械迷城》，本就以出色的画风和细节见长，而到了这个游戏，各种小细节的精细雕琢着实又让人惊喜了一把。无论画面、音乐、可玩性，都非常棒。
说完优点说说缺点，我觉得这种架空的植物世界设定虽然非常有创造性也非常成功，但同时会带来逻辑性的削弱。比如有时候会得到一些奇怪的东西，这东西看不出是啥，也看不出能在什么地方使用，你就得去试，不够直观，不像机械迷城这种写实风的，打个比方，你在水塘附近捡到一个杆子一个钩子，自然就会联想到再去找根线组成钓鱼竿，这种联想在非写实的本游戏中就会因为不够直观而显得很难。
总的来说瑕不掩瑜，主要是这游戏制作确实良心。好评。

Ugh. I forced myself to keep playing as it was highly rated and I felt I wasn't getting something. Nope. Just not my thing.

通关撒花：植物精灵，机械迷城制作组又一力作。

流程不长，一共6关，有即时存档。画风温馨治愈，没有文字，但却能感受到它们的情绪，或雀跃或恐惧，生动有趣。

植物精灵们的家园被不知名的黑球怪物所侵占，它会吸食植物的精华，一株株植物枯萎而死，五小萌决心打败黑球怪物，拯救家园。在路上会遇到各种困难，然而五小萌无所畏惧。

实在太萌，点点点就是了，推荐。

20268081.review:
I just took the weekend for 2 of Amanita's games: Machinarium and Botanicula.

If you've ever played Machinarium before (and you liked it), I'm telling you now that Botanicula is just as amazing. Get it, play it, enjoy it! The graphics are lighter and more colourful in general, the puzzles are only a little less challenging (so no need for a "cheating" notebook on the upper right corner, but you still need to crack your head every once in a while), and the story is just as adorable.

If you haven't played any of this studio's games, however, allow me to summarise without spoiling you: Botanicula tells the story of a group of plant-y friends who embark on a journey to save the tree of light from darkness (embodied by spiders). Since it's a puzzle game, you need to complete several tasks to get items and continue to the next level. You will find a total of 123 creatures, each representing a creature card that will be given to you, and which you can look at by selecting the deck on the upper left corner. Take your time, though! There are plenty of Easter eggs along the way (golden cards, and also your Steam achievements) that don't all need to be found for you to go through to the end.

100% recommend if you're into logic and thinking while having fun.

I personally loved it.

1 minute into the game: What the hell is going on?
2 hours and 40 minutes into the game: No, seriously, what the HELL is going on?

This game is, in a word, strange. But I think that's part of the charm. I originally bought this on the cheap due to its unique visuals. I knew literally nothing else about it, and it sat uninstalled in my library for a while before I decided, "Hey, why not? IS it actually any good?"

Had I known beforehand it was a point-and-click style game, I don't think I would have purchased it. When I picked it up in a Humble Bundle, I wasn't even really thinking twice about it. I'm glad I didn't, or I would have missed out on quite the unique experience. This game has quite an array of puzzles to solve, all while presenting you with beautifully simplistic sounds, visuals, and humor. I'm not sure it's something I'd find myself coming back to over and over again, but I missed quite a few cards on my first run through so it might be worth it to come back at least once to see what I missed! If you're looking for something to relax with and spend an afternoon on, this is a great game to pick up.

19832253.review:
Aventura gráfica de estética 2D donde nos sumergiremos en un fantástico universo imaginario de la mano de un variopinto grupo de pequeños seres, los cuales viajarán a través de los confines de este para encontrar la forma de combatir un extraño mal que amenaza su mundo.

Con mecánica “point and click” y sin diálogos, el título nos transporta mediante sus originales diseños y su cuidada banda sonora a una experiencia de juego diferente de la acostumbrada, donde nada se puede dar por supuesto dentro de sus magníficos y coloridos escenarios llenos de vida que, poco a poco, nos abren las puertas a un nuevo mundo plagado de peculiaridades y cosas por descubrir mientras avanzamos resolviendo retos y experimentando con el entorno y sus habitantes.

En conclusión, un interesante título muy cuidado y entretenido, dentro del buen hacer al que nos tienen acostumbrado sus desarrolladores, Amanita design, creadores de aventuras gráficas como Samorost o Machinarium. Por desgracia hay que mencionar que la duración de este es bastante escasa y, aunque no resta valor al juego, si hace discutible su precio de venta, el cual es recomendable adquirir con un buen descuento, por el resto es una propuesta estupenda que agradará a los aficionados al género. Bastante recomendable.

Il gioco non è lunghissimo in termini di durata, ma è godibilissimo.
Le animazioni sono molto carine e i personaggi sono semplicemente adorabili, i versetti e gli strilletti che fanno sono così teneri che si passa buona parte del tempo solo ad ascoltarli, il gioco ha molti momenti umoristici che vi faranno ridere di gusto. Il gameplay è semplice, tutto viene spiegato tramite immagini, sono le espressioni dei personaggi e le animazioni a farvi comprendere la storia e cosa dovete fare, nessun doppiaggio o istruzioni scritte, il gioco è un point & click (punta e clicca) quindi basta il mouse, ma alcune parti permettono di trascinare gli elementi (anzi, sarà indispendabile in alcuni punti).
Pur essendo concepito per un pubblico molto giovane, non è affatto scontato e alcuni momenti si risolvono più con l'astuzia che con ciò che ci si aspetterebbe solitamente da un videogame, siate creativi.
Nota speciale: ve lo godrete anche se avete il triplo dell'età minima per giocarci ahahah! ;D
Avvertenze: potreste trovarlo divertente tanto quanto i vostri figli/nipoti/fratellini/sorrelline, quindi scordatevi di poter mantenere intatta la vostra dignità di adulti, quando riderete sguaiatamente o direte con una vocina ridicola che i protagonisti "sono proprio cariiiini!" XD e fidatevi, succederà.

I loved this game. Beautiful art, relaxing game with a few challenging points--if you're more gifted with mazes/maps than I am, though, you might finish it more quickly! I finished it some time ago and am still thinking about it. I might even play it again to see if I can get 100% of the achievments.

Speaking of, the only two negative points that I found are: 

1) You have to create a save point at the end of each level if you want to go back to try to find creatures for the acheivements. I found most of them just by playing the game, but as there's no list within the game, it's hard to tell without closely scrutinizing the Steam achievements. Didn't realize that I couldn't go back to individual levels until I'd already completed a couple and moved on.

2) There are a couple of annoying sounds that repeat many, many times.

Those are pretty minor points, though, so I'd give Botanicula an overall 9/10. Would definitely recommend.

17035804.review: I cannot express in words my absolute love for this game. As other reviews have said, it's a point-and-click puzzle/adventure game where you play as a group of five little seedlings, each a perfect stereotype of the members of a typical group of friends. For example, the small chestnut-like seedling is the group leader, taking charge of situations and being the one to stand for the group as a whole, whereas the big, kind of walnut-looking one is the stereotypical goofy member of the group, the one who's there for his comic relief and his Hufflepuff heart of gold. For a game with not a single bit of English dialogue, it speaks volumes with the art style, soundtrack (which is phenomenal, by the way), and the movements and actions of each seedling. There's even a strange type of humor, unexplainable in words, that stems from the adorable personalities of the tiny creatures all throughout the game. I've played through Botanicula twice now, and I plan on playing again. The charm this title has, as well as the emotional attachment I've acquired for a handful of seeds, keeps me coming back for more, and that's perfectly fine with me.

17011157.review:
Botanicula is a perfectly thought plant universe; the story takes place essentially in the branches of a tree, and in every board we can observe the life which swarms (a bee which crosses the screen, the wind in leaves, the wildlife which loafs about on branches, etc.). In this way, the whole game is peaceful and pleasant.

The scenario is basic: malefic spiders threaten the vegetable world. Very fortunately, a group of small characters is going to oppose and make everything to save the world!

And it is this band of small characters that you are going to control: Mr. Lantern, the clumsy leader; Mr. Twig, the music lover; Mr. Poppyhead, the acrobat; Mrs Mushroom, the magician; and Mr. Feather, the aerial.

We control all the group of characters at the same time, it will be just necessary to select sometimes one character in particular to carry out an action, but that does not go farther. The objective of levels in levels is to collect objects to get back other objects, change zone or simply beat up spiders. All the actions are thus made with the mouse, both for moving and doing something in particular.

There are no dialogues. We make us the story understand with drawings or dreams

Botanicula is not a really difficult game. Riddles will put only few problems to be resolved. About 3 or 4 hours are required to finish it.

The soundtrack is very pleasant, in particular all the small sound effects which stuff every level (in particular the little "yippee" of our little heroes each time a quest is successful). Visually, it is beautiful and well thought. There is a lot of funny situations, especially because the heroes are, as all the heroes of video games, rather stupid.

Conclusion: Botanicula is a good game experience and a beautiful concept and universe.

5.4 hours to beat, and it was definitely challenging.  I had to watch the walkthrough for a LOT of the puzzles (rather than rage quit!) and I did experience a bug or two, but restarting the game fixed the issue.  I think what this game is sorely lacking is a little "helper" or something to give you a hint when you are stuck.  I hate using walkthroughs (feels like cheating) but I'll do it to get past a part I'm stuck at.  A hint giver would save a lot of people from "cheating" :)

So if you like ridiculousness, cute noises, french canadians? and very challenging puzzles, this game is for you.

16756043.review:
Botanicula vous plonge dans un univers poétique dès les premières minutes de jeu. Ce Point & Click saura vous charmer à tout âge afin d'aider nos petits compagnons à atteindre leur objectif principal : Planter une graine afin de faire naître un nouvel arbre suite à l'attaque d'araignées géantes rappelant un peu les boules de Suif du Studio Ghibli.

Un univers qui semble peint à la main, avec une multitude de petites animations aussi inutiles qu'attrayantes. On se surprendra souvent à essayer de cliquer sur tous les éléments possibles du decors pour voir ce que les créateurs ont pu y attribuer. En passant du comique ou côté mignon tout plein, il y en aura pour tous les goûts. 

Côté bande son, je dirai  que je suis tombée sous le charme, on ne se lasse pas de cette petite musique de fond ni de l'intégralité des petits bruitages que les créateurs ont pu glisser dans leur petit chef-d'oeuvre. La musique accompagne nos petites mascottes, s'adapte également aux différents univers que l'on traverse et aux situations auxquelles nous sommes confrontés. 

Néanmoins, malgré des énigmes attrayantes et farfelues, ce petit Point & Click est malheureusement tellement court ... Je regrette simplement que le jeu ne soit pas plus long avec un peu plus d'univers, puisqu'en 3,4 H de jeu il est possible de le finir (et en prenant son temps, si on rush, je n'imagine pas !). Le seul petit objectif de plus, c'est de recommencer intégralement l'aventure pour essayer d'obtenir les cartes de monstres manquantes pour les succès Steam. Je le recommande donc quand il est en promo, car sinon 10€ pour 3H ce n'est pas très rentable !

16653419.review:
[h1]AT A GLANCE[/h1]
(Full review follows below)

[list]
[*] [b]Game Name:[/b] Botanicula
[*] [b]Original Release:[/b] 2012
[*] [b]Genre Tags:[/b] Point & Click; Adventure; Casual; Puzzle
[*] [b]My Overall Grade:[/b] A-
[*] [b]Estimated Playtime (Campaign):[/b] 4-7 hours
[*] [b]Multiplayer Aspect:[/b] None
[*] [b]Recommended To:[/b] Established fans of the genre; Novelty seekers; Casual gamers
[/list]	

[h1]REVIEW[/h1]
[b]Botanicula[/b] is an incredibly charming, short-and-sweet game which is frequently described as having a “happy” identity.  It is a point-and-click style, casual adventure game that takes you on a wondrous ride through a microcosmic fantasy world inhabited by bugs and critters.  Any fan of point-and-click, adventure-puzzle games will likely enjoy the experience. 

The best feature of this game is the overall charm inherent in its delivery.  The art style and the soundscape together create the alluring atmosphere of the game.  The simple story is told through animations and emotion-filled sounds rather than through text and dialogue.  Despite the simple storytelling mechanics, all the characters you play and those you meet are uniquely interesting and charming.

The actual gameplay requires you to progress the story by solving puzzles via interaction with the world around you.  It will be mostly trial and error; but nothing is too daunting.  I felt the puzzles were a good balance of tricky and sensible; but they are not all necessarily logical.  You will have to think about the puzzles in terms of the wacky game-world dynamics. 

The game is rather short, even shorter if you rush through the main objectives.  It is more enjoyable (and still somewhat short) if you take the time to interact with everything and see what you can discover.  There are plenty of hidden “Easter eggs” and collectibles scattered throughout the game to cater to those who enjoy treasure hunts and achievements.

[b]Botanicula[/b] is definitely a well-designed game that was created with love and care.  I recommend that any point-and-click, adventure-puzzle gamer considering trying it.  Its charm will cater to fans of the genre both young and old.

[i][url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/murphyslawyercuration#curation]Follow my curation page to see more of my recommendations![/url][/i]

16556111.review: Botanicula是有Amanita Design这个捷克独立游戏工作室开发的，而正是由这个工作室开发了享誉世界的《机械迷城（Machinarium）》。而就我个人而言，我认为Botanicula带给我的惊喜相比Machinarium是有过之而无不及。Botanicula中文译名植物精灵，虽然这个译名有点直白，但是还是比较能够切中游戏的主要特色的。同Machinarium一样本作是全手绘画风，这也使的游戏的画面在每一帧甚至是每一个像素上都是精雕细啄。但是不同于Machinarium灰暗破败的背景，本作色彩鲜亮明理，而角色的动作相比Machinarium而言也流畅许多。而剧情方面，也和Machinarium相似，都屌丝拯救世界的故事并最终弘扬了善恶终有报的主题。不过我们的玩家也终于不再是孤军奋战，看着我们的主人公小栗子不畏路途遥远，曲折艰险，坚强护种，而他的小伙伴们也是誓死追随，作者内心不免也有一丝小小的感动(也请大家不要再吐槽三藏师徒了)。当然，这个轻松诙谐的游戏必然不会选择太过沉重的结局。而本作最大的亮点就是期丰富的彩蛋和收集要素，可以毫不客气的说，这使得游戏中的每一个场景都包含这令人兴奋的小宝藏（游戏的难度并不高，但是在没有攻略的情况想要实现全收集还是要花相当的时间的）。顺便提一下，游戏的配乐也是亮点之一，时而空灵时而幽默，这极大程度上加强了本作的体验，只可惜本作没有提供原声音乐。最后总结一句，Amanita Design再次用自己的信念和耐心像我们诠释了什么才是游戏中的艺术品。所以对于这样的游戏，即便是原价购入也是超值的。

16309622.review:
Después de Samorost 2 y Machinarium se esperaba con impaciencia este tercer juego largo de Amanita Design llamado Botanicula, pero el resultado no está a la altura de lo esperado, por lo menos como juego. Dejad que me explique…

Botanicula se trata de una aventura con la misma concepción que los dos juegos antes mencionados: un point-and-click apoyado en la estética particular y atractiva que nos ofrece siempre el estudio checo. Pero aunque este apartado visual es su mayor baza, el conjunto es demasiado simple y lineal, y la dificultad muy baja (el mayor reto consiste en encontrar todos los logros escondidos, pero no hacerlo no influye para nada en el desarrollo del juego).

La temática mezcla el ecologismo y la típica lucha del bien contra el mal, pero salvo por los entornos orgánicos y la originalidad en el diseño de las criaturas (que sí se puede disfrutar) el juego es aburrido. No se conecta con los protagonistas, los puzzles son sencillos en exceso, la duración corta, y la batalla final bastante decepcionante.

¿Lo recomendaría? Sí y no. No es una buena opción como juego, pero la personalidad que destilan todos los diseños de Amanita Design y los guiños a otros de sus juegos siempre merecen la pena. Además es una forma de conseguir que sigan ofreciéndonos sus creaciones. Lo que sí estoy bastante seguro es de que no lo volvería a jugar… para eso prefiero Machinarium o esperar al próximo Samorost 3.

15326170.review:
Materially, this is just a simple point-and-click adventure. It does not open up any new frontiers and it will not burn your brain attempting to solve the puzzles. If you are looking for a deep gameplay experience, look elsewhere.

This game will appeal to people who appreciate the idea of video games as personal art. Not necessarily thoughtful commentaries that "have something to say" about social issues, but rather just as works of reflection, crafted by a creator who actually cares about the work he is producing.

This game is ugly and beautiful at the same time, and strangely compelling in its own way. I felt rewarded when I had completed it. Not really for the sake of the game's story (rudimentary and nebulous at best), but for the sake of having experienced something that other human beings shaped and created for their personal satisfaction, hoping that I, a stranger, might like it too. Sometimes I did, sometimes I didn't. That is art to me.

If the thing I've described above is what you want to see more of in "indie" game design, then spend a couple bucks on this and I think you will be happy.
