Roztomilá vtipná avšak i temná adventura plná juchajících potvůrek potěší nejen Vaši přítelkyni.

Botanicula je svět jenž obývají staří přátelé. Oříšek, houbička, semínko, tobolka a klacek (neberte mě vážně, to jsou pouze jejich pracovní názvy pro tuto recenzi). Věřte mi to nebo ne, ale je to vybraná parta, jejichž strom života ohrožují smrtelní pavoukovci. Zatím co strom začne zmírat pod jejich jedovatou kutikulou, přátelé stromu se pokusí vypravit do centra stromu, aby ho zachránili. Cesta je to velmi dramatická a přitom příjemeně odpočinková. :)

8733974.review: I was pretty sure it would be beautiful, but didn't expect much else from this puzzle adventure game.  I started playing, couldn't stop, was blown away, and kept on playing until I finished it.  It is definitely gorgeous, every character, frame, map, and cut scene was worth prologued gaze.  The story weaves in so many different areas and characters to bring to life this tiny world among the leaves.  Then there's the music, both the background and puzzle derived tunes were fantastic.  I found myself reactivating or not wanting to stop some of the really great numbers.  Each montage and character interaction can surprise with abusrdity, hilarity, depth, sadness, or beauty.  I normally wouldn't write such a serious review, but this little game deserves more.  I highly recommend this gem.

Primero que nada no soy fan de las Aventuras Graficas o juegos tipo Point and Click, pero este en especial fue algo completamente diferente a lo que estaba acostumbrado a ver

[b]Primero los puntos buenos:[/b]

- No existe ningun tipo de dialogo escrito en todo el juego, todo es narrado en base a imagenes lo cual hace una experiencia unica puesto que se entiende a la perfeccion lo que esta pasando
- Existen una enorme cantidad de personajes por todo el juego asi que es muy facil encontrar todo tipo de eventos en cada escena y aun asi perderse bastantes si no se presta demasiada atencion al entorno
- Otra cosa que me gusto fue el hecho de que no solo es hacer click tras click, si no que varias veces es necesario mover el mouse de diferentes maneras para conseguir lo que necesitas, no necesita ningun tipo de tutorial ni nada, todo sale casi de forma intuitiva lo cual lo hace mas divertido aunque es muy facil perderse
- En cuanto a la musica y los efectos de sonido tambien son muy buenos, la musica es una de las mejores que he escuchado en un juego de este tipo y la ambientacion ni se diga, los efectos de sonido muy variados e igual muy buenos (sobre todo cuando gritan de terror)

[b]El unico punto malo[/b] que le veo es que es algo corto pero tiene bastante contenido para entretener por un rato y desde mi punto de vista, bien vale el dinero gastado.

[b]Mi recomendacion es comprenlo!!!![/b], harto de los juegos AAA o de lo mismo de siempre?, prueben este no se arrepentiran, incluso si no les gustan las aventuras graficas o Point-and-Click, puede que piensen muy diferente despues de jugarlo ;D.

8678705.review:
Amanita Design es un estudio que siempre se ha caracterizado por dos cosas: la belleza artística de sus juegos, y el clasicismo de sus mecánicas. Machinarium es quizás su obra maestra y una perfecta síntesis de ambos conceptos. Con Botanícula quisieron ir un paso más allá en el camino de la experimentación y la jugada les salió bien tirando a regular.

La puesta en escena de Botanícula es impecable. Es un juego muy hermoso a nivel visual y sonoro, es simpático y su arte conceptual es extremadamente original. Donde falla, sin embargo es en la jugabilidad. No es que falle en el sentido en que no cumple lo que pretende, es más bien que lo que pretende no acaba de sostener bien el juego.

Botanícula es abiertamente inocente. Infantil si se quiere, pero maduro al ser consciente de ello. Por eso busca que el jugador haga click en todo lo que le llame la atención. La mecánica básicamente consiste en hacer click en todo lo clickable para ir superando unos puzzles que muchas veces funcionan mediante el método ensayo y error. Y aquí reside el problema: en trasladar esa inocencia a la esencia jugable del título. 

Por tanto, como juego Botanicula es original pero muy normalito. Sin embargo, como experiencia audiovisual y artística es muy notable. Es un título sobrevalorado, pero su riesgo y el cariño que desprende pueden merecer una oportunidad.

8677899.review:

8665384.review: This is definitely one of the most psychadelicly creative games I have ever played. You play as five charcters at once, and they are, as far as I can tell, a nut, a big nut, a stick, a mushroom, and a gnat. Each has unique abilities that are used sometimes to solve puzzles, although this mostly comes into play in the beginning of the game. The level and art design are superb and pretty much every puzzle I solved was a delight. There were a few moments where the puzzle design was tedious, but that happens with pretty much every adventure-type game like this. For the most part, the items you get have obvious uses and you don't have a giant inventory of items that you have to try in different combinations to find the solution. Most of the puzzle solving is based on clicking on the environment and moving your mouse to affect it. Your mouse movements affect the environement in this game (making the flowers move in the breeze, etc.) and this mechanic is often used for puzzle solving. I highly recommend this game!

8627116.review:
Insect-themed animation bliss.

Botanicula brings back the tightly-focused whimsy of Samorost and Machinarium, but unlike this studio's previous titles, it tells a story that is more about a cast of characters than a place. The most wonderful part of Botanicula is the group of unusual critters whom the player controls. Their animations convey so much character, you sometimes forget you've never heard them speak.

Botanicula is a very quick game, but like Machinarium and Samorost 1 and 2, it's gorgeous, tightly themed, and challenging without being frustrating. It's good for pretty much any audience-- including non-gamers-- and has a beautiful soundtrack, too. Very highly recommended.

8609198.review:
Botanicula - забавная point-n-click игруха, доступная для детей начиная с возраста 7+. Проще и короче, чем Машинариум, который делала та же студия. У взрослого человека прохождение занимает примерно 4-5 часов. Увлекательна примерно на это же время. Диалогов в игре нет, задания и история подаются визуально и звуками эмоций героев. В процессе игры накапливается большое количество карточек с анимированными изображениями встреченных персонажей, некоторые из которых можно получить будучи очень дотошным. К сожалению,  прогресс в игре не сопровождается выпадением карточек в steam, из которых можно было бы собрать значок. Анимация в игре на мой вкус очень хороша и оригинальна, звуковое сопровождение тоже неплохое (психоделика), но не производит неизгладимого впечатления. Решение загадок не утомляет, но и доставляет весьма умеренно.
Больше всего радуют мелочи, которые дарит игра при закликивании интерактивных элементов.

Рекомендую всем, кто хочет приятно скоротать время.

挺不错的一款小游戏，没有文字，不需要用文字和解说来解释剧情。画面和音乐也尚可，就是游戏是基于 Adobe AIR 的Flash，然后Overlay就启用不了，成就进度也看不见。中文字体也略过于猎奇，不过这都不是很影响游戏。

An endearing point-and-click game with a story told completely (and wonderfully) through visuals. Sometimes the puzzles can be a little tricky and there were a few times where I got stuck and had to look up a walkthrough, but for the most part just exploring and examining things led me to the correct answers. The world is enjoyable to explore and is populated with a myriad of other creatures that add more depth and character to the world. I actually laughed out loud at multiple points when a new creature appeared or when an event in the game happened.

I love this game and heartily recommend it to anyone who enjoys point-and-click adventure games, anyone who likes things that are different from main-stream, anyone who likes exploring game worlds and finding all the hidden secrets, and everyone else.

8410676.review:
As with Machinarium, the developers managed to tell another charming and delightful story. 

Explore many parts of the 'world' as five friends get together trying to save it along with other creatures in it. The game is purely visual and audio. No text to hand hold you along the way, which encourages the player to interpret the story on their own. However, the unique artistic approach combined with fluid animation and whimsical, yet ambient, soundtrack is intrinsic to what makes this an awesome experience from start to finish. 

The game doesn't last very long, but the journey is definitely worth the time. Consider getting this when it's on sale if your budget is tight and wants something light and flavorful..

8227556.review:
First of all, I'll say that I didn't really enjoy this game. But I can appreciate the effort that was put into it, and I must say that the final product couldn't be much better than it is, I'd say. But it's not my kind of game.

If your familiar with Amanita's games, you'll know this already, but the highly stylized world and characters is their main focus. Like its predecessors, it's a point n' click game, and it has the same problems I have with nearly every game in the genre: you simply click everything on the screen until something happens. And that's not fun for me. It doesn't matter how pretty the world is, that alone simply isn't enough to captivate me. 
On the other hand, if you enjoy these kinds of games, you'll most likely be amazed with this! The amount of detail put into the "bugs/creatures" and the environments is mesmerizing, and I have to give them credit for that. Amanita Design strikes again!

It's a shame that they always do point n' click games. I'm always impressed with their world design and charming way of memorably presenting simple stories... But the gameplay really lacks, with the amount of downtime there is between traversing from a screen to another.
Also, level design was a bit too labyrinthic in levels 2 and 3, having huge areas for the player to go back and forth to get different objects to progress. That's something that wouldn't be as bad if there was something to the gameplay other than clicking an edge of the screen and waiting for the little guys to walk there.


Aside from the traditional gameplay, there are some animated scenes, which are really great, one even representing how the "Amanita Universe" was created, with the Big Bang and both Samorost and Machinarium worlds forming. I feel like I would have enjoyed "seeing" a let's play of this game, rather than playing. They've scored everything in this, except for the gameplay.
The soundtrack fits the game's aesthetic very well, so I simply can't have any complaints about its presentation, it's amazing.

So, if you like point n' click games, go ahead, you'll have a blast! Otherwise, don't expect this to change your mind.

9/10

A group of small organisms try to stop the evil bacteria-spider-things that are taking over their tree in this delightful adventure by Amanita Design.  What captured me most was the soundtrack and incredible amount of sound effects that make the world richly diverse.  As I traveled from frame to frame, some of the puzzles made me feel as though I was interacting with a painting.  And as I solved some of the puzzles, I felt a sense of wonder and interconnectedness as I discovered a large network of unique characters.  By the end of the story (which is told with no written or spoken word that we understand) I became eager to play other games by the same studio.

8076923.review:
総プレイ時間は4時間程度。ポイント＆クリック形式のアドベンチャーゲームで、特に煩雑に感じることもなく気軽に進められるゲームである。

まるでおとぎ話の中に飛び込んだかのようなほんわかとした世界観と、現実には見たこともないようなコミカルなキャラクター達が、物語のあちこちでプレイヤーと出会うのを今か今かと待っている。

美しく描かれたグラフィックの中に怪しい部分があったり、生き物がいたりしたらとことんクリックしてみるといいかもしれない。新たな出会いがある度に実績が解除されていくというのも、なんだかプレイの動機付けになっているような気がして、ついつい真剣になって探してしまう自分がいた。

この物語の中に一度飛び込んで気がつくことは、言葉が何一つ出てこないことだ。主人公達が冒険の中でわーわーきゃーきゃー一喜一憂するのをのほほんと――まるで幼稚園の学芸会で演技する我が子を温かく見守るように――眺めるだけでいい。対応言語がプレイへの二の足を踏んでしまうことはないので、気軽にプレイできるというのは実はとてもポイントが高いところではないだろうか。

物語の進行はパズルを解いていく形式で、すべてクリックによって行われるのだが、難解というところはないものの、解法に気がつくまでに時間を要する部分もあった。それは私自身が鈍かっただけなのかもしれないが、言葉による説明がないというのが良くも悪くも作用してしまったというところであろうか。しかし、些細なヒントに気がつくことが出来れば悩むことなどないので、鋭い人ならばすいすいと進められるはずだ。

畢竟するに、面白くはあるものの、鮮烈さや、派手さは、お世辞にも備わっているとは言いがたいし、万人に勧められるものではない。
しかしながら、例えば、家路の途中で、ふといつもとは違う道を通ってみたくなり、「ああ、この道はこんなところににつながっていたんだな……」なんて些細な発見で、しみじみと感慨にふけってしまうような方には、きっと満足して頂けるのではないだろうか。

8057653.review:
Bien que les jeux d'aventure soient morts pour certains, Amanita Design récidive après le fabuleux Machinarium, en offrant avec Botanicula, une fenêtre sur le monde déjanté de la nature et des insectes.

Le petit studio basé en République tchèque présente dans sa tradition un jeu d'aventure du style pointer et cliquer. Botanicula suit une bande de rigolos insectes et végétaux à travers leur quête pour sauver l'arbre, qui leur sert de maison, d'araignées maléfiques. Le monde qu'ils ont créé est bien singulier. Artistiquement, il se distingue de tout ce qu'on voit présentement sur le marché. Les personnages sont drôles et parfaitement animés, les environnements, colorés et originaux. Sur le plan musical, le jeu se démarque tout autant. La bande-sonore est entraînante et vous fera questionner sur le nombre de sons pouvant être produits par une bouche humaine. Elle évoque aussi bien les thèmes de la nature et crée ainsi une atmosphère particulière tout au long de l'aventure. Botanicula a un charme certain qui le distingue du jeu d'aventure typique.

Toutefois, le genre a ses défauts dont il est parfois difficile de se distancer. D'abord, à certains points, il est difficile de savoir comment progresser. Il est par exemple facile de manquer certains objets qui permettraient d'avancer. Malheureusement, le système d'indice que présentait Machinarium, bien que rudimentaire, n'est pas présent dans Botanicula. On peut cependant utiliser une carte qui permet de se retrouver facilement. Le jeu est aussi très court, il ne vous en durera que quelques heures et n'offre pas vraiment de raison d'y retourner une deuxième fois. On notera que le jeu n'offre pas de casse-tête ou d'énigme bien complexes, il ne faut que résoudre des situations ponctuelles qui permettent de faire avancer l'histoire.

Ne jouez pas à Botanicula simplement pour le terminer. Il faut le savourer, admirer chacun des tableaux, écouter sa musique et explorer chacun des recoins de ce petit bijou.

Points positifs

+ Drôle et charmant
+ Bande-sonore originale
+ Très accessible

Points négatifs

- Pas de système d'indice
- Facile de rester pris
- Plutôt court

If I were to describe this game with one word, it would be: adorable. Botanicula is a simple, funny and lighthearted tale about many, many creatures, whose peaceful lives among the tree's branches are endangered by sinister Zlo, and their only hope is a mismatched, brave team of main heroes, on quest to plant the seed of a new tree...

Puzzles mostly follow the trend of increasing difficulty toward the end of the game, but aren't challenging to the point of frustration. Gameplay is very pleasant - interactions between various characters are humorous, and enthusiasm of our little heroes is quite catching.

Background music perfectly suits the mood set by the story. Graphics give me somewhat nostalgic feeling, reminding of some old cartoons and causing to find them mostly cute :)

If you're not averse to simple point'n'click games, you should play Botanicul - it's a lovely adventure :)

7994864.review:
Botanícula es un videojuego de los que dejan huella. Una aventura que simplifica el concepto jugable a hacer click en todas partes, hasta que comprendes su concepto y te das cuenta de que no es tan "de ese modo". Al principio resulta confuso por su particular mecánica de juego y la ausencia de cualquier tipo de explicaciones pero a medida que vas avanzando todo tiene mucho más sentido. Los toques de humor te sacan una sonrisa de vez en cuando y la banda sonora acompaña fantasticamente a la experiencia de jugarlo.

Pros:
- Gran diseño visual.
- Muy buena banda sonora.
- Momentos simpáticos.

Contras:
- Al principio es muy confuso.
- Cuando le pillas el truco es muy fácil.
- No muy duradero, aunque conseguir todos los logros pueda alargarlo.

Conclusión:
Botanícula es un juego peculiar no apto para todo el mundo, pero estas apuestas diferentes y arriesgadas son las que, bajo mi punto de vista, le dan vida a esta industria. A los que les gusten los juegos diferentes deberían probarlo, sobre todo estando en oferta, ya que destila arte por todas partes.

Puntuación: 7/10

Juegazo. Cosas que se pueden decir de este juego:

No es una aventura gráfica al uso, como machinarium, consiste más bien en minijuegos con puzzles para cada pantalla. Al jugarlo me ha recordado a una aventura interactiva de un juego del Qujote que también clickeando en determinados pixeles de la pantalla ocurrían eventos.

El apartado gráfico es atípico, mezcla escenas bellas con elementos de imágenes reales dando una especie de contraste muy raro (a mí personalmente este estilo no me gusta, pero en Botanicula no queda mal debido a lo atípico de todo su planteamiento).

Lo mejor sin duda es la OST unida a los efectos sonoros y al arte gráfico. Le da 10sentidos y emociones que la música por sí sola no tiene, si jugáis al juego y luego escucháis la OST entenderéis lo que os digo.

En definitiva, un juego que recomiendo disfrutar.

7938708.review:
[h1]Botanicula або гуртом і паразита легше бити.[/h1]

Про "Botanicula" я дізнався ще до її виходу. На одному з сайтів новин про ігри я помітив красиві й яскраві скріншоти, які одразу ж привернули мою увагу до статті. Вже в самій новині йшлося, що Amanita Design працюють над створенням нової квест гри, в центрі якої будуть 5 чудернацьких рослин-чоловічків (далі додавалося кілька зображень та роликів). 

Нагадаю, що Amanita Design це та команда розробників, яка відповідальна за створення пригодницького квесту про роботів "Machinarium" (дуже гарний квест хто не в курсі). Вже цих фактів було достатньо, щоб підігріти інтерес до нового проекту чеської команди.

Навесні, 2012 року, гра вийшла в світ. Звісно ж я не міг собі відмовити в тому, щоб зіграти в цей новий квест. Від проходження гри я отримав навіть більше задоволення, ніж очікував. Тепер по порядку.

Спочатку перед нами постає велетенське чарівне дерево. Воно величаво височіє над землею, але в той же час дерево випромінює ауру спокою та захищеності. Його плоди якраз дозріли, але замість того, щоб потрапити в землю і прорости, їх пожирає велетенське чорне створіння-паразит. Злий поганець жадібно спустошує одну гілку за другою. І от, діставшись до самісінької верхівки, щоби поласувати останньою насіниною, вона падає, залишаючи паразита ні з чим. За щасливим збігом обставин насінина падає на голову Ліхтарика (перший герой з дружньої п'ятірки). Зернятко просить допомогти йому дістатися землі, де зможе прорости новим деревом. Ліхтарик, не гаючи ні хвилини, кличе всіх своїх найближчих друзів із сусідніх гілок і вони, вже вп'ятьох, відправляються в загадкову подорож по материнському дереву.

П`ятірку героїв чекає цікава й захоплива місія, яка невдовзі переросте в цілу пригоду, сповнену небезпеками, цікавими зустрічами й просто дуже кумедними ситуаціями! Нашим сміливцям по дорозі зустрінуться інші, як дружелюбні, так і вороже налаштовані мешканці чарівного дерева. Щоб пройти гру, потрібно буде розв'язати не одну головоломку, допомогти не одному мешканцю чарівного дерева, а також перемогти лихих паразитів, які вже напали на дерево і почали творити безлад.

Мальовничі краєвиди та весела музика створюють спокійну, розслаблюючу атмосферу. Amanita Design додали не одну комедійну сценку в гру, які, як мінімум, змусять вас посміхнутися. Недоліком гри можна назвати хіба що легкість пазлів. Якщо порівняти головоломки "Botanicula" і, вже згадуваної мною, "Machinarium", то в другій гравцю доводилося не один раз помізкувати над тим чи іншим проходженням. Але легкість задач аж ніяк не вплине на задоволення від проходження гри.

[u]Висновок.[/u] "Botanicula" - гра, сповнена теплою атмосферою та добром. Якщо вам подобаються квест-ігри або просто хороші ігри, обов'язково зіграйте в "Botanicula". Не пошкодуєте.

Спеціально для групи [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/IndependentClub]"Незалежний Клуб Оглядачів"[/url].

Quirky and Playful Casual Game, with interesting puzzles and a keen artistic sensibility.  I really enjoyed playing through it, and it's the perfect thing for a rainy day when you need a pick-me-up. Give this game to someone who:  likes a well-crafted puzzle game and/or needs a few hours of happy computer time.

L' albero della vita è minacciato dai esseri maligni (smog?) che stanno sconvolgendo la biodiversità di questo luogo sacro. 5 amici hanno deciso di cercare un nuovo seme per piantarlo in una nuova zona in modo da continuare il ciclo naturale. 
è un puzzle game molto creativo e divertente ricco di animazioni e creature stilizzate copiate dalla natura stessa. Il gameplay si basa sull' interazione con l' interfaccia (si usa solo il mouse) risolvendo enigmi non troppo complicati. 
La pecca è che la storia dura poco per cui è un gioco che bisogna gustarselo nei mini dettagli e passando il tempo in relax con musiche divertenti, disegni ben curati e tanto buon senso. Il primo gioco che si avvicina molto all' ambiente naturale e alla sua preservazione. Da giocare.

7825215.review:
A Amanita é o Tim Burton dos jogos eletrônicos, com uma visão bem autoral e bizarra do universo, mas sem o Johnny Depp, e com um pendor para o lúdico. Por outro lado, e isto pode ser visto como um ponto negativo por alguns, seus jogos não são difíceis, apresentando uma jogabilidade tranquila só usando o mouse e puzzles que até um fracassado em adventures como eu consegue dar conta. A Amanita está mais preocupada em apresentar um mundo mágico e exótico do que em desafiar o jogador.

Em Botanicula, usando um enredo que não tem falas ou texto de qualquer espécie, conta a saga de um grupo de criaturinhas que moram em uma árvore e precisam alcançar o solo para plantar uma semente e vencer uma invasão de sinistras aranhas negras que estão sugando toda a vida do lugar. É um conto de fadas moderno repleto de encontros inusitados. Quase tudo nos cenários pode ser clicado e cada clique revela um efeito surpreendente ou um novo tipo de habitante da mesma árvore. É possível coletar "cartas" dos seres encontrados, mas isso não é importante para o desenvolvimento da história, funcionando mais como um diário de viagem. A fauna que habita a grande árvore de Botanicula é mesmo o grande charme da aventura.

Em alguns momentos, é preciso escolher qual dos personagens controlados pelo jogador irá interagir com um determinado enigma. Os resultados costumam ser hilários, dependendo do personagem selecionado. Senti falta de mais oportunidades explorando essas diferenças entre as criaturinhas, mas é minha única reclamação em uma experiência quase onírica. Isso e o amendoim de capacete que não aceita perder na corrida de besouros...

A atenção nos detalhes está presente até mesmo nas Conquistas do Steam. Com nomes como Dzin, Hrouda e Krotitel e sem descrição alguma na maioria das vezes, elas não aparecem durante o jogo, não quebram a imersão e você nem mesmo sabe por que conseguiu elas! Em contrapartida, tenho uma lista imensa delas bloqueadas que jamais saberei como conseguir. Não que isso importe.

7762920.review:
A Hold banán alakú, Armstrongot pedig annak a nyelve falta fel, a Mikulás pedig valójában egy asztmás csúszómászó – a Botaniculában szerzett tapasztalatok a való életre nehezen vetíthetőek vissza, az viszont biztos, hogy egy fával és annak szabad szemmel láthatatlan lakóival még sose volt olyan szoros a viszonyom, mint itt, a két-három órás kaland alatt. A szerethetően furcsa, különös és egyedi stílus a Botanicula esetében egyáltalán nem meglepő a cseh Amanita Design előtörténetét ismerve: a játékmenethez alapot nyújtó, de kevéssé ismert Samorost mellett mindenképp a Machinarium egyedi, írott vagy kimondott szavakat, dialógusokat nem használó megközelítése dominál itt is. Ennek megfelelően a Botanicula is hangulatjáték, ahol fájdalmasan szerethető, a rajzfilmgyártás aranykorát idézően jól kidolgozott karakterek és furcsa lények egész sokasága viszi a hátán az eseményeket. Abból is akad bőven, az itteni világ ugyanis haldoklik, az életteret nyújtó fát is elérni látszik a végzet a mindent elpusztító, mindenkit felfaló parazita-sereg képében. Az apró lények nem hősnek születtek, de az ötfős minisereg (Mr. Gomba, Mr. Mákvirág, Mr. Toll, Mr. Ág és Mr. Lámpás) a saját irhájának megmentése után rögtön a probléma gyökere után ered, hol akaratlanul, hol szándékosan.

Történetük nem túl hosszú, két-három óra alatt kitakarítható a fa, de az a délután garantáltan feledhetetlen lesz. Játéknak rettenetesen egyszerű, kizárólag egy egérgombra és némi türelemre van szükség. Nincsenek nagy fejtörést okozó logikai feladványok, szerteágazó párbeszédek, pixelkeresgélés, hülyén kombinálható tárgyak: ez a kalandjátékok legtisztább, legletisztultabb változata, ahol maga az út a lényeg és nem valami misztikum felderítése. Itt még egy gilisztából is lehet sztár, egy csirkéből is ártatlan áldozat, a Mikulás pedig nem szakállas öregember, hanem egy feltűnően komoly tüdőgonddal küzdő rovarszerűség, aki ajándék helyett a továbbjutás kulcsát hajigálja.

Kulcsból és más felvehető tárgyból márpedig akad, a hat pályára, valójában pedig száznyi képernyőre osztott játéktéren mindig valami akadály áll előttünk. Valahol kulcsokat kell összeszedni, valahol egy szétszakított család tagjait kell egy helyszínre cibálni, az utolsó harmadban viszont már a túlélés veszi át a szerepet. A Botanicula ennek ellenére nem egy könnyű játék, útmutatást egyáltalán nem ad, kihajít a maga mikro-világába és elvárja, hogy minden képernyőt végignézz, minden szereplőt megismerj, vagy legalább találkozz velük. A baja ebből fakad, rengeteg olyan képernyő akad, amely nem rendelkezik funkcióval – a megbökdöshető állatok és növényeknek sokszor csak kirakatszerep jut, de ez csak sok kínlódás, ezernyi kattintás után derül ki, elterelve ezzel az igazi megoldástól. Fájó, hogy az öt zseniális karakter se kényszerül rá sokszor arra, hogy együtt dolgozzon. Van, hogy kollektíven, egymást segítve kell egy-egy helyzetben boldogulniuk, de nem elégszer – ebben sokkal több lehetőség lapult.

Fogást találni ezen kívül mégis lehetetlen a Botaniculán. Ez az a játék, ahol az első perctől az utolsóig fülig érő mosollyal, hatalmas jókedvvel kattintgatod végig a történetet, mert felnevetsz azon, mikor a csapat a sikert juhézással és ugrálással ünnepli, vagy ha a Benny Hill showt idéző menekülésbe fognak. Imádni fogod a fantasztikus zenéjéért, ahol a neszek és a zajok kakofóniája barátságos káoszt teremt. Meg fogsz őrülni a tarka világáért, ahol centinként botlasz eszelősen őrült karakterekbe és helyzetekbe. Néha keresgélni kell a zsenialitást, néha viszont ott van az ember orra előtt - ebben az esetben alig egy országgal arrébb!

7756055.review:
Buy This:
If you love adventure games
If you're interested in unique and amazing sound and art design
If you love smiling

If you want to have a silly grin on your face for three or four hours, play this game. Botanicula is a point and click adventure game with zero dialogue, but one of the more charming cast of characters and plots that I've ever experienced. This is achieved through brilliant art direction and a fabulous symphony of sounds all recorded by voice from the band DVA. 

When their home is threatened by evil spider creatures, five insect friends band together against all odds to save the day. Their journey will take the player from the upper branches of their tree home down to the bowels of insect hell. All along they're introduced to some of the most fun and unique characters I've ever experienced in a game.

The game is on the short side at about 4 hours, but in the end it seemed the perfect length. I was just happy from start to finish, and it was absolutely money well spent.

Chacun a une capacité qui permettra de résoudre une énigme ou de réaliser une interaction avec le décor pour avancer. The original soundtrack and sound effects are created by Czech alternative band DVA.

7553101.review: What a great little game.  I'll admit that I started playing this as it looked like an easy 100% (which it is), but I was amazed at how quickly it drew me in.  Sure it's cutesy and the hardcore gamer (whatever that means anymore) may scoff at it, but do yourself a favor and set aside 3-4 hours for this.  It's funny, it's charming, it will brighten your day - it's kind of like playing a Pixar movie.  It's not a traditional point and click, but if you've played Machinarium or the Samorost series you know what to expect (basically click on everything enough times - but there are a few decent puzzles).  The only sticking point may be the price tag: $10 seems like it might be a bit much for 3-4 hours (I believe I got this in a humble bundle at some point).  But I know I will click through this again at some point just for the music alone.

7297249.review:
Botanicula is an interesting point-and-click puzzle game. It's relaxing and charming, and somewhat rewarding. I enjoyed my time playing Botanicula, and the soundtrack really compliments the bright art style.

This short and sweet puzzler is one of the good onces, and for that it deserves a spot in your library.

I picked up Botanicula for $0.25 (one of four games in a $1 bundle) and the 5 hours of enjoyment I got out of it are worth at least twenty times that. If this goes on sale for 50% of it's current price, you should get it.

The absence of Steam Cloud support isn't an issue either, because the game is short and once you know what to do, you can finish it within an hour. The achievements are all simple and if you get all the in game collectibles (cards) you should unlock all of them. The rest are progression based. Estimated time to completion would be between 4 and 6 hours.

1692658.review:
One of my favourite games and possibly the most enjoyable in the point and click adventure genre. Everything has been designed so beautifully (in ways words cannot describe). Its visually stunning, the characters are funny, memorable and loveable and the soundtrack is amazing. The levels/ environments are fluid, organic and interesting (you'll be clicking on everything). You are rewarded with animated collectable character & creature cards for exploring the world and interacting with stuff... and you won't get bored of seeing the same things over and over, as the surroundings change at nearly every screen. The diversity is truly astounding. The pace of the game is good too, meaning you are not stuck at the same screen trying to solve a puzzle for ages, but not moving so quick as to miss the hidden gems and soak in the scenery. 

To contrast the beautiful lively 'spring-like' levels, there are also darker and more isolated spaces, which relate to the story. The story is simple yet brilliant, and it is told in an interesting way without even uttering a word. It's one of those games that's fairly challenging at times but without being too frustrating. The puzzles are enjoyable and make me laugh, rather than them feeling like a chore to complete. It certainly makes me smile... and at many points its just so beautiful and amazing, it might just make you all teary eyed with sheer joy.  :)

I honestly can't find anything wrong with this game... it really is a wonderful experience. Would highly reccomend. The game is by Amanita design, and I bought it in the Amanita Bundle with Samorost 2 and Machinarium, two other masterpieces to play through.   :)  

- 10/10 -

Все подается с юмором и без лишней умственной нагрузки, ведь это даже и не квест с хитроумными загадками. Все задачки решаются в два счета, решение, как правило, всегда лежит на поверхности. Яркие цвета и умиротворяющая музыка сильно увеличивают порог погружения в игру, которую проходишь в одно дыхание. После Botanicula заново захотелось перепройти и Саморосты, и Машинариум. 4878558.review:
A game that has and needs no words. You are the inhabitants of a large tree that is the home of around fifty species of insect. However a terrible evil is taking hold of the vegetation and draining its roots leaving only despair. A team of brave insects assemble to adventure down into the depths of the tree and into the belly of the beast, solving puzzles along the way. Rather than playing as a single character, you are descending the tree as the whole group of creatures, choosing different characters to complete different puzzles until you reach your goal.
Despite the dark nature of the story, the game handles it well delivering a feel good experience. Just about all the sound effects in the game are made by the human voice, with a few pieces of percussion filling the gaps. Each area has its own theme and some areas have a friendly sort of warmth made up by the scenery and soundtrack.
 As much as this game is more important than life itself, breaks in gameplay would be advised, since the objectives do get tedious after a little while of hunting for the next meaningful object that you need to fetch for the little munchkins who are not proactive enough to get for themselves. The most memorable one is the mission to hunt down fourteen small ostriches to pedal the turbines to make a huge hot air balloon float of into the air, so a species of hairy-looking creatures can escape to the skies. 
All in all though, it’s a beautiful game visually and soundwise which I would rate very highly indeed.

Сразу понравилась Samorost, так и каждая новая игра затягивает все сильнее, несмотря на простоту управления. В мёртвом Machinarium непонятен был смысл существования робота-железяки, а вот тут — жёлудь, орешек, грибочек, веточка и мушка преисполнены желанием сохранить семя родного деревца, утаив его от паукообразных пожирателей бытия. Композитор Дворжак (однофамилец!) тоже на высоте.

4324452.review:
Following the very grounded release of Machinarium, Botanicula seems much closer to Amantia Design's beginnings. Machinarium was a much more somber view of a machine's wasteland, it also used more traditional means of gameply (solve everything to continue, whether through traditiona puzzles or point and click cleverness). Botanicula is a much more vibrant world and takes a different approach to its gameplay. Though there are plenty of puzzles that can be solved without too much headscratching, there are also little secrets and optional creatures to encounter. 

Botanicula is both a beautiful and strange world. Though some objects and settings are recognizable (such as a tree, seed, insects) everything is so alive and full of wonder. Accompanying the superb artwork of the game, are the sounds of Czech band DVA. The music in this game is full of suitably strange and wild tones. Chimes, bells, vocal gymnastics, strings, and just about anything else finds its way into the soundtrack. The music and sound design are perfect for this game.

Amantia Design has put together a menagerie of sights and sounds that is completely unforgettable. Botanicula is a trip well worth taking.

Вся беда героев в том что зло поглощает их мир то есть деревья и все живое. В лице злодеев выступают пауки жуки итд. Игра вообще интересная и сложная. 288970.review:
Like all Amanita Design games, the visuals are superb, the music is beautiful and imaginative, and the story is cute.

They've created a fantastic and deep world here.

However, like all point & click adventures, it suffers from some obtuse/arbitrary puzzles that can kill enjoyment. Some puzzles require simply clicking the same object N-number of times. Will it be once, four times, seven times, or even over ten (yes, that happens)? Furthermore, many objects require this constant tending in order to be completely released/use. Combine this with the typical pixel-hunt these types of games are notorious for, and you have a recipe for missing things you really shouldn't have missed.

That being said, there is such a wonderful quality to the game. I find myself constantly smiling at the sounds and sights of the world of Botanicula.

I'm not sure why, but it seems to have captured my imagination in a way few things have.

A wonderful game with stellar art, awesome music, and a charm that can't be denied.

Give it a go, and have some smiles.

3195160.review:
Botanicula absolutely explodes with creativity. Every new area is a treat for the eyes, and the myriad creatures your posse encounters are each uniquely designed and characterized. There are a host of mini-puzzles to solve, and many of the tree-creatures have small objectives for you to accomplish. You'll be tasked to find a yellow blob's missing eye, to rescue an ostrich from being dinner for a family of four, to race a ladybug during a quest to win a prize helmet, and far more. 

The amount of originality in Botanicula is stunning, and there's even a Machinarium cameo for Amanita fans. As the game is only a few hours long, it's a delightful experience that shouldn't be missed.

Здесь мы играем за: маковую коробочку, грибочек, перо, фонарик и веточку. Звучит странно, но игра стоит того чтоб в неё поиграли! Сюжет игры прост, мы должны спасти дерево, на котором живут сказочные существа, от каких то злых паразитов, которые уничтожают дерево. Это даже не игра, а какая та волшебная сказка, в который присутствует: хороший сюжет, красочные пейзажи, красивый саундтрек и море позитива.

Another gem from the studio that crafted Machinarium, Botanicula hearkens back to Amanita Design's roots with the Samarost games.  Charmingly abstract and whimsical, the dreamlike tree-world and its assorted organic creatures will quickly whisk you away to a land with a more vivid imagination than most.

While Machinarium was more challenging and puzzle-focused, I really liked the brighter, more lively feel of Botanicula as a game (despite clocking it in one evening).  If you like adventure games and are ready to accept the whimsical, then allow Botanicula to take you on a journey beyond your wildest imaginative fantasies.

Tato point&click puzzle adventura je o partě "botanických" tvorečků (různá semínka a klacíky). Zápletka je jako obvykle jednoduchá, na stromě, který je v podstatě jejich celým světem a domovem, naši malí hrdinové čelí přicházejícímu temnému parazitu, pod kterým vše hyne. 747490.review:
The sorta kinda well-not-really sequel to the popular Machinarium. Except this time it isn't about scrap and robots but nature and what lives on a tree.

You play as Mr. Lantern and his 4 friends who are trying to save their home, a giant tree, from a parasitic spider-like creature that sucks out the life of said tree and its inhabitants. To do that, they need to bring a seed of the tree down to the ground, a journey that takes them to many interesting locations, situations and characters that are just plain charming and fun to watch. Such as when you encounter a genie and every character has to make a wish, one of them creating a Ferris wheel while the soundtrack by the Hungarian band DVA acoustically stimulates your endorphin production. 

The puzzles are much simpler than in Machinarium which actually view as an improvement. I remember getting frustrated with some of the puzzles in that game and even more with the tip function that required you to get past a little shoot-em-up every time you wanted to take a look. On top of that it also had a tendency to just freeze up which is a natural occurrence when you make a game in Flash that is more ambitious and complex than the usual array of games made with it.

Luckily Botanicula doesn't suffer from any of those problems. There are just a few items here and there, other than that the puzzles can be usually solved on the same screen, just like Amanita Design's first two games, Samorost 1 and 2.

The many achievements might lead you to think that Botanicula is rather long, but that isn't the case. The 6 chapters can be played through in about half an hour each. The achievements are related to a little card collecting feature: each new character or creature you meet will give you its card and unlock the corresponding achievement. The majority are mandatory to meet in order to finish the game, but some are optional and require you to find them.

I played the game with such a huge grin on my face. I haven't been charmed by a game like this in a very long time. Easily one of my favorite games of 2012.

3800744.review:
Botanicula is an unique 2D point and click puzzle adventure from Amanita Design, the creators of Machinarium and Samorost.

The story is simple: "It’s about a bunch of five friends - little tree creatures who set out for a journey to save the last seed from their home tree which is infested by evil parasites. ". That pretty much sums it up and is everything you need to know.

On your journey you come across a huge (really huge) variety of other creatues. With nearly all of them you can interact in some way, sometimes just for the fun of it but mostly to actually solve any of the numerous puzzles in the game. Nearly anything in the game you interact with produces some sort of animation, often causing cool animations or hilarious slapstick shows, so there's definitely no lack of humour in Botanicula.

The visual art style and design of the creatures and the world is incredibly unique and definitely stands out from the masses. It seems bizarre at first, but the longer you play the game, the more you notice that this is the absolutely perfect choice for an art style. Anything else would've probably limited Amanita Design in their creativity and simply make Botanicula yet another point and click puzzle game.

Sound and music also plays a big role in the game. Often you come across a group of creatures which, if interacted properly with, start singing or playing music on their crazy instruments. The music perfectly fits the overall style of the game and provides you with a feel-good feeling. Additionally, most of the sound effects like jumping, falling, bumping and so on are self-recorded by actual people (imagine yourself being a kid and playing with action figures or space ships: pew pew, wooosh, boing, zappp - stuff like that). Once again, artificial sound effects would probably just not work out in this game.

With roughly 3 hours, the game isn't exceptionally long, but once you get into it, you will enjoy every single second of the game. Apart from the fact that the Steam Overlay doesn't seem to work with the game, there's really nothing bad I could say about this Botanicula.

It's unique, detailed, funny, mildly challenging and overall one of the best Indie games I've played in a while. Definitely worth checking out!

407950.review: An extremely charming puzzle game that's great for relaxing.

3592340.review:
Oh noes, it's over already :(
I should have picked this one up immediately when it came out; the design told me so. The reason I didn't - I guess - was (apart from me hoping it would be in an indie bundle) that I couldn't imagine how gameplay would fit into this when I saw the trailer. And to be honest, the game doesn't exactly score with its gameplay mechanics; they have something browser-gamerish, even almost dilettant about them. But really, I couldn't care less. Because no game since... actually I cannot even think of any right now that ensorcelled (does that word really exist? O_o) me in such a way as this one (of course some other games à la Final Fantasy VII captivated me in very different ways). 

How does this game manage to do this? With its apparant randomness - you never know what weird creature will come up next, how you will make it react and how it will react. In the end, however, it's not just pure "let's make everything totally crazy and random cuz that's cool"-randomness which one easily sees through; no, here pretty much everything fits together in this whimsical little world and you get the feeling that there must be something in the Czech culture that inspired to something that feels so odd and magical to us non-Czechs...I dunno.

I guess one more aspect that makes this game so interesting is the simple fact that it's a world full of little animals and I for one was reminded of childhood days with adventurous atmosphere, catching little animals out of a pond and studying them and so on.

But all of this would not make it a good game if it wasn't for the wonderful graphics and sound design which also fit together perfectly. There is so much funny voice acting going on, so many eerie tunes (think Animal Collective + The Polyphonic Spree + chipmunks rubbing their butts over green grass) and the unique organic look of everything - it's just too much.

Sorry if I sound like a child pissed on by a fairy but I just totally loved playing this ^^

Of course, there are some flaws, like the simple gameplay, the shortness ( I WANT MOOOAR!), but what the heck - if you want perfectly polished games, go play EA stuff...this is one for the heart :}

I'd even put it into my list of all-time-favorite games.
However, I'm sure many wouldn't like it at all. Guess you'll just have to figure it out yourself ;)

9/10

PS: Sorry, this was long :P

2447794.review: This is a beautiful game. It is a unique point-and-click adventure. It's not about painfully difficult, unintuitive puzzles, it's about exploring a world brimming with strange creatures and plants. Sometimes just clicking on environmental items at the right time will help you advance. These simple interactions are rewarding in their own way, visually and aurally. There are also some traditional inventory puzzles, and a few simple mini-games along the way. The story is told through images, and if any of the creatures talk, it's in nonsensical gibberish. There is no text, except for in the menus.  Just get it. It's delightful. It's not long, but it's not expensive, either.

If you have played any previous Amantia games, you get the idea.  I'm pretty sure they did more shrooms this time around because this is by far their strangest game.  You play a group of little plant-inspired characters whose goal is to rid their home tree of and entity that is corrupting it.

As a point-and-click adventure game, the gameplay mostly consists of solving short (occasionally long) puzzles which will grant you items needed to continue or reveal various hideous and deformed creatures.  There is no voice acting so the story is told purely through imagery, which actually works quite well.

The game has fantastic artwork and good music.  It's fairly short but it depends on how easily you can decifer the puzzles.  Definitely a fun game if you like the point-and-click genre.

И вообще игра добрая, позитивная и дружелюбная, как и предыдущие игры разработчиков (Machinarium, Samorost). В этой игре исследуем дерево снаружи и изнутри, встречаем всякую живность (собирая своеобразную коллекцию карточек), бродя по разнообразным, наполннных жизнью, локациям, в лице сразу пяти героев "растительного" происхождения.

1627652.review:
Botanicula is a very simple point-and-click adventure game that uses minimalistic gestures, visuals, and sounds to guide the player on a tale filled with humor, playfulness, and, most of all, discovery.  Every new area holds a new creature or vegetable that manages to be both cute and mysterious.

There are very few games that can convey the simple and undiluted joy of discovering new things.  Botanicula is one of them, and does it all with zero dialogue.  Most of my first playthrough found me smiling gleefully as the five protagonists enthusiastically escaped the treacherous claws of the sinister shadow spider.

Botanicula is a short little game about a short little story that follows the example of Dr. Seuss and Shel Silverstein, and at only an hour or two of playtime, it never wears out its welcome.  It is an adorable journey that left me feeling like a child again.  There's a great, big, wonderful world out there full of adventures, and this game made me remember it.

849708.review:
A hauntingly beautiful game, with artwork that fills me with childlike delight, and music and sound effects that make me giggle with glee, the tiny world of Botanicula is sure to leave the observant player in high spirits.

A puzzle game that rewards exploring and clicking on nearly anything that stands out in the environmnt, Botanicula is a spiritual successor to Amanita's previous Samorost games.  Though this game has a considerably greater degree of player control when it comes to exploring the surroundings, most of the puzzles are still solved by trial and error and investigating your surroundings as much as much as they are solved with critical thinking.  

While this might sound tedious as first, the game often rewards interaction by the player with amusing actions from it's team of main characters and the other bizarre inhabitants of their dying home.  

It's ease of play and charming audio and visuals makes it an absolute treat of a game for children and adults alike.

1114026.review:
Botanicula, part of the Amanita collection, is a lovely little indie game. It's from the same studio that brought us Machinarium, so if you enjoyed that game, you'll like this too. 

It's the story of a group of friends who have to band together to dispatch an evil presence threatening their home.

The game is incredibly light and fun, filled with humour and an eclectic soundtrack. I completed the game in 3.4 hours, which included unlocking 47 of the 53 achievements. Afterwards, I felt compelled to go back and finish the last 6, giving a full completion time of 5.1 hours.

If you played Machinarium, you should find this easy enough. It isn't as difficult, focussing more on the unique art and animation than the indepth and complex puzzling aspects, but there are still some great puzzles to be found.

If you fancy a light, fun puzzling experience that'll occupy you for a few hours, check this out. Definitely worth it.

-Nilesy

4484310.review:
Some games aren't games so much as they are experiences.  Botanicula reminds me of the feelings of innocent discovery I had as a child when I'd see something new outdoors for the first time.    After beating it, I went back and got every achievement, because it's the kind of game that makes you want to explore, and the creativity of the team that designed it shines through in the sound effects (all done vocally), music, and creature design.  

Gameplay wise, it's the graphical progression of those old text-based Adventure games from the days of games on 5 inch floppies, minus the death by minotaur because you didn't figure something out quickly enough.  In fact, there is no way to die or fail...you just haven't figured it out the solution yet.  Overall, it's a light-hearted affair of puzzle solving that's well worth the experience.

1592546.review:
If you are a fan of Mushishi and wondered what it was like to live as a Mushi without losing the mystery and magic of their world, you will love this game. If you don't like Mushishi, best move on.

If you don't know what Mushishi is, this game delivers it in the power of showing, not telling. The music and sound effects adding to what Amanita Design is great at doing, a worldless atmosphere. The ambience that plays throughout has never felt repetitive and there are many times where you can add to it.

Where other adventure games risk losing it's charm over frustrating moments like "clicking like mad to figure out how to solve this puzzel". The world is so lively that it's fun trying everything. The little animations, the bells and songs that make the language of these little creatures and their world.

Sound and music is a big part to this atmophere. I hope you have good speakers, my audiophilic friends. I'd hate you to miss any subtleties.

2967242.review:
A piece of art and pleasure. Count 3 to 4 hours of pleasure in this point-and-click adventure in a world of fantaisies. Very refreshing, nice and original story-telling. If you liked Machinarium, you'll probably like Botanicula, although the atmosphere is very different (nature vs robots).
A must buy at a small price.

2734586.review:
Botanicula n'est pas vraiment un jeu, mais plutôt un conte intéreactif dans lequel vous dirigez cinq créatures végétales devant sauver une graine d'une créature dévoreuse de vie.

C'est l'ambiance pleine de vie, les sonorités, les couleurs chatoyantes etc qui font son charme. Le gameplay (si on peut ecore parler de gameplay) étant réduit au simple point & click, bien que musique et gameplay soient intimement liés.

L'environnement est plein d'animations, dont la plupart sont à déclencher. Différentes créatures sont aussi à découvrir, ce qui nous permet de collecter des cartes sur celles-ci (dont l'utilité semble anecdotique, mais ça reste à vérfier).

Botanicula fait parti de ces jeux indies réveillant l'enfant qui someille en vous. Le studio Amanita Design signe là encore une perle vidéoludique originale et magique.

Botanicula è la creazione di un mondo colorato e simpatico.
Dai creatori di Machinarium, Botanicula nè riprende le meccaniche, incarandosi in un cocktail di esplorazione, svago, tensione, e commedia. Alla base di un'avventura grafica c'è sempre un Detective che indaga su un caso molto particolare, invece, in Botanicula, il tema è originale e simpatico, e da vita ad un mondo a parte, capace di coinvoglere il giocatore più qui, che in qualsiasi altra piccola-grande produzione videoludica indipendente.

Voto: 9.5

Si ringrazia OMJosh per avermi consigliato questo piccolo-grande capolavoro, del genere e della storia videoludica: un titolo che rivoluzionerà il mondo dei punta e clicca.

Sponsored by Only Clan.

4334082.review:
Amanita Design never fails to impress me.
Ever since I played and fell in love in Machinarium I have been checking back at Amanita Designs website waiting for whatever they are coming up with next. 
I heard about this game and I had no idea what to expect. The trailers they released for it didn’t really show much in terms of gameplay or plot, it focused more on the kooky little characters. Which are adorable by the way!
Any who, I got this game in a bundle shortly after it came out and I jumped into it not know what to expect. I was pleasantly surprised with this game, it’s a point and click set in a wonderful and artistically done tree. And you are a small gang of various things that inhabit that tree, who have banded together to save it from evil dark life-sucking spider-like creatures!
As per usual in Amanita Design’s games the Art style is amazing; it has a very distinct look about it and really is something beautiful to look at.
The characters are lovable, and for someone who normally hates the “gibberish” voices in games, I actually thought their little noises and shouts were both fitting to the game and easy on the ears. (The crying noise that the conkers make on several occasions is just one of the best things I have ever heard, it’s so amusing to me)
It’s a strange game, but it is so unique. I enjoyed this game a lot, I played through it once and shortly after discovered it had steam achievements, so played through it again! I liked it that much!
I will always look forward to new Amanita Designs games.

Great game! 
If you like something a little unique and you like point and click games, this is something I think you will enjoy a lot.

1867563.review:
[b]Apto para veganos[/b]

El género de hongos amanita incluye tanto especies comestibles como tóxicas –al punto de ser los principales responsables de las muertes por envenenamiento con fungi–. ¡Un momento! ¡No vayan a la tapa, sí, es [IRROMPIBLES]! Les pido perdón, me fui por las ramas –sin doble sentido–. Lo cierto es que acabamos de saborear –con doble sentido– Botanicula, la última creación verde de Amanita Design, desarrolladora independiente de República Checa.

En esta nueva entrega, Amanita –la desarrolladora, se entiende– retoma la receta que tantas satisfacciones y reconocimiento le trajo: aventuras cocinadas a fuego lento en Flash, con muy poco texto y mucho de arte visual del más refinado estilo point-and-click. Su menú no es extenso, más bien gourmet: Samorost (2003, disponible gratis en su Web), Samorost 2 (2005), The Quest For The Rest (2007, también gratis), Questionaut (2008, gratis) y Machinarium (2009).

Pueden leer mi review completo del juego en el número 7 de la revista [Irrompibles].
[url=http://www.irrompibles.net/revista/6021-revista-irrompibles-07-the-walking-dead]Más información...[/url]

Новая игра от Amanita Design, сделанная в стандартном для студии высоком качестве. От "классического" игрового процесса использованного в Machinarium создатели снова вернулись к лаконичности первого Samorost, и вместе с исчезновением запутанных головоломок исчезла и встроенная помощь. Планировка уровней отличная и разнообразная, а добавленные "аркадные элементы", вопреки традиции жанра вписаны отлично и без проблем с управлением. Визуальный ряд, музыкальное и звуковое сопровождения сделаны как всегда отлично.

Портят картину только слишком топорно вставленные "пасхальные яйца", нечастое использование особых возможностей каждого из персонажей и как всегда малая продолжительность.

1699111.review: If you enjoy point-and-click puzzle/adventure games and/or other games from Amanita Designs, you need to own this game -now-. The artwork is lush, the soundtrack is enjoyable and incredibly layered, and despite no written or spoken dialogue (par for the course for Amanita games), you get an in-depth sense of character from both the protagonists and the enemies through clever animation and sound effects. Some of the puzzles can be very devious and you'll find yourself clicking -everything- in hopes of collecting another card. However, I never found that to feel tedious or boring, as the atmosphere was so intensely charming that I enjoyed every minute of gameplay.

1602141.review: I found Botanicula's whimsical take on biology absolutely enchanting. Five unlikely heroes wander through the forest attempting to banish the evil parasites, and meet many fantastical and adorable creatures along the way. Learn enough about a new creature and you will receive a collectible card. This adds a lot of replayability as it's fun to try to collect all the cards. 3602590.review:
Absolutely charming little puzzler. Gameplay is simplistic point and clickery that starts off very easy but towards the end I found myself scratching my head rather often, though there are a handful of places with unnecessary complex navigation or confounding pixel hunt, but the quirky shenanigans that follow a success are always worth it.

What really sets the game sets the game apart and makes it so memorable is it's trippy and playful looks and equally weird soundtrack consisting of onomatopoetic sounds and celebratory chimes. You won't be presented with a pretentious and self serious game here; Botanicula is celebration of imagination with it's own flavor of humor.

*On a technical side note, it was very apparent that the game was designed with touch screens in mind. While it doesn't really negatively affect the gameplay per se; I found myself thinking I should be playing this on iPad.

3585947.review:
Botanicula is a short point and click adventure game from the developers of Machinarium and Samorost 1 and 2, Amanita Design. The game lasts about six to seven hours (getting all achievements and such), all of which are amazing. Every interaction is full of life, emotion, and uniqueness - resulting in characters with more personality than ones in most AAA games. The characters and story rival those, if not exceed, of Machinarium's. Only "flaw" with the game is there are no puzzles or much challenge, and thus no real gameplay. This takes away any real replay value.

Only thing Botanicula can offer is character. Fortunately that's all you really need with this game.

Edit: I take back the AAA dig - it's unfair. This game has more personality than a lot of indie games too.

1758503.review:
Amanita Design is single-handedly bringing the Adventure Game back into style.

Their previous game, Machinarium, blew me away with its creativity, soundtrack, style and charming little story. Their Samorost series is also a unique gem of a game series. Amanita continues to create great games with Botanicula.

Botanicula is like a blend of Machinarium, Samorost, and Windowsill. Like Samorost, you don't usually control your character directly, but interact with the environment, which allows you to progress. Other times you do tell the characters where to go and what to do, which is very much like Machinarium. And although Amanita did not design it, I couldn't help but think the game reminds me of Windowsill because there are so many clickable things on the screen, and clicking them yields fun surprises.

Cute, happy, creative and unique surprises.

There aren't any serious puzzles here like in Machinarium. It's much more casual. The focus is on interaction with the environment and exploration. You won't need to take notes to figure out the puzzles. Some will require you to make leaps of logic, but in the context of this strange world, it's never an unfair leap. In fact, it's usually a funny leap.

Happiness and charm are very rare in games these days it seems. The tone of Botanicula is happy, upbeat and humorous. I especially like it when the group screams. It's funny, and the surprises they uncover along the way are just as amusing. It doesn't become dark or scary until the last level, which is a surreal trip in and of itself.

Botanicula is a work of art and a joy to play!

Yoo-hoo!

5640589.review: Another brilliant  game from Amanita Design - bright, funny, relaxing and with very warm feel to it.

1555495.review: Extremely charming, creative, and unique adventure game by the makers of Machinarium and Samarost. A slightly different take on the adventure game genre that emphasizes exploration over trial-and-error inventory item combining.

811508.review:
Get it. That's all you should really know. Get it this instant. If you love point and click adventures or if you've ever played Machinarium or Samorost, this is something you simply have to own. I rarely play games that give me a big smile on my face, and Botanicula, a short, charming adventure, managed to do it. The sounds in this game are just sooo cute. It has loveable characters, a touching story, easter eggs, superb graphics (they really are awesome, I love 2D art), everything.
There's only one downside to this game and that is that it really is too short. But then again, I can always decide to replay it, of course. Oh, and some puzzles are a bit hard to do control-wise.
Other than that; fantastic !

[Rating: 88/100]

2279156.review: After finishing this game, I wanted to run out and plant a tree.  Seriously, though, this game is absolutely beautiful.  The character design is original and adorable.  The soundtrack and sound effects -- all done by the two people who make up DVA -- are perfect, and add to the naturalistic atmosphere of the game wonderfully.  The setting itself is fantastic and imaginative, with its little secrets and delights to discover.  You cannot imagine my reaction when the giant turtle revealed itself (you know the part if you've seen it), or when the lightning bugs land on the vines in the area under the frogs and crabs (again, you'll know the part when you see it).  The game also balances humor and terror very nicely.  The dream sequences are some of the creepiest game scenes I've ever seen, and the Zlos themselves are their own lovely brand of horror.  In short, this game was worth the price I paid for it.  20/10, would play again.
